job.title: Mortgage Referral Executive  (5-day work)
job.abstract: This position provides candidate with opportunities in developing career / professional in mortgage and financial services field.
job.content:
Centaline Mortgage Broker Limited (CMB), established in 1997, is a member of The Centaline Group (中原集團).

With the aim of providing high-quality mortgage referral service for years. CMB provides courteous mortgage referral services to our clients for FREE. We are able to arrange property valuation, mortgage pre-approval and express mortgage approval service for FREE to our clients. We strive to introduce the most favorable mortgage plans to our clients as per their different needs or investment strategies.

 

Join us and be a part of our exciting growth!
 

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Handle mortgage / loan referral applications and enquiries;
  • Facilitate coordination with banking partners, customers and property agents for business acquisition opportunities;
  • Advise customers of the most suitable mortgage plans as per their needs;
  • Participate in tactical promotion activities.

 
Job Requirements:

  • DSE Graduate / F.7 or above;
  • 1 year working experience in banking or mortgage referral industry is preferred; 
  • Sales / Customer Service experience in mortgage/ loan service is preferable;
  • Self-motivated, independent and service centric;
  • Good interpersonal & communications skills;
  • Proficiency in Chinese, English and Putonghua
  • Candidates with less experience will be considered as Assistant Mortgage Referral Executive.

 

 

We offer excellent career opportunities and competitive remuneration package to the right candidates.  Please promptly send your CV with current and expected salary by clicking “APPLY".

job.title: AIGC Engineer
job.abstract: The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing large-scale language models to enhance our AI capabilities.
job.content:
We are a cutting-edge technology innovation company dedicated to exploring the endless possibilities of artificial intelligence and digital entertainment. By integrating the latest AI technology with creative content production, we are shaping a new form of future entertainment experience. Currently, we are looking for a talented AIGC Engineer specializing in digital human technology to embark on a new chapter of interactive content creation for the next generation.

Responsibilities:

  • Technical Leadership and Innovation: In-depth research and application of the latest AIGC technology, especially 2D and 3D model generation technology, to design and implement highly realistic and interactive digital humans.
  • Model Optimization and Implementation: Optimize existing 2D/3D models to enhance rendering efficiency and visual effects, ensuring smooth performance of digital humans across different platforms.
  • Cross-Disciplinary Integration: Explore new boundaries of digital humans in sound interaction and emotional expression by combining sound processing and music production technologies to enhance the realism of user experience.
  • Project Collaboration: Collaborate closely with product, design, and audio teams to drive the entire process of digital human projects from concept to finished product, ensuring timely and high-quality project completion.
  • Technical Innovation and Sharing: Stay updated on industry trends, continuously learn new technologies, regularly share research findings, and drive the continuous improvement of the team's technical capabilities.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related fields, with a solid foundation in computer graphics and artificial intelligence.
  • At least 3 years of relevant work experience, with priority given to those who have successfully participated in 2D/3D model development projects in the digital human, gaming, or film industries.
  • Proficiency in at least one mainstream 3D modeling and animation software (such as Maya, 3ds Max, Blender, etc.), familiarity with game engines like Unity or Unreal Engine.
  • Some understanding of sound processing technology, with experience in audio synthesis and sound design being a plus.
  • Familiarity with programming languages like Python, C++, and experience using deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch.
  • Excellent teamwork spirit, good communication skills, and the ability to quickly learn new technologies.

bullets: Design and optimize large language models
Degree or higher in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics
Proven experience in developing and deploying large language models

job.title: International Industry Research
job.abstract: A great opportunity to build a world-class information service and technology innovation company！
job.content:
China Mobile (Hong Kong) Innovation Research Institute Company Limited was established in 2024. It is a group-level research and development institution that undertakes three major functions: inward, outward, and international integration. The Hong Kong Innovation Institute will leverage Hong Kong's role as a bridge, strengthen the coordination among Guangdong, Hong Kong, and Macau, start from Hong Kong, strategically position itself, actively integrate into the global innovation system, promote the company's core capabilities and products to "go global," gather top global innovative talents, carry out high-quality international scientific and technological cooperation, enhance the company's international scientific and technological innovation influence, and contribute to building a world-class information service and technology innovation company.

Responsibilities:

1. Responsible for the collection, investigation, tracking, analysis and research of international technological developments such as mobile information and AI, and completed the writing and release of relevant white papers and industry research reports;
2. Responsible for obtaining relevant hot information, mining scientific and technological cooperation opportunities, technology and industry analysis and judgment in key regions such as Hong Kong, Asia-Pacific and the Belt and Road, forming relevant technology and industry insight reports, and putting forward strategic suggestions for the company's technology development;
3. Responsible for organizing and promoting international innovation cooperation projects, and promoting extensive exchanges and sharing of international cutting-edge technologies;
4. Complete other tasks assigned by leaders.

Requirements:

1. Bachelor degree or above, professional direction or working background in mobile communication, AI, cloud computing, computing chip and other fields is preferred;
2. Have a deep understanding of international cutting-edge technology and industrial development trends, master market and industry investigation and analysis methods, and have the ability to systematically formulate cooperation and expansion strategies and put forward development suggestions;
3. Skilled in external contact, communication, negotiation and other skills, with international operators, industries, cross-industry cooperation and development capabilities;
4. Fluent in English listening, speaking, reading and writing, able to communicate effectively with partners in English.

bullets: Integrate into the global innovation system
Building a world-class information service and technology innovation company

job.title: Assistant Warehouse Manager
job.abstract: We are looking for a leadership with art handling and warehousing experience and strong management and leadership capability
job.content:
The role: 

 

This role manages the art handler team of 5+ staff, responsible for warehousing, property handling, logistics planning and execution for exhibitions and auctions. This role requires strong art handling experience and strong people management skills for effective collaboration with internal stakeholders (i.e., saleroom operations, security, services operations, and specialist departments etc.) and external stakeholders (i.e., suppliers and clients), to deliver seamless logistics for warehouse operations, exhibitions and auctions. It is essential that the person taking this role has a supportive attitude and is willing to provide mentorship to the art handler team to drive performance, operation efficiency and ensure excellent client experience in warehouse and logistics operations.

 

Key responsibilities (Not limited to the following):

 

Team Management 

  • Manage and supervise the art handler team of 5+ staff, provide art handling support and supervision in the warehouse. 
  • Point of escalation for art handlers, support them to deal with difficult case and solve problem. 
  • Train and develop the team on art handling knowledge i.e., packing, framing, installation etc.
  • Prioritize health, safety and wellness in the warehouse. 
  • Foster a collaborative and positive work environment, cultivate art handler team development, set KPIs and objectives and manage individual development. 

 

Warehouse Operations:

  • Supervise the warehouses operations in the office and offsite location which is operated by our 3rd party supplier.
  • Work closely with the Inventory Team to conduct physical stock take as required.
  • Develop and implement efficient process to streamline and standardize warehouse operations, storage space organization, handling and packing standard.
  • Conduct regular review with 3rd party warehouse suppliers against KPIs, ensure they provide services up to Christie’s standard.
  • Report any damages, losses or discrepancies immediately to the Manager, responsible to investigate and conduct incident report, work closely with the Manager to debrief and resolve the case.

 

Sale and Exhibitions Logistics:

  • Appropriate manpower planning in support of installation and de-installation, timely move in and out of our gallery. 
  • Work closely with internal team and other departments, including specialists, saleroom operations, security and customer service, to support preview setups & dismantle, and property release to clients.
  • Oversee the jib operations for load-in and out of oversized artwork in our gallery. 
  • Support projects and new initiatives as assigned by the manager.

 

Qualification Requirements: 

  • Completion of tertiary education with minimum 5 years of industry and supervisory experience.
  • Strong and solid knowledge of logistics, including art handling and warehousing; luxury handling is an advantage.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; demonstrated ability to communicate with all organizational levels.
  • Abilities to multi-task, work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
  • Strong leadership skills of people management, coaching and training.
  • Effective verbal and written English and Chinese (including Mandarin).
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Offices, prior experience with ERP system is an advantage.
  • Flexibility to work overtime and weekend hours when required.

bullets: Must have management and leadership capability

paragraphs: World’s Leading Auction House

Christie’s is a name and place that speaks of extraordinary art, unparalleled service and expertise, as well as international glamour. Founded in 1766 by James Christie, Christie's has since conducted the greatest and most celebrated auctions through the centuries providing a popular showcase for the unique and the beautiful. Christie’s offers over 450 auctions annually in over 80 categories, including all areas of fine and decorative arts, jewellery, photographs, collectibles, wine, and more. Prices range from $200 to over $100 million. Christie’s, the world's leading art business, had global auction and private sales. Our sales figures were driven by an increase in new buyers across all geographies coming to the market, including from growth markets such as China and through the Internet. Christie's also has a long and successful history conducting private sales for its clients in all categories.

Christie’s has a global presence with 53 offices in 32 countries and 10 salerooms around the world including in London, New York, Paris, Geneva, Milan, Amsterdam, Dubai, Zürich, and Hong Kong. More recently, Christie’s has led in growth markets such as Russia, China, India and the Middle East, with successful sales, exhibitions and initiatives in Shanghai, Moscow, Baku, Beijing, Mumbai, Delhi, Jeddah, Abu Dhabi, Doha and Dubai.

job.title: Assistant Manager, Business Account Acquisition
job.abstract: Reporting to Senior Manager, Business Banking Acquisition, you are expected to eplore new business opportunities in SME segment
job.content:
Reporting to Senior Manager, Business Banking Acquisition, you are expected to eplore new business opportunities in SME segment to generate lending businesses and revenues for the Bank.

Responsibilities: 

  • Work towards KPI target by acquiring new SME account and CASA deposit balance.
  • Build and manage sales pipeline effectively by generating new leads from own network and working closely with branches to identify SME loan opportunities.
  • Conduct need assessment to map suitable financial products/service to meet customers’ needs and identify up-selling and cross-selling opportunities for SME and Retail Banking Business.
  • Follow through the whole loan application process, from application submission to loan drawdown.
  • Ensure KYC/CDD compliance for all new to bank and existing customers and exercise risk assessment for new customers by following all necessary procedure of KYC.
  • Prepare credit proposal and conduct regular review to ensure credit quality by following the Bank’s policy and procedures.
  • Comply with customer data protection, regulatory conduct, compliance requirements and practices as defined by internal and external requirements.
  • Achieve and maintain excellent service quality to SME Business Banking customer and handle customer enquiries in a professional way to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction

Incumbent Requirements:

  • University degree in business Management/ Finance/ Related disciplines preferred.
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in business banking, relevant experience in commercial lending or SME lending advantageous.
  • Sound knowledge in commercial credit, product and services with strong compliance mindset.
  • Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, analytical and communication skills.
  • Self-motivated, resilience, customer-centric, with good teamwork spirit.
  • Proficiency in both English and Chinese, fluency in Putonghua is an advantage.
  • Relevant insurance licensing (IIQE Paper 1, 2, 3) advantageous.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job.title: Administrative Assistant (Temporary Appointment)
job.abstract: The appointee will be required to provide administrative and operational support to the daily operation of the general office.
job.content:
DEPARTMENT OF CHINESE HISTORY AND CULTURE

Administrative Assistant (Temporary Appointment) (Ref. 241003009)

[Appointment period: twelve months] 

Duties 

The appointee will be required to: 

(a) provide administrative and operational support to the daily operation of the general office;

(b) perform counter duties and to handle enquiries and phone calls;

(c) provide support in organising seminars, workshops and promotional events;

(d) assist in handling financial matters of the Department;

(e) provide support in filing and report compilation; and

(f) perform any other duties as assigned by the Head of Department or his/her delegates. 

Qualifications

Applicants should: 

(a) have five passes in HKCEE including English Language (at least Grade C if Syllabus A; Level 2 if results are obtained from 2007 onwards), Chinese Language (Level 2 if results are obtained from 2007 onwards) and Mathematics; or a combination of results in five HKDSE subjects of Level 2 in New Senior Secondary subjects / “Attained” in Applied Learning subjects / Grade E in Other Language subjects, and the five subjects must include English Language, Chinese Language and Mathematics;

(b) have some relevant administrative experience, preferably gained from education sector;

(c) be able to communicate in both written and spoken English and Chinese, preferably with fluency in Putonghua;

(d) have good computer literacy, including MS Word, Excel and Chinese word processing; and

(e) have multi-tasking skills and good interpersonal skills.

Conditions of Service 

A highly competitive remuneration package will be offered.  

Application 

Please submit an application through PolyU’s career website (https://jobs.polyu.edu.hk/general).  Consideration of applications will commence on 17 October 2024 until the position is filled. The University’s Personal Information Collection Statement for recruitment can be found at https://www.polyu.edu.hk/hro/careers/pics_for_recruitment/.

PolyU is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, nationality, family status or physical or mental disabilities.

job.title: Designer, Publications
job.abstract: In uniting with SR, you’ll be joining a family of brand strategists, sustainability change-makers, creatives, and digital architects going places.
job.content:
The Role

An opportunity to join a well-established creative studio within a growing brand and sustainability consultancy.

The role is focused on design development for printed and digital publications, including sustainability and annual reports, taking these through to final production.

You love layout and typography design with an eye for the details. 

You understand information hierarchies and have a talent for visual information design.

You’re collaborative and reliable.

If this sounds like you, join our friendly creative team based in Central working for some of the top listed companies in Hong Kong and overseas markets.

 

Responsibilities

Working alongside the creative director and design director, and supported by a dedicated production team, your primary responsibility is the design of printed and digital reports including:

  • Development and visualisation of concepts through to layout and final production.
  • Supervision of suppliers such as illustrators, photographers, printers.
  • Attending printing press checks to ensure quality standards.
  • Assist in art direction of photography.
  • Developing SR brand assets for marketing.
  • Helping polish sales presentations for maximum impact.
  • Assisting in the development of brand identity systems and design guidelines.
  • You will also have opportunity to lead creative on projects. This requires you have the skills necessary to manage both yourself and other designers, mentoring and inspiring juniors, from beginning of the project to completion.

 

About You 

  • A recognised graphic or visual design qualification.
  • Minimum two years’ experience in a design environment.
  • Calm and patient under pressure of deadlines, you can work quickly and accurately.
  • Publications design experience, including sustainability and/or financial annual reports, printed and online.
  • Eager to learn new design tools to ‘work smart’ and focus on the key design challenges.
  • Good communication skills with fluency in English and Chinese, able to handle bi-lingual designs.
  • You have intimate working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, In Design, After Effects, Figma. Cinema 4D is a good plus.

 

What We Offer

  • Some hybrid flexibility to organize where you work.
  • A supportive, coaching culture. You grow, we grow.
  • Like-minded colleagues committed to sustainability and walking the talk.

 

Why Join Us

Headquartered in Asia for over 30 years, Sedgwick Richardson (‘SR’) is a brand and sustainability consultancy.  We work with visionary leaders and entrepreneurs across East and Southeast Asia to build brands that create value for business, society, and the environment.

We believe the adaptation and regeneration are integral to business resilience, growth, and sustainability.  Brands that are credibly contributing to a better world will prosper. 

In uniting with SR, you’ll be joining a family of brand strategists, sustainability change-makers, storytellers, creatives, and digital architects going place. 

 

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At SR, we believe an equitable and inclusive work environment—where everyone feels valued and respected—is the foundation for delivering on our purpose. We seek candidates who fit into our culture and who can expand our horizons, challenge the status quo, and innovate to create Shared Value. 

 

To Apply

If this sounds like you, please send us (join@sedgwick-richardson.com) a short email explaining why you’re ready to build belief in the future along with your résumé.

job.title: Manager, Digital Business, Partnership Distribution
job.content:
What the role is?

 

Lead Generation Platform Development

  • Design and implement a robust lead generation platform to attract potential partners and clients.
  • Utilize digital marketing tools and technologies to optimize lead generation processes.
  • Experiment with new approaches and tools to improve lead quality and conversion rates.

 

Market Analysis

  • Conduct market research to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive landscape in the life insurance market.
  • Analyze data and metrics to refine lead generation strategies and improve conversion rates.

 

Digital Marketing Strategy

  • Develop and execute digital marketing campaigns to promote partnership distribution initiatives.
  • Leverage social media, email marketing and other digital channels to reach target audiences.

 

Collaboration and Coordination

  • Work closely with sales, marketing, and IT teams to ensure alignment and support for partnership distribution goals.
  • Coordinate training and resources for partners to maximize their effectiveness in lead generation.

 

Performance Monitoring

  • Track and report on the performance of lead generation efforts, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
  • Set and monitor KPIs to measure the effectiveness of digital marketing initiatives.

 

What we look for?

 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 8 years of experience in digital marketing, partnership development, or lead generation, preferably in the insurance industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
  • Proficient in digital marketing tools and platforms, including CRM systems and social media
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels.
  • Self-motivated, results-driven, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.

 

 

Personal Information Collection Statement

 

At Chow Tai Fook Life Insurance Company Limited (“the Company”) we respect the privacy of your personal data and are committed to fully complying with the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (“the Ordinance”).

 

The personal data that we collect and/or hold (whether contained in this application form or otherwise obtained) includes your personal details, contact information, education and training details, employment details, financial details, and information on your social circumstances.

 

Provision of personal data by you is mandatory for selection purposes. Personal data collected through this application will be used by the Company to assess your suitability to assume the job duties of the position for which you have applied. The Company may not be able to process your application if you fail to provide your personal data.

 

Applicants not contacted within four weeks after the interview / test may consider their application unsuccessful. The information provided will be kept for 2 years for consideration of other suitable posts.

job.title: IPB, Citigold Relationship Manager
job.abstract: We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as IPB,Citigold Relationship Manager (Internal Job Title: Citigold Relatio...
job.content:
Shape your Career with Citi

Wealth brings together the full power of Citi to serve the entire continuum of wealth clients, from affluent to ultra-high net worth to family offices.The strategies we create help our clients maintain liquidity while maximizing yields, transact in foreign currency and across borders, and manage fluctuating expenses or cash flow. We are uniquely suited to helping our clients meet their banking needs across regions through our global network.

We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as IPB,Citigold Relationship Manager (Internal Job Title: Citigold Relationship Banker - C12) based in Hong Kong.  Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well-being to help plan for your future.  For instance:

Citi provides programs and services for your physical and mental well-being including access to telehealth options, health advocates, confidential counseling and more. Coverage varies by country.

We empower our employees to manage their financial well-being and help them plan for the future.

Citi provides access to an array of learning and development resources to help broaden and deepen your skills and knowledge as your career progresses.

In this role, you’re expected to:

Client Account Management

Review Citigold customer needs and asset allocation, pro-actively engage with the customer to validate the understanding of the needs in China & Taiwan market

Advise Citigold customers to enrich the relationships by mobilizing additional funds and sell other fee-based products/services based on the current and future customer needs.

Review product penetration for the assigned client base, identify potential Citigold customers who can be sold tailored products to enhance product penetration

Ensure coverage of all relationships through customer engagements, risk profiling and financial planning.

Organize Citigold customer events to enhance customer bonding.

Acquire new Citigold customers through converting referral leads.

Compliance, Risk & Controls

Ensure that KYC/AML and other compliance norms are strictly adhered to.

Fulfilling the clients’ necessities while providing an exceptional client experience is the expected behavior from all our employees and it will be measured by specific metrics.

Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

As a successful candidate, you’d ideally have the following skills and exposure:

Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience

2-5 years relevant experience

Ability to manage relationships both internal and external; Ability to multi-task

Mandatory certifications as required for selling financial products, i.e. HKSI Paper 1, 7 & 8 and IIQE 1, 2, 3 & 5

Working at Citi is far more than just a job. A career with us means joining a family of more than 230,000 dedicated people from around the globe. At Citi, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, give back to your community and make a real impact.

Take the next step in your career, apply for this role at Citi today

job.title: Brand Protection Officer (IP Enforcement Officer)
job.abstract: We are looking for an experienced IP Enforcement Officer to join our team.
job.content:
This role is responsible to enforce Swatch Group’s IP rights (Trademark, Design, and Copyright) mainly online, including platforms such as Marketplace, social media, e-commerce website. 

The position require offline enforcement knowledge as well (online to offline action, customs seizures). You will need to work with internal and external stockholders (Customs, Government authority, Law firm) to initiate and follow up legal actions against counterfeiting activities, IP infringement matters, and Unfair competition.

Responsibilities:

General Intellectual Property (IP) rights Enforcement / Brand Protection

  • Online monitoring of platforms such as Marketplace, social media, e-commerce website or any other digital venues regarding IP Infringements. Online Investigation on important targets ;
  • Work with external anti-counterfeits agencies or law firms to initiate and follow up on legal actions (civil, criminal, and administrative) against any kind of IP infringement ;
  • Negotiate and coordinate with the marketplaces, e-commerce platforms/ social media operators / Search engines to implement and improve measures to enforce Swatch Group's IP rights (Trademark, Design, and Copyright);
  • Being able to highlight local specificities regarding the legal framework of Intellectual Property Law and procedural rules.

Tackle Counterfeit products

  • Represent the company toward government authorities in matters related to anti-counterfeits;
  • Work with external lawyer, customs, government authorities on counterfeit related litigation.

Tackle Trademark and Design infringement issues

  • Assist HQ trademark team in important trademark and design related disputes.

Tackle Copyright issues

  • Identify and enforce Copyright rights on online platforms. Such as unauthorized use copyright pictures;

Identify Unfair Practices

  • Identification of Unfair practices (Unfair Competition Law).

Requirements:

  • Bachelor or Master Degree in Law
  • Fluent verbal and writing English, Cantonese and Mandarin
  • 3-5 years working experience in the IP enforcement and/or brand protection area at law firms, multinational companies. 
  • Good knowledge about the Hong Kong IP laws as well as the Internet technical infrastructure and communication tools (social networks, mobile apps, etc.)
  • Good analytical and observation skills
  • Positive attitude, solution oriented, and Customer care oriented
  • Autonomous, flexible, and real team player
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Professional), Excel PowerBI etc.
  • Knowledge about Internet / Information Law and Unfair competition Law is a plus
  • Knowledge in Forensic science or IT a plus
  • Previous experience in the watch industry of fashion industry is a plus

bullets: 4-6 years of working experience in the IP enforcement / brand protection area
Familiar with Hong Kong IP laws and data protection laws is an advantage
Good career progression with good exposure

job.content:
Do you think selling sexual wellness products to the public on the Internet is easy or difficult? Do you want to challenge yourself and liberate the general view on sexual wellness products, including condoms, personal lubricants, and even adult pleasure toys? A more significant challenge yet, we will work it on a global scale, working in markets including Australia, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Singapore and the UK. The successful candidate will join our team to develop and enhance our market-focused on emerging sexual wellness products.

Duties

  • Respond to customer queries promptly and accurately via chat, phone, or email regarding sexual well-being items - condoms, lubricants and pleasure toys.
  • Identify customer needs, suggest suitable products, and help with placing/tracking orders.
  • Monitor customer complaints on social media and reach out to assist.
  • Gather customer feedback and share it with our business development and marketing teams.
  • Assist in training junior Customer Support Representatives.
  • Manage Night-shift CS representatives.
  • Provide assistance in both Chinese and English for Hong Kong, Taiwan, Singapore, Australia and the UK markets.
  • Enhance existing marketing strategies and be responsible for execution.
  • Identify opportunities and collect market intelligence.
  • Instruct and conduct Sagami Workshop.
  • Perform any ad-hoc duties as required.
  • Prepare CS reports.
  • Follow up on customer enquiries and communicate with different parties.

Requirements

  • Must be a Hong Kong resident.
  • Good command of Cantonese, English and Mandarin.
  • Experience as a Customer Support Specialist or similar CS role
  • Good IT skills, eager to learn new systems.
  • Knowledge of sexual wellness products is an advantage, and willing to learn different types of products and be open-minded.
  • Able to discuss intimate matters professionally.
  • Skilled in avoiding harassment from inquiries yet maintaining a professional manner.

Our working environment

  • Small team, close relationship.
  • Staff purchase discount (https://SampsonStore.com).
  • Casual dress code.
  • Free snacks, espresso machine, regular happy hour party.
  • Work only for the result, non-commission based, we share success with a year-end performance bonus.

job.title: Airport Performance Manager (Hong Kong)
job.abstract: Ensures safety, streamlines operations, and leads a high-performing team for a best-in-class passenger service.
job.content:
Cebu Pacific puts people at the heart of service. More than transporting people or cargo, we are passionate about transforming how we can do things better and create opportunities to implement innovative solutions that will bring the airline to a world-class global experience.

 

Apply today and be JUAN of the game changers of the Philippines’ leading airline, Cebu Pacific as a Station Manager (based in Hong Kong) under our Airport Experience team. 

 

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Implement and enforce safety regulations and procedures to ensure the highest level of safety is achieved for all operations at the airport.
  • Develop and maintain effective emergency response plans, ensuring that all personnel are trained and prepared to handle emergency situations efficiently.
  • Monitor and analyze on-time performance metrics, identifying areas of improvement and implementing strategies to enhance overall punctuality.
  • Work closely with airline partners, ground handler agencies, and other stakeholders to streamline operational processes and minimize delays.
  • Recruit, train, and develop a highly skilled and motivated team of aviation professionals.
  • Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and identify training needs to ensure continuous improvement and professional growth.
  • Maintain a comprehensive understanding of IATA regulations, SGHA (Standard Ground Handling Agreement), and an SLA-KPI Management program for performance reviews.


 

Basic Qualifications

  • Must have a bachelor's degree in aviation management, Business Administration or any related field. 
  • Must have proven background in aviation operations which includes: passenger handling, ramp, and cargo operations with a minimum of five (5) years of experience.
  • Must have more than two (2) years of experience in a leadership or management role. 
  • Must have a comprehensive knowledge of aviation safety and security regulations including IATA standards and local/international aviation security protocols. 
  • Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills

job.title: Accountant
job.abstract: Assist in the completion of accounting administration tasks including month-end closing, financial reports and cash flow forecast
job.content:
Otter Products is seeking an Accountant to join our team on a 9-Month Fixed Term Contract. The Accountant will assist in the completion of accounting administration tasks including month-end closing, financial reports and cash flow forecast. 

 

This role report to Financial Controller, OPI. 

 

About Otter Products:

Otter Products, we grow to give. From our founder's garage in 1998 to the global technology leader we are today, Otter Products continues to drive growth through innovation. Through our industry-leading brands - OtterBox, Liviri and OtterCares - we provide our partners the number-one selling and most trusted products in our categories. Our philanthropic spirit is the foundation on which we foster our partner relationships, allowing us to grow and to give - together. By way of our charitable arm, the OtterCares Foundation, we support our communities and invest in our future through education that inspires kids to change the world. And even as our global community of Otters continues to grow, our founder's core values are still at the heart of everything we do. We measure our success by our ability to give back to our communities and strengthen opportunities for all.

For more information visit www.otterproducts.com.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Support the review of the financial performance of APAC.   
  • Provide financial trends and insights relating to APAC. 
  • Maintenance of Chart of Account to facilitate effective cost analysis and defining accounting policies and procedures.
  • Monitor daily accounting operations in A/R, A/P & G/L and bank reconciliation.
  • Follow up on irregularity on payments, sales invoicing and expenses.
  • Review various balance sheet accounts detail and ensure these are reconciled monthly.
  • Review intercompany reconciliation and follow up on discrepancies. 
  • Review monthly cash flow projections and provide insights to management. 
  • Perform periodic financial statements and management reports timely.
  • Responsible for month end & year end closing and reporting to manager to review.
  • Review and analyze balance sheet schedules. 
  • Maintain analysis on Sales adjustments and rebates.
  • Maintaining and upheld inventory control and valuation policy.
  • Review financial reports and tax filings of Korea and WFOE.
  • Review monthly and recurring journal entries and consolidation journals.
  • Review and enforce policy and procedures.
  • Assist management and FP&A with budget process.
  • Other ad hoc assignments or duties as required.

 

Accounting Control, Audit and taxation

 

  • Liaise with auditor on audit matters and corporate tax filings.
  • Liaise with tax service providers to maintain proper tax filings of Australia (ICT, VAT, PAYG & FBT).
  • Prepare General Purpose Financial statements client templates for Australia tax.
  • Enhance company internal control policies and participate in system enhancement.
  • Control income and expenditure and liaise with banker and financial service provider.

 

Financial Analysis 

  • Support the preparation of management reports, and financial analysis in division and business unit levels. 
  • Assist in standard price & cost function in APAC.
  • Assist Group Finance team for various finance and compliance projects.

 

Key relations and environment 

  • Work closely with other members of the Finance teams of OPI.

 

Qualifications:

  • Degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline, preferably a qualified Accountant (e.g. HKICPA, AICPA, ACCA, CMA, etc)
  • Knowledge of IFRS & US GAAP will be an advantage but not a must.
  • Minimum 2 years’ relevant experience. 
  • Good command of spoken and written English and Chinese.
  • Good business acumen and attentive to details and accuracy. 
  • Great team player, well-organized, reliable, and self-motivated with strong interpersonal communications skill.   
  • Able to handle full set of accounts independently.
  • Advanced level spreadsheet skills and proficiency in MS Office.  

 

Otter Products International is an equal opportunities employer (EEO).

All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of their race, colour, ethnic or social origin, genetic features, language, religion or belief, political or any other opinion, membership of a minority, birth, disability, age, sexual identity or any other characteristic.

 

Please apply for this role via our careers page: www.otterproducts.com/careers

leads the way to help people do more and go more places with technology in hand. We are a global company with more than 900 employees,
who collaborate globally from our offices in Fort Collins, Colo., San Diego, Calif., Hong Kong, and Cork,
Ireland to deliver the best, but like our namesake Otter, we work hard and play hard together. Our mission is simple –
We Grow to Give which comes to life by way of our charitable arm, the OtterCares Foundation. From innovation and engineering to community and culture – growing to give is
at the heart of everything we do!
OTTERBOX is the #1 selling protective phone case brand in the U.S.A. and increasingly offers an expanded product lineup in the outdoor gear category.
For more information visit www.otterproducts.com

The Otter APAC team is highly collaborative and our new office reflects this. To get a preview into what life at Otter Products is like click here: https://officesnapshots.com/2020/02/18/otter-products-offices-hong-kong/

job.title: Advancement Manager
job.abstract: The Advancement Manager plays a crucial role in cultivating and stewarding donor relationships.
job.content:
Advancement Manager 

(Reference Number: S_AM_218_JB)

 

Christian Alliance International School (CAIS), a non-profit making school wholly owned by the Kowloon Tong Church of the Chinese Christian and Missionary Alliance, invites applications for Advancement Manager.

 

Reporting to the Director of Admissions and Advancement, the Advancement Manager plays a crucial role in cultivating and stewarding donor relationships. The primary goal is to grow a vibrant culture of philanthropy within the school substantially, improve the school's fundraising performance, and significantly impact the school's future. The main responsibilities are listed below. 

 

Duties and Responsibilities: 

  • Work closely with the Director of Admissions and Advancement to develop compelling messaging for various audiences, including appeals, impact reports, annual reports, and cases for support, aligning with CAIS’s vision and mission.
  • Manage a strategic and holistic structure for the identification, cultivation, solicitation, and stewardship of individual donors (Major Gifts and Annual Funds) to support the school's vision and mission.
  • Identify and engage potential donors and stakeholders to strengthen their connections with the CAIS community and secure financial support.
  • Strengthen relationships with existing donors through organizing and executing various fundraising events (in-person visits, fundraising gala, and other cultivation events, etc.).
  • Manage and enhance the Constituent Relationship Management (CRM) system effectively and efficiently; compile analytical reports for management's review and assist in formulating future strategic directions.
  • Collaborates with the wider team to produce content, stories, social media content with donor stewardship focus that aligns with CAIS’ values.
  • Attend and support admissions and advancement events when necessary.
  • Carry out any other job duties as assigned by the Director of Admissions and Advancement.

 

Qualifications and Experience 

  • A professional who believes in the vision and mission of the school
  • Minimum 8 years solid experience in fundraising, with a record of success
  • Excellent command of both English and Chinese with exceptional bilingual writing skills is a must
  • Proven track record in developing, planning, and implementing fundraising campaigns
  • Good interpersonal skills. Ability to work with people from a broad range of background internally and externally
  • Bachelor’s degree holder in communication, marketing, or related discipline
  • Familiarity with nonprofit fundraising best practices
  • Excellent team player who values collaboration
  • High attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to produce high-quality work against a deadline
  • Competent in computer literacy (PowerPoint presentations, spreadsheets, and mail merge)
  • Proficiency in Salesforce would be an advantage
  • Candidate with an understanding of Christian values preferred

 

Application Details

Interested parties please apply with full resume stating current and expected salary by clicking “Apply Now” or by email to the Human Resources Department via our employment webpage at www.caisbv.edu.hk.

Please quote the reference number of the post in your application.

We thank applicants for their interest in the position.  Review of applications is on on-going basis until the position is filled and the School reserves the right not to fill the posts advertised.  Applicants not contacted within 12 weeks may consider their application unsuccessful.

All personal data submitted will be used for recruitment purposes only and all related information will be kept for up to 24 months.

location.label: Lai Chi Kok, Sham Shui Po District

bullets: Strengthen relationships with existing donors through fundraising events
Manage and enhance the Constituent Relationship Management (CRM) system
Produce content, stories, social media content with donor stewardship focus

job.title: Sales Executive
job.abstract: Join EcoBay Technologies as a Sales Executive to drive sales of Far-UVC disinfection solutions and promote cutting-edge hygiene technology.
job.content:
About us

EcoBay Technologies Limited is a trailblazing leader in harnessing the power of patented filtered UVC222 technology, a revolutionary breakthrough aimed at effectively neutralizing harmful bacteria and viruses. Our precision-focused approach targets the nucleic acid structure of pathogens, ensuring both immediate disinfection and long-term protection. Unlike conventional UVC systems, our Care222 technology can safely illuminate spaces occupied by both humans and animals, ensuring a seamless and secure disinfection process. Our clientele includes esteemed government bodies, major airports, luxury hotels, bustling shopping malls, and various sectors that prioritize the health and well-being of their patrons and employees. We take immense pride in the trust placed in us by our diverse range of clients, as they recognize the unmatched quality and reliability of EcoBay's solutions.

 

Qualifications & experience

 

  • University graduate, preferably with a major in biophysics, life sciences or healthcare-relateddisciplines.
  • Minimum of 2 years of work experience, preferably in the healthcare industry.
  • Familiarity with Hospital Authority (HA) tender procedures and procurement policies is a plus.
  • Strong business acumen with knowledge of key healthcare industry trends.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a professional and customer-focused approach.
  • Responsible, honest, outgoing, and able to work independently under pressure.
  • Fluency in English and Cantonese; Mandarin is a plus. Proficiency in Microsoft Office is required.
  • Candidates with less experience will be considered for an entry-level sales position.
  • Immediate availability is preferred.

 

 

 

Tasks & responsibilities

 

  • Responsible for daily sales activities to hospitals, clinics, healthcare and other commercial institutions in Hong Kong.
  • Accountable for achieving sales targets, developing new accounts, and expanding the client base in assigned territories.
  • Establish and maintain positive relationships with clients, Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs), and professionals in the healthcare industry.
  • Monitor market trends and competitor activities, providing relevant updates to management and marketing teams that could influence sales strategies.
  • Continuously update product and gerontechnology knowledge to provide on-site support and conduct product demonstrations for customers.

 

 

 

Benefits

 

  • Basic salary + commission.
  • 5 working days, bank holidays, and medical allowance.
  • EcoBay Technologies Limited offers a dynamic and collaborative work environment where innovation thrives.
  • Be part of a team that is committed to delivering excellence and making a difference.

bullets: Innovative Technology: Be part of a company at the forefront of clean tech.
Career Growth: Gain valuable experience in the growing healthcare technology.
Impactful Work: Safer environment in healthcare, education and commercial space.

job.abstract:
- designing and developing innovative mobile applications, web and in-store experience
- utilize your UX knowledge and creative thinking
job.content:
As a designer, you will be responsible for designing and developing innovative mobile applications, web and offline experiences. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the product meets user needs and provides an exceptional user experience with design thinking. You will utilize your UX knowledge and creative thinking to continuously drive product innovation.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research and understand target user needs, and develop product design solutions that meet user requirements.
  • Interaction design, user interface design and visual design for mobile applications, web and in store experience.
  • Quickly validate concepts using wireframes, prototypes, and interaction design.
  • Closely collaborate with the technical development and design team to ensure the design solutions are successfully implemented.
  • Continuously optimize the overall visual style and user experience of the product.
  • Passionate and stay up-to-date with industry design trends and continuously learn new design skills and methods.
  • Participate in cross-functional team meetings to provide innovative design recommendations for the product.
  • Creating on-brand graphic designs/ illustrations and handling offline print production of marketing collaterals

 Required Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of work experience in mobile application, web and graphic design in a fast-paced environment.
  • Familiar with interaction design, visual design, and prototyping design processes.
  • Strong user experience design mindset, able to design from users' perspective for all  online and offline touchpoints.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Innovative thinking skills to propose creative design solutions in a collaborative environment.
  • Proficient in design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma and other Adobe Creative Cloud softwares
  • Knowledge of photoshooting, video shooting, video editing
  • 5-day work week, immediate start will be advantageous

job.content:
Connaught Shipmanagement (HK) Limited

Connaught Shipmanagement (HK) Limited is a dynamic and fast-growing ship management company focusing on primarily on the dry bulk sector, with headquarters in HK and office in Copenhagen, Mambai, Shenzhen and Xiamen. Now we are managing 24 dry bulk vessels. With our expansion, we are looking for a highly integrated candidate who is open for a new and challenging job to join our growing team.

job.title: Front Office Administrator
job.abstract: Mattel is seeking a Front Office Administrator to join our Office Management Team.
job.content:
The Opportunity:

Mattel is seeking a Front Office Administrator to join our Office Management Team. 

What Your Impact Will Be:

  • Perform receptionist duties, such as answering phone calls, greeting visitors, and handling couriers.
  • Maintain a professional and welcoming environment at the front desk and in the waiting area.
  • Assist with other administrative tasks as assigned by the supervisor, such as office equipment maintenance, office supplies inventory control, company shuttle online reservation system, reporting, budgeting, payment processing etc.
  • Work closely with different internal departments, external service providers, vendors/suppliers & property management to ensure smooth operations.
  • Monitor office maintenance to foster a work environment that is eco-friendly, engaging, efficient and safe.
  • Support internal activities, events, and ad-hoc projects as needed.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to continuously learn, grow and advance their career within our organization. 

What We're Looking For:

  • High Diploma / associate degree or above with 1 to 2 years' relevant administration experience in sizable organizations. 
  • Strong sense of responsibility, reliable, detail-minded, meticulous and committed to delivering quality results. Pleasant and willing to learn.
  • Organized, analytical, able to handle multi-tasks and prioritize works.
  • Good interpersonal skills and supervisory skills, a team player.
  • Fluent in English, Cantonese, and Mandarin, both spoken and written.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Proficient in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Chinese Word Processing.

Who Should Join Us:

We are not only looking for the right experience and skill set, but also for attitude, potential & cultural fit.

If you are creative, energetic, passionate with a growth mindset and devoted to developing your future career in the world’s leading toy company, you are welcome to be a part of our team and we will play & grow together! 

What We Offer:

As a caring company, we are committed to providing engaging and work-life balance environment, competitive remuneration, comprehensive fringe benefits, and progressive career opportunities to our people.   

Our benefits include:

  • 5-day work week
  • 13th Month Salary and Performance Bonus
  • Annual Leave and Company Holidays
  • Group Medical, Dental and Life Insurance
  • MPF/ Mattel Retirement Scheme (ORSO Scheme)
  • Training Sponsorship & Education Subsidy
  • Comprehensive Wellness Programs 

How To Apply: 

Interested parties please click “Apply Now” to send your full resume (in Microsoft Word or PDF format), current and expected salary to us for review.

Applicants not invited for interview within 6 weeks may assume their application unsuccessful. All information will be treated in strictest confidence and used solely for recruitment purpose.

job.title: Head of Manufacturing (Food)
job.abstract: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Head of Manufacturing to join our team.
job.content:
About the Client:

My client specializes in delivering high-quality gourmet food products that delight consumers worldwide. The company is seeking a dynamic and experienced Head of Manufacturing to join the team. This newly created role will be instrumental in enhancing manufacturing operational efficiency and driving transformative initiatives within our factory operations and workflows. The successful candidate will blend hands-on leadership with strategic vision to optimize the production processes in alignment with the group commitment to quality and excellence in the food industry.

About your role:

  • Led cross-functional teams, including R&D, quality assurance, and supply chain, to ensure alignment and optimize production schedules.
  • Lead efforts to improve manufacturing efficiency, reduce waste, and enhance product quality through the implementation of best practices and innovative solutions.
  • Analyze existing workflows and manufacturing processes; develop and execute strategies for process improvement and automation.
  • Manage and mentor the manufacturing team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, safety, and performance excellence.
  • Oversee manufacturing budgets and resource allocation, ensuring cost-effective operations while maintaining high standards.
  • Ensure all manufacturing operations comply with industry regulations, safety standards, and company policies.
  • Establish and monitor KPIs to assess manufacturing performance and drive accountability.

Qualifcation:

  • Bachelor's degree in Food Science, Food Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 15 years of experience in food manufacturing or food processing operations, with a proven track record of managing teams and driving operational improvements.
  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to motivate and develop a diverse team.
  • In-depth understanding of manufacturing processes, quality control, and lean manufacturing principles.
  • Ability to think strategically while maintaining a hands-on approach to problem-solving and operations management.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization.

Click "Apply Now" to apply for this position or call Jason Li at +852 3180 4962 for a confidential discussion. All information collected will be kept in strict confidence and will be used for recruitment purpose only.

job.title: Senior Executive Assistant (Managerial Grade)
job.abstract: Provide a full spectrum of strategic, administrative and archival support to both the Owners and Family Council
job.content:
Established in 2002, the Lee Kum Kee Family Office serves a business-owning family of six generations. The Family Office manages, preserves, and sustains the family in governance, wealth management, and communication. We offer exclusive services and add values to the family in alignment of interest, effective information flow, continuous family learning and development, and risk management. 
 

 

Main Responsibilities 

  • Providing a full spectrum of administrative and secretarial support to the Senior Manager of Stewardship and Governance Team and the Head of Family Office (as needed) to achieve the Owners and Family Council’s goals and objectives of developing the best practices in governance and strengthening the communications with the Family and Owners Assembly
  • Supporting the Senior Manager to develop the strategies and action plans to optimize the goals of the Owners and Family Council
  • Supporting the Owners and Family Council in facilitating effective communication through content creation and review of workflows and guidelines e.g., drafting newsletters, updates and announcements
  • Preparing presentations and meeting materials and minutes-taking in all Owners Council, Family Council and other related meetings
  • Supporting family archives initiatives in achieving the Family Archives mission
  • Facilitating family/owners assembly learning and bonding activities, in its program planning and implementation, and sourcing, screening and arranging learning and development programs and activities
  • Monitoring project progress to ensure expected deliverables are met
  • Coordinating meetings/events/activities as required
  • Assisting Senior Manager to prepare the stewardship and governance annual budget, and monitoring expenditures
  • Conducting research, analysis, and preparing reports as required
  • Performing/Leading ad-hoc projects/tasks as assigned

 

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related discipline
  • Minimum 10 years relevant experience in supporting Senior Management
  • Experience in working in family office will be an advantage
  • Proven administrative or executive assistant experience will be an advantage
  • Good communication, interpersonal, facilitation and presentation skills
  • High level of integrity with confidentiality mindset and maturity in handling highly sensitive information
  • Service-minded with a can-do attitude and able to proactively anticipate others needs
  • A great team player with a strong sense of responsibility, flexibility, able to prioritise and work independently
  • Strong problem solving skills, highly attentive to details, and project management skills
  • Receptive to feedback, willing to continually learn and improve
  • A provable level of interest and creativity to adapt to new technology at work
  • IT literacy including MS Office and Mac Applications
  • Thorough knowledge of Google apps and other cloud-based softwares
  • High proficiency in both written and spoken English, Cantonese, and Putonghua

 

How to apply: 
This is an opportunity for you to do something unique, to grow, to learn, and to make a difference. Get a chance to thrive in an environment that values your growth and respects your abilities. Interested in joining this professional journey with us? Submit your resume via the jobsdb link.
 

 

All applications received will be used exclusively for recruitment purposes only. Applicants who are not contacted within 4 weeks should consider their application unsuccessful for the position advertised. Data supplied by applicants will be kept for 12 months.

We are a dedicated professional English Language Centre in Taikoo, providing quality language education to children ages 3-17 by arousing their interests in reading, enhancing their understanding in English and developing their skills in mastering the language with initiatives and procedures.  We are looking for energetic and responsible individuals to join our team. 

 

Job Description

  • Delivering 1-1 and small group English lessons to kindergarten, primary and secondary students;
  • Preparing lesson plans for various English courses, Phonics, Reading, Writing, Grammar, Speech, according to student's needs;
  • communicate with parents regularly about students performance, progress and needs;
  • Carrying administrative duties to help daily operation;

Requirements

  • Highly proficient in English is a must, including speaking, reading and writing;
  • A degree holder with a recognized English-related major or certificate is preferred;
  • Fresh graduates  and experienced teachers are also welcomed;
  • Love children, passionate in teaching. Responsible, creative, self-motivated, and enthusiastic collaborator is an advantage.

Benefits

  • Simple friendly environment with supportive colleagues
  • Training and material resources
  • Bank holidays

 Interested parties please send full resume with expected salary and availability to the Centre Manager

job.title: Senior / Education Counsellor (5-day)
job.abstract: Elite is a leading education consultancy with a decade of experience helping our students achieve their dreams. With offices in Hong Kong...
job.content:
Elite is a leading education consultancy with a decade of experience helping our students achieve their dreams. With offices in Hong Kong, Shenzhen and the USA we are dedicated to ensuring our client achieve their ambitions.

Reporting to our Head of Counselling this vital role will build and maintain a portfolio of clients helping with applications to international universities and schools. You will be responsible for day to day communication with parents and students and ensuring that our high standards are maintained.

Job Responsibilities

  • Guide and provide assistance to students and families, and advise them on a full range of international experience options for the students.
  • Manage students' portfolios, build and maintain positive and professional client relationships throughout the whole application process
  • Communicate and meet with schools/colleges representatives to follow up with students' application
  • Engage, daily, with parents and students to ensure client expectations are met and that your cases are progressing.
  • Cooperate with our teaching team, working particularly closely with our academy leadership to ensure students are prepared for entrance examinations and required tests.
  • Assist in external seminars, participate in exhibitions and deliver presentations

Key Requirements

  • Overseas university graduate (from USA, UK, Australia or Canada) is a must
  • At least 1 year of relevant experience. 
  • Good understanding of the overseas education system
  • Sensitive towards students’ needs and able to build up good relationship with clients
  • Fluency in English, Cantonese and Mandarin
  • Self-motivated, Self-directed, responsible, service-oriented and hard-working
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proficient in computer software applications including MS Word, Excel and Chinese Word Processing
  • Five day work week (Monday – Friday)

  What We Offer

  • 5-day work week and a friendly work environment
  • Prime working location in the heart of Hong Kong
  • Basic salary and commission
  • Bank Holiday
  • Medical Insurance

job.title: IBDP Physics Tutor (Full Time & Part Time)
job.abstract:
IBDP Physics Tutor 
We are looking for qualified and driven tutors to join our team of educators.
job.content:
IBDP Physics Tutor (Full Time & Part Time)

We are looking for qualified and driven tutors to join our team of educators. We are looking for ambitious tutors who will provide our students with the academic training and real-life skills that are needed in the modern world. Those who commit to our team will get the opportunity to oversee the development of the next generation at a critical stage of their lives. We take this responsibility very seriously.

Job Description:

  • Preparing and teaching interactive lessons focused on allowing students to build a solid foundation within the topics specified in the IB, A Level & IGCSE Curriculums
  • Using a variety of effective techniques to allow the student to conceptualize topics and to enhance their learning such as preparing A* vs B/C sample responses and breaking down why one response will be marked higher than the others
  • Building great student/teacher relationships and being a helpful team member within the team
  • Using a variety of effective techniques to allow students to build up their exam-taking skills using past paper exams
  • Using the Socratic approach to ensure students are engaged and are learning effectively within the lessons
  • Assisting in the creation of proprietary course/teaching material to be used exclusively at All Round Education Academy
  • Assisting in analyzing past paper trends in order to forecast potential pitfalls students may face in achieving top grades
  • Providing clear and constructive feedback to students and parents

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree with a minimum 3.0 GPA
  • Excellent Academic background
  • Teaching experience in IB/GCSE/A-Level with a proven record of score improvements among past students is a plus
  • Passionate in teaching students, patient and creative
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Fresh graduates with impressive academic backgrounds will also be considered
  • High achieving undergraduate and/or postgraduate candidates who are still at university are also encouraged to apply in a part-time setting

Benefits:
 

  • Competitive base salary
  • Attractive bonus scheme and annual leave for Full Time tutors
  • Medical insurance provided for Full Time tutors
  • Training and development opportunities 
  • Wellness program for Top performers
  • Career development and progression

Locations:

Tsim Sha Tsui Campus

Central Campus

Online

Home Tutoring

 

Website:

www.allround-edu.com
 

Company Overview

All Round Education Academy specializes in academic tutoring for students following international curricula (including IB, GCE, IGCSE, AP), standardized test preparation (ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL), admissions consulting as well as programs specifically designed for young learners.

We value candidates who exhibit the following attributes:

  • Commitment: We are seeking individuals who can commit to joining our team until the end of the Academic year.
  • Location Flexibility: The ability to work at both of our locations is a key requirement for this role.

Job Types: Part-time, Full-time

Salary: $18,000.00 - $35,000.00 per month

job.title: Senior Officer - Administration
job.abstract: Perform general office administrative & soft services duties
job.content:
Company description:

Hang Lung Properties Limited, a constituent stock of the Hang Seng Index and Hang Seng Corporate Sustainability Indices in Hong Kong, is a leading real estate developer in Hong Kong and mainland China. Boasting a diversified portfolio of investment properties in Hong Kong, we have progressively branched out into the Mainland since the 1990s, building, owning and managing world-class commercial complexes in key cities that have earned international acclaim for their exceptional quality of architectural design, services and sustainable features.

Our people are the most precious asset of the Hang Lung family and the key to our success. They drive forward our development through their commitment, professionalism and caring services. As we extend our business horizons, we continue to devote significant resources and energy to developing the expertise and skills of our outstanding team.

We are looking for people who are talented, energetic, self-motivated team players. Are you ready to join us now?



Job description:

Responsibilities

  • Perform general office administrative & soft services duties
  • Work closely with different internal departments, pursue timely and effective communication
  • Handle invoice payments, update payment records and maintain proper filing system
  • Liaise with service providers/suppliers, price quotation, perform cost and service standard analysis and make recommendation
  • Assist in coordination and operation of regular company event and meeting, including mover arrangement, venue set up, secondment coordination as well as onsite support
  • Backfill receptionist during lunch hour & when needed
  • Monitor office cleaning / maintenance work (occasionally work during non-office hours)
  • Assist in Group Administration projects (e.g., renovation, category planning) & Procurement
  • Assist implementing of Group Administration procedures to ensure the efficiency of company operations (i.e., process, reporting, and functional standard consistency)
  • Support office sustainability implementation including Wellness and Green initiatives such as sourcing, generate reports, prepare posters / slides
  • Assist on Intranet content management include but not limited to prepare draft and update in timely manner
  • Manage inventory and delivery schedule, support stocktake regularly
  • Handle local procurement of ad-hoc office appliances, equipment & sundries
  • Manage vendor performance and service reporting
  • Perform ad hoc duties assigned by the management team
  • Able to anticipate unexpected guest needs and react promptly and tactfully
  • Willing to work in flexi working hours occasionally to support company events / monitor vendors' service

Requirements

  • Diploma holder or above
  • 3-5 years or above relevant working experience in sizable company (Candidate with less experience will be considered as Officer)
  • Experience in hospitality industry, event supporting and outsourcing vendor management will be a definite advantage
  • Able to adapt changing needs, able to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines
  • Good customer service, communications, and interpersonal skills with pleasant personality
  • Embracing our values of integrity, sustainability, excellence and openness
  • Good planning skill, well-organized with strong numerical sense and business acumen
  • Good command of written and spoken English and Chinese (including Mandarin)
  • Proficiency in MS Office and Chinese Word Processing
  • Work Location: Mong Kok & Central

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. We offer an attractive remuneration package and excellent prospects for career advancement to the right candidate. Please send detailed resume to Human Resources Department by clicking "Easy Apply" button. For more information about our Company, please visit our website: http://www.hanglung.com/ Please read the following Personal Information Collection Statement before applying.

Personal Information Collection Statement of Hang Lung Properties Limited

"Personal Data" in this statement has the same meaning as "personal data" in the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Chapter 486 of the Laws of Hong Kong) ("PDPO"). Personal Data collected by Hang Lung Properties Limited and/or its associated companies (the "Hang Lung Group") will be treated in strict confidence and be used exclusively for recruitment and other employment-related purposes and will be disclosed or transferred to the responsible person(s) concerned with applicants' applications. The provision of true, complete, accurate and up-to-date Personal Data required in support of applications is necessary for selection purposes. Failure to do so may affect the processing and outcome of applications. Personal Data provided by successful candidates will be retained as part of Hang Lung Group's employee records for employment and benefit-related purposes. Applicants who do not hear from Hang Lung Group within 8 weeks from the date of application may consider their applications unsuccessful and their Personal Data will be deleted or destroyed within 12 months from the date of application. Applicants have the right to request access to and/or correction of their Personal Data in accordance with the provisions of the PDPO. Any such request for access to and/or correction of Personal Data should be in writing, made in accordance with the PDPO and sent to the Data Protection Officer of Hang Lung Properties Limited at (if by post) 28/F, Standard Chartered Bank Building, 4 Des Voeux Road Central, Hong Kong or at (if by email) privacyofficer@hanglung.com.

For further information, please refer to Hang Lung Properties Limited's Privacy Statement at https://www.hanglung.com/en-us/special-pages/privacy-policy-statement.

job.title: Associate Technical Support Manager
job.abstract: Leads support teams, handles installations, resolves tech issues, and ensures effective solutions for clients in a flexible, dynamic work setting
job.content:
Responsibilities

  • Lead and assist the technical support team in providing efficient IT and hardware/software troubleshooting support.
  • Oversee the installation, maintenance, and upgrade of hardware and software at client locations, ensuring quality service.
  • Address client inquiries regarding IT and POS solutions, acting as a liaison between the technical team and customers.
  • Collaborate with other departments to ensure that technical solutions align with customer needs and business objectives.
  • Utilize internal systems to log inquiries, track resolutions, and execute remote support tasks.
  • Occasionally perform hands-on technical support and system installations, involving minor physical work.

Qualifications

  • Minimum 2 years of technical support experience, with some team management or leadership exposure preferred.
  • Strong communication skills in Cantonese (spoken), with basic proficiency in Mandarin and English.
  • Proficiency in reading and writing Chinese and English, and using input methods.
  • In-depth knowledge of TCP/IP protocols and basic IT network configurations.
  • Strong skills in both software and hardware support for Android and iOS platforms.
  • Experience working with POS systems or IT solutions in a retail or hospitality environment is a plus.

 

About the Role
You will take the lead in providing Hong Kong's restaurants with the tools and tech solutions they need to thrive. As the Associate Technical Support Manager, you'll guide the team to ensure seamless installation and continuous support for our merchants, while managing both on-site and remote technical operations. Your expertise will empower our merchants with the right solutions to optimize their operations.

 

Why Join Us?
We are a diverse workplace that builds our ethos upon the pillars of trust and responsibility. We fully believe in the merit of each person we bring on board and reward our team with a work environment that promotes autonomy. What does this mean? We say ‘no’ to punch-in cards and ‘yes’ to flexible hours. Enjoy the journey and love the process - just make sure you get your work done on time!

Find out more about us at: www.eats365pos.com/hk/en

job.title: Wealth Strategist /Management Trainee, Financial Advisor /Intern
job.abstract: CYN Branch深明各有獨特之處的個體，能成就更優秀的整體。因此，我們樂見團隊中有來自不同文化背景的成員。在這裡你將擁有更高的收入，更彈性的時間，更多發展和學習的機會。無論你是來自不同的行業，還是剛投身社會，只要願意接受挑戰，我們將全力助你以您獨特的方式創造改變。
job.content:
Key Responsibilities

  • Conducts Fundamental Analysis to Help Develop Advice and Guidance on Financial Planning Strategies
  • Keeps Up to the Market and Regulations to Remain Knowledgeable on Industry Standards
  • Applies Previous Experiences to Add Value to a Growing Sector of Insurance Advisor Services
  • Gains Exposure to Every Facet of Wealth Management, Liquidity Management and  Relationship Management
  • Learns Team Management and Sales Management through Utilizing the Full Capabilities of the Company
  • Displays Creativity in Formulating Integrated Risk Investment Solutions through the Use of a Wide Range of Products and Services
Boost Your Career and Income with AIA

(Full Time)
  • Diversified Environment, Flexible Working Hours
  • Exceptional Income Potential, One-of-a-kind Financing Scheme
  • Comprehensive Medical Coverage, Insurance & Retirement Plans
  • Best In-Class Training Delivered by Industry Leading Tools
  • Benefit from Exclusive Recognition, Privilege & Rewards
  • Accelerate Career Growth within a Short Span of Time
(Internship)
  • An Guaranteed Official Internship Certificate
  • Customized Training and Flexible Internship Schedule
  • At Least Two Business Licenses throughout the Internship
  • Chance for Receiving Return Offer to Unlock Full Benefits
  • Various Milestones to Receive Extra Bonus
About AIA

  1. AIA的今日成就可追溯至1919年於上海的發源地，屹立亞洲逾100年。為最大的泛亞地區獨立上市人壽保險集團。1931年在香港開展業務，至今覆蓋亞洲18個市場。
  2. 我們屢獲殊榮，深得業界認同，傲視同儕。改善上億人的生活，人壽保險業界的卓越標準。
  3. AIA作為香港聯交所最大上市公司，自2010年上市後，市值升逾四倍，總資產值達 3,400億美元，為恆生指數第二大成分股。
About Challenge District

  1. 「精英團隊，執行細節，追求卓越」是AIA "Challenge Family" 核心營運理念。
  2. "Challenge Family" 精英輩出，依靠高標準的人才選拔，眾成員學歷皆為學士以上；配合最專業的培訓，卓越的配套支援，區域不斷栽培出更多獨當一面的管理人才。
  3. 「挑戰家族」獲獎記錄首屈一指。連續12年取得行業最高榮譽「最高百萬圓桌會會員比例、最多百萬圓桌會會員人數的區域大獎」。業界唯一四度摘得「超級傑出區域」第一名的殊榮。
About the Leader

Cynthia CHAN，Senior District Manager，香港金融財富管理Professional Training Instructor、香港中文大學高级工商管理硕士。自06年將管理哲學帶入團隊，連續二十載橫掃各大獎項。2021年更獲得香港最傑出資深經理排名第一。

Cynthia致力培育新一代優秀人才，團隊成員皆為「年輕有為」的學士及碩士，並相繼取得MDRT、COT及TOT的榮譽。除剛畢業的大學生，團隊有具備金融、經濟學、市場學、法律等不同背景的優才為客戶提供最專業的服務。而作為業界的領跑者，Cynthia為成員提供度身定造的專業培訓、自主的工作模式，注重實踐及反饋，令新人能快速掌握行業知識及溝通技巧。發揚因材施教的團隊文化，CYN Branch將助你在事業上快速起步，成為卓越管理者，實現「財富自由」的目標。


Reasons for Running your Wealth Management Business

  • 我們的人員比銀行、證券等金融從業者擁有更靈活的時間和空間。自由建立團隊，發展終身事業，成為行業企業家。
  • 不單助您發展事業，我們希望照顧您工作和生活的平衡。我們為員工提供一系列的活動及措施，助您在思維、情緒、規劃上都各得其所。
  • 我們正建立可持續發展的將來。據數據顯示，未來10年間香港及內地將迎最大退休潮。透過多年來完備的保障及財富管理方案，我們已為上億人的生活帶來積極影響。
  • 2019年起，政府實施多項市場政策以支持行業。2020年更推動服務中心在大灣區設立。隨著疫情迎來轉折點，面對龐大且不斷增長的市場，空前的機遇已經出現。
想要創造改變，實現財務自由，選擇平台很重要。通關契機下，香港四大產業之一的金融保險業再度興起。依靠友邦雄厚的實力和卓越的亞洲資源，現在就是你“低成本創業”的絕佳機會。

Begin the career of your dreams now
