job.abstract:
Are you looking for a career at one of the world’s largest research organizations?
Due to the rapid growth of the business, we are looking for...
job.content:
Are you looking for a career at one of the world’s largest research organizations?

Due to the rapid growth of the business, we are looking for executive support to work on exciting market research programs. We are also keen to groom the next generation of market researchers to cope with the transformation of our industry.

Working with us will provide you opportunities to be exposed to a wide range of industries, interesting and innovative tools and platforms as well as insightful analytical frameworks.

If you consider yourself agile, bold, collaborative, determined and entrepreneurial, come to join us!


Role Objective / Purpose

The role of Research Assistant is to provide support to the research team member. 

 

Role & Responsibilities:
 

  • Conduct desk research to maintain an accurate, complete, up-to-date and insightful understanding on research subjects and clients
  • Assist senior staff in proposal preparation, fieldwork coordination, analysis and report writing
  • Undertake administrative tasks to support research staff on research project execution

 

Person specification

 Qualification：

  • Bachelors' or Master’s degree major in Business / Humanities / Social Science a plus
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English and Cantonese, Mandarin a plus
  • Able to handle stress and work independently under time pressure
  • Good analytical thinking, good business sense a plus
  • Good interpersonal skills, be open minded, empathetic, energetic and articulate
  • Ideally a self-starter with good time management; detailed oriented a strong plus

 

Requirements：

  • Good analytical skill
  • Sensitive to numbers and enjoy working on reports with numbers
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication skills
  • At least 15 hours+ per week
     

Work Location: Whampoa

Please write down your availability in CV.

 

Interested parties please send resume to mail to us (with your available working timeslots is a MUST). All information collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. The Company may retain applications for future opening or other appropriate positions within the Company. Resumes received will be destroyed within 12 months.

job.content:
About The Mills & The Mills Fabrica 

The Mills Fabrica is a collaborative platform for accelerating sustainability-focused tech innovations in the techstyle and agrifood sectors. Its venture capital fund, business incubator, impact retail store Fabrica X, and spaces across Hong Kong and London support innovations from different growth stages. 

Grown out of Hong Kong’s Nan Fung Group’s textile legacy, The Mills Fabrica, through its capital, connections, and expertise, is on a mission to bring together innovators, entrepreneurs, and corporates to create positive environmental and social impact for generations.


About The Role 

  • Assist in administrative operations, data entry and filing
  • Coordinate conference room reservations and set up. Ensure the office area is organized and presentable
  • Distribute mails and arrange courier for office, manage office supplies and inventory
  • Answer and screen incoming calls professionally to provide information about memberships and events etc.
  • Greeting visitors/clients in a professional manner
  • Arrange maintenance works for office equipment and assist in ordering office supplies
  • To assist with the events set up logistics, and manage client’s expectations
  • Act as a concierge to our members
  • Conduct center tour
  • Build and create a collaborative community through events and relationships between members
  • Solve member-related issues to help foster a collaborative community
  • Assist in ad hoc assignments as required

 

Requirements of Role

  • Diploma or above in related disciplines
  • With relevant work experience in performing administration duties is an advantage
  • Details-minded, good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Good command of written and spoken English, Cantonese and Mandarin
  • Fresh graduate will also be considered

 

We provide market-competitive packages and fringe benefits to our staff to ensure they are well-rewarded to excel in their career. ​

Don't hesitate. Please apply NOW!​

We are an equal opportunity employer. All applications will be treated in strict confidence and only be used for selection purpose. For further information about Personal Information Collection Statement (“PICS”) Pertaining to Recruitment, please click the link below http://www.nanfung.com/en/common/pics.

“Nan Fung Group” and “the Group” mean Nan Fung Group Holdings Limited and its subsidiaries.

paragraphs: Nan Fung Group was founded in 1954 and has a track record spanning over 50 years with over 165 projects including residential, commercial and industrial buildings. The Group also strategically focuses on first-tier cities in Mainland China and recognises attractive opportunities for development and investment overseas, including New York and London.​

At Nan Fung, we believe that our people are the foundation of our success. When you join us, you will become part of a tightly-knitted workplace that elevates lives through innovation and sustainable projects. We work as a team and will help you build a meaningful career. ​

job.content:
Rosewood Hong Kong celebrates a culture in which Rosewood Associates are inspired to look at life a little differently, through a lens of limitless possibilities. We aim to create an innovative culture of intimate and casual, yet refined, hospitality, empowering Rosewood Associates to create indelible memories for themselves, for one other and for our guests.

The vertical estate on the majestic harbour, Rosewood Hong Kong is seeking intuitive, engaging and impassioned Associates to embark on a Rosewood Journey with us. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Play a pivotal role in evolving Rosewood Hong Kong’s brand identity through content strategy, ideation, and execution
  • Collaborate across marketing functions and business units to ensure the delivery of the highest-quality content that aligns with the brand's identity and business objectives

  • Support the content needs of other business units, including F&B, Wellness, and Mainland China channels

REQUIREMENTS

job.title: Senior Software Engineer/ Software Engineer
job.abstract:
Job Description
This role is exceptionally challenging because it requires both technical knowledge of electronics manufacturing and the...
job.content:
Job Description

This role is exceptionally challenging because it requires both technical knowledge of electronics manufacturing and the ability to communicate empathetically with internal and external parties. 
 


Job Responsibilities:
 

  • Responsible for full software development life cycle for embedded products.
  • Develop technical documents to identify requirements and solutions.
  • Design well-structured, traceable, and testable code.
  • Document and maintain software functionalities.
  • Enhance, debug, and upgrade existing products.
  • Perform R&D for state of art technology in IoT.

 

Job Requirements: 

 

  •          A proactive, collaborative team player
  •          Bachelor’s degree in electronic engineering, computer engineering, computer science or related disciplines
  •          Good command of English and Mandarin.
  •          Knowledge in electronics circuit and 16/32bit MCU and SoC application.
  •          Familiar with embedded C. Knowledge of C++, RTOS based design is a plus.
  •          Hands-on experience for below technical area:
    •  driver development in common wired interface e.g. UART, SPI, I2C.
    •  network protocols (e.g. TCP/IP, MQTT) and modern wireless standard (e.g. Wi-Fi, BLE, Zigbee, LoRa).
    •  GUI display engine and UX development.
    •  Scripting tools such as Python or batch.
  •          Some knowledge on cloud / app development is a plus but not essential.
  •          Fresh graduates will be considered as software engineer with training support.
  •          Candidate with more experience will be considered as senior software engineer.
  •           At least 2-3 years of relevant experience.

We place much emphasis on the career development of our employees, respect the worthiness of individual contributions and expect strong commitment to performance excellence. We offer 5 days work per week, competitive remuneration package and fringe benefits including year-end and mid-year bonuses, medical scheme, life & accident insurance etc to the right candidate.
 


Interested parties please send full resume stating current salary, expected salary and availability via JobsDB apply now.

All information received will strictly be kept confidential and be used for employment-related purposes only.

bullets: IoT software design, implementation and testing
Knowledge of electronics, MCU and RF Protocol
5 days' work/week, mid-year bonus & double pay

Also, you will be involved into frontline operation, leadership training and all-rounded on-the-job training.  

Candidate who successfully completed 18-month program with outstanding performance will have the opportunity to promote to an Assistant Store Manager OR Store Manager (annual income up to HK$449,500).

job.title: Senior Accountant (Korean Speaking)
job.abstract: We are looking for an experienced and adaptable Korean speaking Senior Accountant with 6-8 years of relevant accounting experience.
job.content:
[Company Introduction]

Dream Maker Entertainment Limited is a leading Live Entertainment Company specializing in concert planning and production across Asia. Headquartered in Harbour City, Tsim Sha Tsui—a major shopping and transport hub—we are a subsidiary of SM Entertainment and Kakao Corporation. With a history of organizing and executing around 200 performances worldwide, including Hong Kong, our company has partnered with numerous collaborators across over 30 countries to bring exceptional live performances to audiences.

We are actively seeking talented and passionate individuals to join our team and help us continue delivering unforgettable experiences.

 

[Company Culture]
At Dream Maker Entertainment Hong Kong, we foster a collaborative and dynamic work environment that values creativity, teamwork, and dedication. We believe in investing in our employees' growth and offer career development opportunities to help them thrive. Join us to be part of an energetic team that brings the excitement of K-pop to fans worldwide.

For more information, visit our website at www.dreammakerlive.com or contact us directly.

 

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced and adaptable Senior Accountant with 6-8 years of relevant accounting experience. The successful candidate will play a key role in our Finance team while also supporting administrative, company secretarial, and HR tasks. The position requires someone who is flexible, open-minded, and willing to handle diverse responsibilities in a small office environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead a small team
  • Oversee daily accounting operations, including general ledger maintenance, accounts payable/receivable, and payroll processing.
  • Prepare and review monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in compliance with GAAP.
  • Conduct account reconciliations and variance analyses.
  • Support budgeting and forecasting processes, and track budget vs. actual performance.
  • Assist in preparing tax returns and liaise with external auditors.
  • Ensure compliance with internal controls and accounting policies.

Our company is a small office, so there may be some additional responsibilities beyond accounting.

  • Assist in managing HR functions, including recruitment, onboarding, employee records, and payroll coordination
  • Support employee benefits administration, leave management, and performance appraisal processes
  • Provide administrative support, including managing office supplies, handling correspondence, and scheduling appointments
  • Assist in the preparation and filing of statutory documents, such as annual returns, resolutions, and minutes of meetings
  • Maintain corporate records and ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements
  • Coordinate board and shareholders' meetings, including the preparation of agendas and meeting materials
  • Liaise with external stakeholders, such as regulatory authorities and legal counsel

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related fields
  • 6~8 years of relevant experience in accounting
  • Proficiency in ERP systems (experience with Douzone is a plus).
  • Experience in company secretarial, HR, or administrative roles is an advantage
  • Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, and relevant laws and regulations
  • Familiarity with company secretarial duties and corporate governance requirements is an advantage
  • Basic understanding of HR practices and principles
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills in English, Chinese, and Korean are required, with proficiency in Korean being a must
  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in financial and administrative tasks
  • Hardworking, meticulous, and able to work well under pressure to meet tight reporting deadlines
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive attitude and the ability to work independently
  • Professional certification (e.g., CPA, company secretary qualification) is a plus
  • Immediate available is preferred

Benefit:

  • Five-day work week with flexible working hours
  • Paid annual leave and paid sick leave
  • Gift Cards on Birthday, Lunar New Year, and Mid-Autumn Festival
  • Discretionary Bonus
  • Medical Insurance

job.title: Systems Specialist in the School of Computing and Data Science
job.abstract: Website setup and maintenance, including web content updates System administration of computer servers,Administration of firewalls, routers, and netwo
job.content:
Systems Specialist (at the rank of IT Technician) in the School of Computing and Data Science (Ref.: 530142)

The Technical Staff Office of the School of Computing and Data Science provides technical support services for administrative, teaching, and learning activities in the School. It is currently seeking a Systems Specialist to join the team. Fresh graduates are also welcome to apply.

The Role 

The appointee will perform duties for the Technical Staff Office and assist in one or more of the following tasks:

  • Website setup and maintenance, including web content updates
  • System administration of computer servers
  • Administration of firewalls, routers, and network switches
  • Providing helpdesk support for both staff and students
  • Video conferencing support
  • Event logistics management

Qualifications and Qualities

  • A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related discipline is preferred; candidates with other qualifications are also encouraged to apply
  • A good command of written and spoken English and Chinese
  • Strong problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills
  • Self-initiative and a willingness to learn
  • Knowledge of Linux operating systems will be an advantage

What We Offer 

The appointment will be made on a fixed-term full-time contract for 2 years, commencing as soon as possible, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance. A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, along with contract-end gratuity and a University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme at 10% of basic salary. Other benefits include annual leave and medical benefits.

How to Apply 

The University only accepts online applications for the above post. Applicants should apply online at the University’s careers site (https://jobs.hku.hk) and upload an up-to-date C.V. Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until December 31, 2024, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier. Shortlisted candidates will be invited to attend a written test and an interview.

job.title: Partnership Strategy & Analytics, Specialist/Senior Analyst (Assistant Manager/S
job.abstract: At AIA we’ve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone. As pioneering innovators for over 100 years
job.content:
At AIA we’ve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.

As pioneering innovators for over 100 years, we’re now transforming our organisation to be faster, simpler and more connected. Because we want to be even better equipped to develop digital solutions and experiences that help more people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.

To get there, we need people with tech/digital/analytics expertise and passion to help develop positive, sustainable change through digitally enhanced experiences that will impact the lives of millions of people and create a healthier future for everyone.

If you believe in developing a better tomorrow, read on. 

About the Role

Provide management information, analysis and insights to formulate business plan and partnership strategy

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Provide and manage management and performance reporting with analysis and recommendations to various management groups and stakeholders
  • Support sales teams with market insights and competitive analysis
  • Support to design, build, maintain, and control/manage the Partnership Distribution database and reporting tool
  • Analyze all informational requirements, develop database specifications, and enforce all database standards
  • Coordinate budget planning/ forecasting process/sales target setting
  • Ensure compliance with local budget and expense guideline, establish and maintain appropriate internal controls
  • Perform other responsibilities and duties periodically assigned by direct manager and department heads in order to meet business needs

Minimum Job Requirements:

  • University degree with 3-5 years working experience in financial analysis, management reporting
  • Experiences in insurance/ financial services preferred
  • Curious and courageous to share insights and propose new ideas in business solution
  • Strong analytic capability and time management skills
  • Positive mindset, self-motivated
  • Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
  • Be a team player
  • Strong in MS Excel and PowerPoint tools for developing financial models, data analysis and management presentation
  • Good command of written & spoken Chinese and English
  • Obtain relevant license if job involves in regulated activities

Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.

You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

job.title: DataBricks Data Analytics Consultant
job.abstract: This position has responsibility for the Data Analytics Solution Implementation & Delivery reporting to the Data Analytics Solutions Delivery...
job.content:
This position has responsibility for the Data Analytics Solution Implementation & Delivery reporting to the Data Analytics Solutions Delivery Manager

People & Business Responsibilities 

  • Manage, Work and Support client projects
  • Communicate project task deliverables
  • Engage, Support, Share and Assist the team


 

Implementation and Delivery Responsibilities  

  • Design, develop, maintain and manage advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards built in Data discovery Platform including but not limited to DataBricks, Qlik, Alteryx, PowerBI and Tableau 
  • Utilize various data visualization tools to develop dashboards and to visualize data
  • Work with business and IT teams in various business units to develop reports or address data needs to provide reporting solutions
  • Review functional and technical specifications prepared by clients or partner vendors
  • Extract data from databases and data warehouses for reporting and to facilitate sharing between multiple data systems
  • Perform and document data analysis, data validation, data mapping/design, by accessing multiple sources
  • Perform data transformation / ETL to create required data sets for data modelling and dashboard building  
  • Work closely with the infrastructure team on nonproduction and production infrastructure and environments
  • Work with teams to manage defects and bugs during the SIT and UAT phase
  • Attention to details and high standards of documentation are expected
  • Ensure projects are delivered on-time to the standard required and within the constraints of the delivery process
  • Communicate and manage proactively on issues affecting delivery
  • Be able to work with other Data Analytics solutions such as Microsoft Azure, PowerApps, Apache Spark is an advantage


 

Desired Skills and Experience Requirements 

  • Degree or above in Computer Sciences, Statistics, IT or related discipline preferred 
  • A minimum of 12-18 months experience in a data analytics related or consultative role
  • Working/project experience in DataBricks and Apache Spark is a MUST
  • Proactive, self-motivated to drive high-quality and efficient solutions delivery and willing to work with others
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good communicator, client facing experience is preferred 
  • Fluent in English and Cantonese. Mandarin is a plus
  • Some technical knowledge in programing, scripting and SDLC is a plus
  • Certified and/or Knowledge in MS Data Factory, MS Platform is an advantage
  • Knowledge in enterprise data storage and transformation platforms such as ETL tools from Azure, AWS and GCP is a plus
  • Knowledge in RDBMS such as Oracle, SQL, IBM and Database platform tools such as Snowflake, MS SQL, Azure Synapse, Databricks, DW/DL etc. and related experience would be an advantage
  • Full training and support to become expert of tools are provided. Sponsors on professional certifications are provided
  • Individuals with more experience would be considered as Senior Data Analytics Consultant

 

This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast growing and leading data analytics solutions company that is growing rapidly delivering a range of advanced data and analytics solutions across various industries. If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you then please send your resume including your current OTE compensation package to us.

bullets: Manage, Work and Support client projects

  • University Degree holder in e-Commerce, Marketing, Digital Marketing, Advertising or related discipline
  • Familiarize with Facebook and Instagram content marketing with strong KOLs networking is preferred
  • 3-5 years solid experience in search marketing, website project or digital media planning, creative writing in advertising agencies and / or FMCG

  • Experience in online video production and advanced skills with design tools (e.g. Photoshop) is preferred
  • Strong analytical mindset and strategic conceptual skill with acute marketing sense and high attention to detail

job.content:
The Position

  • Formulate strategies on facility management policy, smart-technologies application & implementation, development & planning, space management, and resources planning to maximize the efficiency of the facilities resources to support the property portfolio;

  • Manage the facilities management service providers to ensure effective and efficient operation of the facilities in newly developed property portfolio in Science Park and Industrial Estates including office buildings, residential institutions, high-tech manufacturing & logistic centre, Data Technology Hub and laboratories;

  • Review all functions and operations of FM for continuous improvement and working towards FM Best Practices;

  • Manage annual operation budgets and monitor actual monthly incomes and expenditures;

  • Monitor the take-over process of new buildings and follow up all outstanding building defects until satisfactory completion;

  • Prepare design, budgets, estimates, drawings and specifications for maintenance and improvement works and administer the tendering process;

  • Review tender or contract documents submitted by the facility management service providers and advise on the tendering process and tender document formulation;

  • Comment, inspect and control tenants' fit-out works and installations;

  • Comment the design drawings, specifications, manual, etc. and conduct inspections to identify defects during takeover of new projects;

  • Overview the District Cooling System improvement project;

  • Lead and supervise technical staff to carry out routine, ad hoc and emergency repair and maintenance works;

  • Liaise and coordinate on taking over of new properties;

  • Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor.

The Candidate

  • University degree in Building Services Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant Engineering disciplines or equivalent; Master degree in Facilities Management/Engineering is an added advantage;

  • Corporate membership of HKIE or equivalent;

  • Minimum 10 years of working experience preferrably in operation and maintenance of large-scale infrastructure;

  • Higher education or professional qualifications with less experience will also be considered;

  • Experience in facilities management with knowledge of Government procedures and requirements on licensing and maintenance certifications;

  • Experience in handling A&A and fitting out projects and knowledge of relevant statutory requirements;

  • Experience in District Cooling System design, construction, operation and maintenance is an added advantage;

  • Working experience with major developer(s);

  • In-depth knowledge of latest technology of intelligent building and conversant with FM-Maintenance Management System and related softwares;

  • Strong interpersonal skills with customer service oriented mindset in dealing with different levels of internal and external parties;

  • Excellent communication, planning, organizational and management skills; self-motivated, confident, creative and strong desire to achieve better performance;

  • Proficiency in both written and spoken English and Chinese (including Putonghua);

  • Candidates with less experience may be considered for the position of Manager, Technical Services.



What We offer

  • Unique Work.Live.Play.Learn culture in Hong Kong's largest Innovation & Technology ecosystem
  • 5-day work week, attractive annual leave and additional special leave
  • Medical benefits including dental and annual check-up from Day-1, with extended coverage to dependent(s)
  • Professional training and career advancement opportunities
  • Accessible to various bus service with network across different locations in HK

Interested parties please submit your application by clicking "Apply Now". Commencing position will be commensurate with qualifications, relevant experience, and competencies.

[This position is open for referral by Recruitment Agencies. The profile should be sent to our HR email h r @ h k s t p . o r g]

The application will remain open until the position is filled. HKSTP reserves the right not to fill the position.

Personal data provided will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purpose only. All personal data collected will be used strictly in accordance with employer's personal data policies, you can refer to the Corporation's Privacy Policy Statement at https://www.hkstp.org/privacy-policy/

Applicants not invited for interview within 6 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful. Personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be retained for a maximum of two years counting from the date the vacancy has been filled.

About Hong Kong Science & Technology Parks Corporation


Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP) was established in 2001 to create a thriving I&T ecosystem grooming 13 unicorns, more than 15,000 research professionals and over 2,000 technology companies from 28 countries and regions focused on developing healthtech, AI and robotics, fintech and smart city technologies, etc.

More information about HKSTP is available at www.hkstp.org.

job.title: Embelex Product Line Manager
job.abstract: Responsible for product commercialization from brief through to go to market launch for Embelex business in apparel and footwear industry solutions.
job.content:
What we can offer you! - Your Role:

As an Embelex Product Line Manager you are responsible for understanding the market for Avery Dennison’s apparel embellishment products and solutions. You will bring to market products that create exceptional value and drive key profit pools to enable top and bottom line growth.  Focused in our Embelex category, you will use your technical materials knowledge, consumer and industry insights, creative problem solving and collaborative skills to deliver new product lines that differentiate and evolve our portfolio. As a Product Line Manager you would be directly responsible for product commercialization from brief through to go to market launch. You will drive a global agile cross functional team and collaborate closely with Technical Development and manufacturing partners to ensure products and solutions are robust and fit for purpose. 

You will partner with your Sr Product Manager and different divisions within our organization to build and execute portfolio and innovation pipelines. With key stakeholders you will identify and evaluate market opportunities and develop specific value propositions that convert into new or incremental sales for the Embelex category. Utilizing  your expertise in apparel embellishments, you will ideate and refine products that optimize business needs and technical feasibility. Partnering across the Embelex product organization you will ensure a holistic approach that proactively focuses on how our products perform in the customer end use. This role serves as a catalyst to elevate the apparel embellishment market while championing sustainability goals and commitments.

Responsibilities extend to relevant product planning and execution throughout the product life cycle. Including understanding and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining product vision and scope, and working closely with internal teams to ensure business objectives and customer needs and expectations are met. 

 

Activities may include, but are not limited to:

  • Lead and accelerate new product innovations through the end to end commercialization process from brief to go to market launches.
  • Drive and own the decision making process for your product lines to balance business objectives, end use requirements and technical feasibility.
  • Support the Embelex Sr Product Manager with the implementation of category portfolio strategies and evolutions by building and contributing short and long term roadmaps for your product lines.
  • Conduct regular market and competitive analysis for knowledge of emerging market and consumer trends, product positioning, segmentation and competitors.
  • Collaborate with Technical and Commercial teams to gather customer insights, discuss white space opportunities to leverage into product line evolutions.
  • Monitor product line profitability trends to analyze product life cycles; taking proactive actions to evolve your product line (i.e. initiate and implement action plans for upgrades, cost savings, new introductions, and phase outs).
  • Develop and provide technical product training to enable launch activities internally across the global commercial team that articulates the value proposition for your product lines.
  • Own sustainability evolutions and product transitions within your product line; collaborating with the sustainability team on studies and targets, and the sales teams on revenue mapping.
  • Partner with global manufacturing leads to proactively build products with robust raw material supply chains.
  • Validate back-end support is in place and readily available for new product launches and expansions, including capacity planning, raw material readiness, and alignment of resources.


 

What we expect from you! - Your Expertise:

  • Minimum 5 years of product management or development within the apparel/ footwear industries.
  • Structured understanding of Apparel Embellishment product platforms, graphic applications and evolving physical and digital branding technologies.
  • In-depth technical working knowledge of the manufacturing methods across a wide range of apparel embellishment technologies and application processes.
  • Keen understanding of apparel testing and quality requirements that are needed to maximize product performance and end user success.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of the competitive landscape of apparel embellishment solutions.
  • Proven track record in defining, launching, evolving and sustaining product lines.
  • Customer/ market focused with experience in evaluating product requirements and feedback, matching them with effective solutions or leveraging into scope for new product development.
  • Strong influencing skills with the ability to champion products both cross functionally and vertically within global organizations. 
  • Strong storytelling and public speaking skills with the ability to create and deliver engaging presentations across global audiences.
  • Organized and detail oriented, with the ability to maintain and clearly communicate project updates and deliverables.
  • Work experience in the Apparel manufacturing, materials or trim management field is strongly preferred.
  • Direct development experience with printed heat transfers and associated chemistries is a plus.
  • Work experience in product line management in an international business, ideally in targeted markets is advantageous.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
  • Willingness to travel globally for about 20% of the time
  • Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent)

job.title: Team Lead, Fixed Income Trade Support
job.abstract: A Foreign Investment Bank is looking for a Team Lead, Fixed Income Trade Support
job.content:
Your new company

A Foreign Investment Bank is looking for a Team Lead, Fixed Income Trade Support

Your new role

  • Process day-to-day operational activities between customers, front office, and other operational teams to ensure all transactions are properly processed.
  • Handle products including Bonds, Repos, Mortgages, Loans, Primary new issues, Futures, and Pledges.
  • Liaise with settlements, brokers, and clients to resolve issues.
  • Create and maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Ensure all reconciliations are performed and escalated in a timely manner.
  • Promote operational excellence.
  • Support the Head of Fixed Income Middle Office in delivering their technology and operating model strategy.
  • Foster an inclusive working environment.
  • Drive process improvement and system automation.
  • Support the implementation of new products.
  • Ensure compliance with Department and Firm's Operational Risk & Regulatory requirements.
  • Assist the Head of Fixed Income Middle Office and ensure appropriate Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are in place.

What you'll need to succeed

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
  • Minimum 7 years of Middle Office experience.
  • Previous experience with Murex and CTM.
  • Strong understanding of Cash Fixed Income products.
  • Fluency in verbal and written English.

What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or reach out to Christopher Cheung, email: christopher.cheung@hays.com.hk phone: +852 2230 7916 now.

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

job.title: Technical Manager (Front End Web Development)
job.abstract: End to End Web Development for a streaming platform
job.content:
Our Client is the leading pan-regional over-the-top (OTT) video streaming service, available in 16 markets including Hong Kong, South East Asia, the Middle East and lately South Africa. Millions of users are enjoying our client's full range of premium Asian content including Movies, Drama, Animates and Variety Show with local language subtitles as well as original production series. 

Job Highlights:

  • Assume the role of a problem solver and leader within the organization.
  • Lead the Over-the-Top (OTT) service in the Southeast Asia (SEA) region, gaining valuable regional exposure.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and manage a team dedicated to developing web streaming platform and web projects.
  • Analyze requirements from stakeholders to identify needs and deliver architectural designs and innovative solutions.
  • Engage in full stack engineering and collaborate closely with the backend teams to ensure the optimal solution.
  • Continuously evolve the app architecture to enhance development efficiency.
  • Produce meticulous and comprehensive technical documentation to ensure alignment and facilitate knowledge transfer.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders to provide updates, address concerns, and gather feedback.
  • Present technical concepts and proposals to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and concise manner.
  • Foster effective collaboration and maintain open lines of communication with team members located in Hong Kong, China and India.

Requirements:

  • Demonstrate a minimum of 3 years of experience in a leadership role, effectively guiding and managing teams.
  • Expert level in React.js / Next.js, Typescript, JavaScript, HTML5, CCS.
  • Familiar with RWD, SEO and Git.
  • Exhibit exceptional analytical and logical skills, coupled with meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Possess in-depth knowledge of software design principles, including SOLID, CLEAN, TDD, and other industry best practices.
  • Good command of written and spoken English and Mandarin.
  • Knowledge on DevOps and agile methodology

job.title: Assistant IT Support Engineer/IT Support Engineer
job.abstract: We are looking for an energetic and dynamic IT Support Engineer joining our team!
job.content:
Responsibilities

  • Provide first line helpdesk support to employees in all offices of the Asia Pacific region
  • Assist in maintaining server room located in Hong Kong (temperature control system, fire suppression system, high availability power system, environment monitoring system, network switch, structure cabling, etc)
  • Record and manage all incidents and requests in ticket-tracking system
  • Responsible for handling hardware maintenance on network equipment, server, PC, PABX and all related equipment
  • Telephone system, network equipment connection
  • Perform IT equipment administration, including equipment procurement and inventory management 
  • Implement, support and develop systems following defined standards and procedures
  • Provide other IT-related support as required by the business

 

Key requirements

  • Degree holder or above in IT or related discipline
  • With 1 year of IT support experience, Fresh Graduates will also be considered
  • Knowledge of network and server-side infrastructure (e.g. Windows Server 2019/2022)
  • MS Windows 11 and O365
  • PC and Server Hardware, AV equipment
  • Proficient in IT support, with experience in Microsoft Windows configuration, desktop administration, the Microsoft Office suite, and telephone systems.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and reporting software (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI)
  • Willingness to work outside of office hour
  • Proactive, self-motivated and able to work independently
  • Strong communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills
  • Fluent in English and Putonghua
  • Immediate available is highly preferred

 

On the job training will be provided to this position, including the following systems.

  • Windows server based applications and technologies (Hyper V, Failover Cluster, SCVMM, SCCM, SCOM, Sharepoint, etc) 
  • Backup solution (NetBackup, Tape Library)
  • HP Nimble storage system

 

The successful applicant will need to be self-motivated, eager to learn, able to work under pressure, with good interpersonal skills, good problem-solving skills and able to work in a team.  This position is primarily based in the Hong Kong office, but it may require travel to other sites in the Renishaw Asia Pacific region.

 

We offer 5-day work week, double pay, discretionary performance bonus, bank holidays, extensive medical plan and MPF contribution. Interested parties please submit your full resume including expected salary and availability by clicking "APPLY NOW".

job.title: Event Sales Manager
job.abstract: Work together with sales team to convert, retain and grow our group base while securing reputable and lucrative business for the hotel.
job.content:
Rosewood Hong Kong celebrates a culture in which Rosewood Associates are inspired to look at life a little differently, through a lens of limitless possibilities. We aim to create an innovative culture of intimate and casual, yet refined, hospitality, empowering Rosewood Associates to create indelible memories for themselves, for one other and for our guests.

The vertical estate on the majestic harbour, Rosewood Hong Kong is seeking intuitive, engaging and impassioned Associates to embark on a Rosewood Journey with us. Apply Now.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Reach and exceed yearly events budget as assigned.
  • Support the Director of Events Sales to successfully manage function diary to ensure bookings are appropriately qualified, accurately recorded, standards applied, revenue detailed accurately and within guidelines, activities recorded, decision due and cut off dates followed and lost business analyzed.
  • Assist in management of incoming event enquiries to ensure efficient response time.
  • Focus on lead conversion and key opportunities, in effort to maximize hotel revenue.
  • Accurately identify and define the event, dates, times, function space requirement, expected attendance, flow, budget, client expectations and level of influence and decision making power of contacts in the customer organization and use these to secure event business.
  • Analyze, negotiate and prepare proposals, contracts and addendums according to hotel availability and demand while maintaining price integrity.
  • Coordinate accurate, up-to-date revenue with changes whenever necessary together with sales activities are recorded in the system.
  • Regular review key competitors’ study on pricing, packages, booking trends in order to cope with market trends and work with Director of Event Sales on pricing strategies from time to time.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 5  years’ experience in a sizeable luxury hotel and catering group with 2 years in similar capacity
  • Detail oriented, organized and able to handle a fast paced environment
  • Possess excellent guest services skills, professional presentation and sophisticated interpersonal skills
  • Excellent verbal bilingual communication skills is a must (both English and Chinese)

job.content:

job.title: Sports Sales Specialist - Omni Sports (Full time)
job.abstract: Are you a sports lover seeking an exciting career in sports retail? Look no further! Join Us!
job.content:
Are you a sports lover seeking an exciting career in sports retail? Look no further! Join Us!

Join the Decathlon Hong Kong Team as a Sports Sales Specialist (Full-time Omni Sports Leader) and ignite your passion for sports!

Are you a sporty entrepreneur with an unstoppable drive for retail success? We're seeking exceptional individuals to join our dynamic retail team in Hong Kong as Omni Sports Leaders. At Decathlon Hong Kong, we're on a mission to Move People Through the Wonders of Sports and create an unmatched shopping experience right at the heart of this bustling city!

As a team specialist in your Sports Department, you'll be responsible for assisting customers, offering expert product recommendations, handling transactions, and ensuring our store maintains its vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. At Decathlon, we believe in nurturing talent, which is why we offer comprehensive training and development opportunities to help you grow both personally and professionally. No prior experience is required - just a genuine passion for sports and a customer-centric mindset. Join us and be a driving force in the exhilarating world of sportswear!

Responsibilities:
 

  • Ignite passion and create remarkable retail experiences that embody the Decathlon spirit.
  • Provide personalized and attentive customer service, going above and beyond to guide customers towards finding the perfect sports gears that meet their unique needs.
  • Ensure seamless product availability, safety, and operational efficiency to keep the excitement alive.
  • Foster a thriving local sporting community by organizing store activities and promoting active lifestyles.

Why Join Us?
 

  • Be part of the Decathlon Hong Kong family, a global leader in sports retail with a strong commitment to customer satisfaction.
  • Unlock unparalleled professional & personal development opportunities to grow your career in retail management.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package, medical coverage, including a generous sports allowance that fuels your passion and a healthy employee discount on Decathlon products.
  • Immerse yourself in our diverse and inclusive work environment that celebrates the wonders of sports.

Ready to embark on an exhilarating journey where retail and your passion for sports collide? Click Apply Now to find out more and become an invaluable teammate of the Decathlon Hong Kong family! 
 

*Eligibility Requirement: Applicants must have the legal right to work in Hong Kong.


Working Location(s):
 

  • Mong Kok/ Kowloon Bay/ Central/ Causeway Bay/ Tseung Kwan O/ Shatin/ Tuen Mun/ Ma On Shan
  • Full time: 5 working days per week, 8 hours + 1 hour meal break, shift required.

bullets: Ignite your sports passion at Decathlon HK!
Thrive in Hong Kong's sports retail scene!
Competitive salary, sports allowance, diverse team

paragraphs: In 1976, Decathlon opened its first store in Englos, a town near Lille in the north of France. With over four decades of experience, we strive to provide innovative, affordable, and sustainable sports products. We have remained committed to our mission: to move people through the wonder of sports. We offer over 70 sports categories and have over 1,700 stores in over 60 countries worldwide.

job.title: Assistant Manager, Wealth Management Marketing
job.abstract: We seek to attract high-calibre talent by offering a dynamic working environment, career development opportunities & competitive compensation packages
job.content:
A Career with Hang Seng Bank

Hang Seng is committed to service excellence. Our people are our most important asset and play a vital role in our efforts to continually enhance our performance for customers and provide best-in-class products and services.  We seek to attract high-calibre talent by offering a dynamic working environment, good career development opportunities and competitive compensation packages.

Marketing

Hang Seng’s Marketing function is responsible for formulating marketing strategies and implementing marketing initiatives to reinforce the brand of Hang Seng Bank, drive acquisition and usage of the Bank's product and services, strengthen customer loyalty to build long term relationships, and provide internal business units with marketing support to deliver a comprehensive suite of products and services offered by the Bank. 

We are currently seeking a high caliber marketing professional to join us as Assistant Manager, Wealth Management Marketing.

Principal Responsibilities

  • Assist in various Marketing & Business initiatives and insurance project development to support Life Insurance business
  • Facilitate effective communication between marketing channel, external parties, internal stakeholders and risk stewards
  • Facilitate the development of the O2O process for marketing optimization
  • Monitor the campaign progress / effectiveness and conduct post-program evaluation for future improvement

Requirements

  • University graduate preferably in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics or related discipline
  • Minimum 2 years banking/insurance experience
  • Experienced in marketing with knowledge on martech
  • Strong communication skills, self-motivated, multi-tasking and able to work independently under pressure
  • Well versed in MS Office, PowerPoint and Excel
  • Proficiency in both English and Chinese 

 

Visit Hang Seng Career Page and sign up with our Talent Community to receive the latest information about our career opportunities in Hang Seng Hong Kong.

All information provided by applicants will be used only for recruitment purposes and will be used strictly in accordance with the Bank's personal data policies, a copy of which may be obtained by the applicant upon request. Unless otherwise instructed in writing by the applicant concerned, applicants may be considered for other suitable positions within the Bank and its related companies. The personal data of unsuccessful job applicants may be retained for a maximum of two years from the date when the job application is rejected and such data may be retained for a longer period if there is a subsisting reason that obliges the Bank to do so, after which the personal data will be destroyed.

paragraphs: Established in 1933, Hang Seng Bank is renowned as one of the leading banks in Hong Kong that is dedicated to delivering a comprehensive range of banking, investment and wealth management services tailored to the unique needs of individuals and business. With an extensive customer base of over 3.9 million and over 260 branches in Hong Kong, Hang Seng has built a robust local presence by adopting a customer-centric approach.

job.title: Customer Service Officer - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.abstract: Customer Service Officer - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.content:
Job description

Some careers open more doors than others.

If you're looking for a career that will unlock new opportunities, join HSBC and experience the possibilities. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) helps deliver on HSBC's purpose of opening up a world of opportunity by providing our customers with borderless banking and world-class wealth management through best-in-class, mobile-first capabilities and exceptional people. Our international network and breadth of expertise enable us to support individuals, families, business owners, investors and entrepreneurs. Wealth and Personal Banking has four key business areas responsible for efficiently bringing the best of HSBC to our clients through a broad and relevant suite of wealth and retail banking capabilities: Asset Management, Global Private Banking & Wealth, HSBC Life, Retail Banking & Strategy and COO & Digital Transformation.

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Customer Service Officer (HP).

Principal responsibilities

Duties

  • Provide quality customer service through accurate and efficient counter transactions at branch
  • Meet the financial services needs of customers by identifying opportunities and referring them to appropriate bank colleagues
  • Promote digital banking services and products and encourage customers to migrate to digital
  • Ensure smooth branch operations and achieve satisfactory audit rating by meeting all control and service requirements
  • Ensure compliance of both general and anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing compliance controls in accordance with HSBC or regulatory standards and policies
  • Multiple work locations available across branches in Hong Kong, Kowloon, and New Territories

Requirements

  • Secondary school graduate with a pass in 5 subjects for HKCEE or HKDSE including Math, Chinese or English, equivalent or above preferred
  • Customer centric mindset with commitment to deliver quality service
  • Self-motivated and adaptable to a service environment
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills with fluency in Cantonese and English. Mandarin is a definitive advantage.
  • With at least 1-year customer or teller service experience
  • Candidate with less experience will be considered for a Customer Service Officer role

Employee Benefits

  • Competitive salary package with stable working hours, 5-day work week
  • 18 days paid annual leave plus additional leave such as marriage, birthday and maternity/ paternity leave
  • Medical and dental coverage for you, your spouse and children
  • Staff housing loan up to 100% of the valuation or purchase price
  • Employee banking services including loans, credit facilities, and credit cards
  • Progressive career advancement opportunities

You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.
http://www.hsbc.com/careers

HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

卓越理財客戶服務主任 - 零售銀行及財富管理業務

零售銀行及財富管理業務為全球數以百萬計的客戶提供全面的銀行及財富管理服務，協助客戶管理財務，並為未來構建穩健財務及提供保障。這項環球業務主要包括零售銀行、財富管理、保險及投資管理，致力提供以客為先的服務及發展創新高效的分銷渠道。

職責

  • 確保分行櫃位交易準確無誤
  • 把握機會將客戶轉介給相關銀行業務的同事，滿足客戶不同的金融服務需要
  • 推廣並鼓勵客戶使用網上理財服務及產品
  • 遵守所有監控和服務規定，確保分行運作順暢並達到令人滿意的審核評級
  • 遵循滙豐或監管機構的標準與政策，確保符合反洗錢與反資助恐怖主義活動規程
  • 香港/九龍/新界多個分行地點可選

職位要求

  • 持有 香港中學會考 (HKCEE) 或香港中學文憑證書 (HKDSE) 五科合格，包括數學、中文或英文; 同等或以上學歷為佳
  • 以客為先，致力提供優質服務
  • 對工作充滿熱誠且能適應服務行業
  • 良好的人際關係與溝通技巧，能操流利粵語及英語，懂普通話更佳
  • 具1年或以上客戶服務或銀行櫃位服務經驗
  • 經驗較淺者，將會被考慮擔任客戶服務主任職位

員工褔利

  • 良好的薪酬待遇及固定工作時間，每星期五天工作
  • 18天有薪年假及額外有薪假 如婚假、生日假、產假或侍產假
  • 退休金的僱主供款部分最高可達基本月薪的13%
  • 醫療及人壽保險，保障您本人、配偶及子女
  • 員工物業按揭貸款，貸款額可達物業估價或售價100%
  • 各種銀行服務及產品的員工優惠，包括貸款、信貸、信用卡
  • 理想晉升機會

bullets: One of the world's leading international banks
Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply

paragraphs: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited is the founding member of the HSBC Group. Established in 1865 to finance the growing trade between Asia and Europe, it has become the biggest bank incorporated in Hong Kong.

The bank provides a range of personal, commercial and corporate banking financial services across Asia. HSBC is known in Cantonese as “Wayfoong”, which means “focus of wealth” or “abundance of remittances.”

job.title: Premier Relationship Manager - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.abstract: Premier Relationship Manager 卓越理財客戶經理 - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.content:
Some careers grow faster than others.

If you're looking for a career that will give you plenty of opportunities to develop, join HSBC and your future will be rich with potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) helps deliver on HSBC's purpose of opening up a world of opportunity by providing our customers with borderless banking and world-class wealth management through best-in-class, mobile-first capabilities and exceptional people. Our international network and breadth of expertise enable us to support individuals, families, business owners, investors and entrepreneurs. Wealth and Personal Banking has four key business areas responsible for efficiently bringing the best of HSBC to our clients through a broad and relevant suite of wealth and retail banking capabilities: Asset Management, Global Private Banking & Wealth, HSBC Life, Retail Banking & Strategy and COO & Digital Transformation

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Premier Relationship Manager.

As a Premier Relationship Manager, you will be a trusted adviser to our new and existing Premier customers. Working collaboratively with Investment and Insurance Specialist Team, you will support client's entire life journey by providing professional and comprehensive financial advice to suit the customer needs. You will also have a dedicated team of Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier who will provide support on contacting clients proactively, handling clients' banking queries timely and ensuring all the compliance and regulations are met. All these are unique in making your career journey different from any other.

Principal Responsibilities

  • Developing our Premier customer base and establishing long term relationships with an assigned Premier clientele portfolio
  • Managing the total wealth of your clients by matching our financial and investment product solutions to their financial needs
  • Demonstrating genuine curiosity about customers, helping them reach their financial ambitions
  • Connecting with Product Specialists to provide more advanced technical input to identify and fulfill multiple needs with customers
  • Promoting our Premier Service to potential customers, exploring their needs and making referrals to other business units where appropriate
  • Supporting branch improvement initiatives, providing customer feedback of our service and ensuring compliance with audit requirements and quality assurance
  • Understanding and adhering to local and global compliance

job.title: Purchasing Officer, Purchaser (Greater China, Traditional Chinese Medicine)
job.abstract: Our procurement team travels across the region to source food / TCM products. Job seekers with expertise in proprietary Chinese medicine are welcome.
job.content:
[Stream A: Native Mandarin + Traditional Chinese Medicine Specialist]

[Stream B: Native Mandarin + 985 + food industry calibre]

 

Main Duties:

Purchaser’s duties:

  • Act as a sourcing officer in purchasing department;
  • Handle sourcing, price negotiation, payment terms, PO, Shipping Documents, order follow up as well as payment arrangement, etc;
  • Communicate between with suppliers and production teams;
  • Liaise with factories for production schedule & quality checking;
  • Internal communication with warehouse for stock management, food quality control, etc;
  • Occasionally travel to Greater China region.

 

Candidates with relative trading / sourcing experience in Greater China Region will be considered as Purchasing Officer / Sourcing Officer, in addition providing following duties:

 

  • Meet with Ethnic Chinese (Mainland China / Taiwan / Hong Kong) vendors;
  • Source and audit new suppliers;
  • Maintain current product supply and ensure in stable quality;
  • Travel to China / Taiwan, source and audit new suppliers;
  • Handle price negotiation, cost comparison & analysis;

 

Important: Instead of related experience in the field, good intuitive and common senses are overwhelmingly important requirements for the above position. Candidates from sizeable Traditional Chinese Medicine retail and wholesale distributors, such as 華潤堂, are welcome.

 

Requirements:

  • Good knowledge with great interest in Traditional Chinese Medicine / food / food science is essential;
  • Good command in both written and spoken Mandarin plus Native Cantonese Speaking;
  • 3-4 years’ working experience, preferably in sales or trading, purchasing office, retail industry;
  • Proficient driving skills, with a preference for holders of a Mainland China driver’s license;
  • Good understanding of China’s business environment / culture is preferred;
  • Good Knowledge of Chinese culinary, supply chain, food science, etc is an advantage;
  • Holder of driving license (Hong Kong and China);
  • Able to work multi-tasks under pressure and deliver on schedule;
  • Self-motivated, positive, energetic and keen on learning;
  • Good numerical sense plus proficiency in usage of EXCEL tool is definite advantage;
  • Strong team player and communicator;
  • Disciplinary, punctual.

 

We offer 5-day work, Free lunch, Monthly incentive, 12 -18 days annual leave, Birthday leave, 10 days paternity leave, Employee purchase discount and Annual body check to the above position.

 

Interested parties please send Full resume to HK JEBN LIMITED, including the following details:

1)       Availability
2)      Expected salary
3)      Present salary

 

*HK JEBN Group policies on non-recruitment of smokers or other tobacco users.

All personal data collected will be treated in strict confidential and be used for recruitment purpose solely.

paragraphs: In the late 19th century, abduction and trafficking of women and children were critical issues in Hong Kong. On November 8, 1878, local Chinese petitioned Governor Sir John Pope Hennessy to establish Po Leung Kuk for rescuing kidnapped victims. This led to the approval of the “Society for the Protection of Women and Children” in May 1880, adopting November 8 as our founding date.

job.title: Customer Service Officer - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.abstract: Customer Service Officer - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.content:
Job description

Some careers open more doors than others.

If you're looking for a career that will unlock new opportunities, join HSBC and experience the possibilities. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) helps deliver on HSBC's purpose of opening up a world of opportunity by providing our customers with borderless banking and world-class wealth management through best-in-class, mobile-first capabilities and exceptional people. Our international network and breadth of expertise enable us to support individuals, families, business owners, investors and entrepreneurs. Wealth and Personal Banking has four key business areas responsible for efficiently bringing the best of HSBC to our clients through a broad and relevant suite of wealth and retail banking capabilities: Asset Management, Global Private Banking & Wealth, HSBC Life, Retail Banking & Strategy and COO & Digital Transformation.

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Customer Service Officer (HP).

Principal responsibilities

Duties

  • Provide quality customer service through accurate and efficient counter transactions at branch
  • Meet the financial services needs of customers by identifying opportunities and referring them to appropriate bank colleagues
  • Promote digital banking services and products and encourage customers to migrate to digital
  • Ensure smooth branch operations and achieve satisfactory audit rating by meeting all control and service requirements
  • Ensure compliance of both general and anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing compliance controls in accordance with HSBC or regulatory standards and policies
  • Multiple work locations available across branches in Hong Kong, Kowloon, and New Territories

Requirements

  • Secondary school graduate with a pass in 5 subjects for HKCEE or HKDSE including Math, Chinese or English, equivalent or above preferred
  • Customer centric mindset with commitment to deliver quality service
  • Self-motivated and adaptable to a service environment
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills with fluency in Cantonese and English. Mandarin is a definitive advantage.
  • With at least 1-year customer or teller service experience
  • Candidate with less experience will be considered for a Customer Service Officer role

Employee Benefits

  • Competitive salary package with stable working hours, 5-day work week
  • 18 days paid annual leave plus additional leave such as marriage, birthday and maternity/ paternity leave
  • Medical and dental coverage for you, your spouse and children
  • Staff housing loan up to 100% of the valuation or purchase price
  • Employee banking services including loans, credit facilities, and credit cards
  • Progressive career advancement opportunities

You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.
http://www.hsbc.com/careers

HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

卓越理財客戶服務主任 - 零售銀行及財富管理業務

零售銀行及財富管理業務為全球數以百萬計的客戶提供全面的銀行及財富管理服務，協助客戶管理財務，並為未來構建穩健財務及提供保障。這項環球業務主要包括零售銀行、財富管理、保險及投資管理，致力提供以客為先的服務及發展創新高效的分銷渠道。

職責

  • 確保分行櫃位交易準確無誤
  • 把握機會將客戶轉介給相關銀行業務的同事，滿足客戶不同的金融服務需要
  • 推廣並鼓勵客戶使用網上理財服務及產品
  • 遵守所有監控和服務規定，確保分行運作順暢並達到令人滿意的審核評級
  • 遵循滙豐或監管機構的標準與政策，確保符合反洗錢與反資助恐怖主義活動規程
  • 香港/九龍/新界多個分行地點可選

職位要求

  • 持有 香港中學會考 (HKCEE) 或香港中學文憑證書 (HKDSE) 五科合格，包括數學、中文或英文; 同等或以上學歷為佳
  • 以客為先，致力提供優質服務
  • 對工作充滿熱誠且能適應服務行業
  • 良好的人際關係與溝通技巧，能操流利粵語及英語，懂普通話更佳
  • 具1年或以上客戶服務或銀行櫃位服務經驗
  • 經驗較淺者，將會被考慮擔任客戶服務主任職位

員工褔利

  • 良好的薪酬待遇及固定工作時間，每星期五天工作
  • 18天有薪年假及額外有薪假 如婚假、生日假、產假或侍產假
  • 退休金的僱主供款部分最高可達基本月薪的13%
  • 醫療及人壽保險，保障您本人、配偶及子女
  • 員工物業按揭貸款，貸款額可達物業估價或售價100%
  • 各種銀行服務及產品的員工優惠，包括貸款、信貸、信用卡
  • 理想晉升機會

paragraphs: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited is the founding member of the HSBC Group. Established in 1865 to finance the growing trade between Asia and Europe, it has become the biggest bank incorporated in Hong Kong.

The bank provides a range of personal, commercial and corporate banking financial services across Asia. HSBC is known in Cantonese as “Wayfoong”, which means “focus of wealth” or “abundance of remittances.”

job.title: Partnership Distribution Manager
job.abstract:

job.content:
Job Descriptions

  • Develop promotion and marketing campaigns to enhance the relationship with business partners so as to enable the business growth

  • Assist in planning, budgeting, organizing and executing the marketing strategies, promotions and events

Job Requirements
 

  • Bachelor degree or above
  • 5+ years’ relevant experience in channel distribution, preferably in broker’s distribution
  • Possess insurance related qualifications e.g. IIQE I & III, FLMI etc.
  • Integrity and honest

job.title: 资深财富管理销售经理/客户经理
job.abstract: We are looking for experienced Wealth Management senior sales managers and relationship managers to join our Fund Finance team in Hong Kong.
job.content:
工作地点：香港&上海

岗位职责：

1、为高净值个人和机构客户提供专业的境外投资服务与财富管理咨询，完成公司的业务指标；

2、与客户进行及时有效的业务联络及投资咨询建议，提供全面的金融理财服务，保证客户的资产安全及保值增值；

3、通过各种渠道开发境外投资的新客户，并维护好现有客户关系，提升公司资管品牌与资产管理规模。

 

岗位要求：

1、在金融投资咨询、财富管理等行业具备丰富的渠道资源与客户资源，对全球投资产品（如基金、债券、股票等）有深入理解，具备评估和销售海外金融产品的能力；

2、具备丰富的家族办公室、私人银行或保险行业的工作经验，特别是在境内外高端产品的销售和服务；

3、能够独立开发高净值客户，有针对境外投资的高效客户转化策略；

4、英语流利，口语和书面表达能力强，能有效进行商务沟通交流及谈判；

5、持有基金从业资格证书或金融规划师认证（如AFP、RFP、CFP）优先考虑。

 

公司提供的资源：

1、全球财富管理团队提供全方位的技术支持；

2、我们是香港1、4、9号牌资产管理公司；

3、我们与一些全球顶尖的私人银行和资产管理机构有深度合作，例如：花旗银行、摩根士丹利、摩根大通、DBS、UBS、UBP、新加坡银行、罗素、霸菱等；

4、我们的员工有机会参加全球各大私人银行的研讨会和活动；

5、如果您是优秀的候选人，公司会为您提供在香港工作的签证支持。

 

Senior Wealth Management Sales Manager/Sales Account Manager

Location: Hong Kong& Shanghai

Job responsibilities:

1. Provide professional overseas investment services and wealth management consulting for high net worth individuals and institutional clients, and complete the company's business targets;

2. Provide timely and effective business contacts and investment advice with customers, and provide comprehensive financial services to ensure the safety of customers' assets and maintain and increase their value;

3. Develop new customers for overseas investment through various channels, maintain the relationship with existing customers, and enhance the company's asset management brand and asset management scale.

 

Job requirements:

1. Have rich channel resources and customer resources in financial investment consulting, wealth management and other industries, have a deep understanding of global investment products (such as funds, bonds, stocks, etc.), and have the ability to evaluate and sell overseas financial products;

2. Have rich working experience in family office, private banking or insurance industry, especially in sales and service of high-end products at home and abroad;

3. Able to independently develop high net worth customers and have efficient customer conversion strategies for overseas investment;

4. Fluent in English, strong oral and written expression skills, able to effectively conduct business communication and negotiation;

5, holding the fund qualification certificate or financial planner certification (such as AFP, RFP, CFP) is preferred.

 

Resources provided by the company:

1, global wealth management team to provide a full range of technical support;

2, we are Hong Kong 1, 4, 9 brand asset management company;

3, we have deep cooperation with some of the world's top private banks and asset management institutions, such as: Citibank, Morgan Stanley, jpmorgan Chase, DBS, UBS, UBP, Bank of Singapore, Russell, Baring, etc.

4. Our employees have the opportunity to attend seminars and events of major private banks around the world;

5, if you are an excellent candidate, the company will provide you with visa support to work in Hong Kong.

bullets: Participate in corporate financial investments, primary and secondary markets.
Deep cooperation with some of the world's top private banks and asset managers.
Attend seminars and events at major private banks around the world.

job.title: Personal Banking Executive - Contact Centre and Remote Channel
job.abstract: Personal Banking Executive, Premier Relationship - Contact Centre and Remote Channel
job.content:
Job description

Some careers grow faster than others.

If you're looking for a career that will give you plenty of opportunities to develop, join HSBC and your future will be rich with potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Personal Banking Executive, Premier Relationship.

Principal Responsibilities

Our Contact Centre Business team in Hong Kong was renamed as HSBC Contact Centre and Remote Channel in 2023 as we move to become a remote customer relationship management team providing premium customer service to our Premier, Premier Elite and Global Private Banking customers. Located at HSBC Centre in Tai Kok Tsui, our Contact Centre and Remote Channel team is a vital part of the wider Retail Banking and Wealth Management Distribution team in Hong Kong.

Our customers are as diverse as the services we provide, including people from Hong Kong, mainland China and across the world. Through phone banking and digital banking platforms, we provide personalised wealth management solutions to meet the changing and evolving needs of our customers. To you, it means excellent exposure to banking and wealth management knowledge including credit cards, loans, investment, and insurance products.

滙豐香港客戶聯絡中心已於2023年易名為滙豐客戶聯絡及遙距支援中心，意旨我們的服務已從客戶聯絡中心進一步提升為客戶關係管理平台，為我們卓越理財、卓越理財尊尚和環球私人銀行客戶提供優質的銀行和財富管理服務。滙豐客戶聯絡及遙距支援中心位於大角咀的滙豐中心，是香港零售銀行及財富管理分銷團隊的重要組成部分。

我們的業務涵蓋多個範疇，為遍佈香港、中國內地和世界各地的客戶提供多元化的服務。通過電話理財和數碼銀行平台，我們能更精準地為客戶解決問題， 並提供個性化的財富管理方案以滿足他們各方面的個人財務需要。對於您而言，這意味著會得到更廣泛的銀行和財富管理知識，包括信用卡、貸款、投資和保險產品等。

As part of our team, you will:

  • Provide quality services and resolve queries from our Premier, Premier Elite and Global Private Banking customers efficiently using insights from our innovative technology and solutions
  • Work closely with our customers, understand their needs and recommend appropriate financial services and solutions
  • Achieve individual performance expectation, develop your career with a clear progression path
  • Benefit from extensive training, learning opportunities, support from your peers and managers and exposure to a wide variety of financial products, services and technologies

Employee Benefits:

  • 18 days paid annual leave
  • Hybrid working arrangement available
  • Additional leave such as marriage, birthday and maternity leave (up to 20-week) / paternity leave (40-day)
  • Competitive salary package with quarterly bonus
  • Transportation allowance
  • Medical and dental coverage for you, your spouse and children
  • Staff housing loan up to 100% of the valuation or purchase price
  • Employee banking services including loans, credit facilities, and credit cards
  • Assistance with training and certifications to further develop your career


成為我們的成員之一，您將會:

  • 透過多元渠道處理來自滙豐卓越理財、滙豐卓越理財尊尚和滙豐環球私人銀行客戶的咨詢，並提供高質素服務，解決客戶的疑慮
  • 聆聽並理解客戶需要，以提供合適的財務產品及服務
  • 實現個人績效並通過清晰的晉升機制，遂步實踐您的事業目標
  • 透過定期及全面的在職培訓及學習機會，掌握各項銀行產品及服務知識，發掘您的專業潛能，並開展您的銀行職涯

員工褔利:

  • 18天有薪年假
  • 混合辦工模式
  • 額外有薪假如婚假、生日假、產假（高達20 週）或侍產假（40 天）
  • 良好的薪酬待遇及額外季度花紅
  • 交通津貼
  • 醫療保險及牙科福利保障 (包括員工、配偶及子女)
  • 員工物業按揭貸款，貸款額可達物業估價或售價100%
  • 各種銀行服務及產品的員工優惠，包括貸款、存款利率優惠等

Requirements

  • A holder of High Diploma, equivalent or above
  • Fluency in Cantonese, English and Mandarin and ability to read and write in Chinese and English
  • Banking experience is not essential. We will provide comprehensive training to help you progress in your career and gain your professional licensing qualifications
  • Candidate with customer service experience, and a license holder of HKSI 1,7,8 or IIQE 1, 2, 3, will be considered for a Senior Wealth & Personal Banking Executive role
  • Fresh graduates are welcome

Visit hsbc.com/hkretailcareers to learn more about working in HSBC Contact Centre and Remote Channel.

要求:

  • 香港高級文憑證書同等或以上學歷
  • 能操流利廣東話、英語及普通話，並有良好中英讀寫能力
  • 無需銀行工作經驗，我們將會向員工提供全面的專業培訓，並支援員工考取工作所需的相關專業資格包括（香港證券及投資學會卷一、卷七及卷八）或保險牌照 (保險中介人資格考試卷一、卷二及卷三）
  • 具客戶服務經驗並持有以上相關專業資格的應徵者，將會被考慮擔任高級財富管理及個人銀行業務主任職位
  • 歡迎應屆畢業生申請

請到 hsbc.com/hkretailcareers了解更多在滙豐客戶聯絡及遙距支援中心工作的體驗。

Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) helps deliver on HSBC's purpose of opening up a world of opportunity by providing our customers with borderless banking and world-class wealth management through best-in-class, mobile-first capabilities and exceptional people. Our international network and breadth of expertise enable us to support individuals, families, business owners, investors and entrepreneurs. Wealth and Personal Banking has four key business areas responsible for efficiently bringing the best of HSBC to our clients through a broad and relevant suite of wealth and retail banking capabilities: Asset Management, Global Private Banking & Wealth, HSBC Life, Retail Banking & Strategy and COO & Digital Transformation.

You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.
http://www.hsbc.com/careers

HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

The bank provides a range of personal, commercial and corporate banking financial services across Asia. HSBC is known in Cantonese as “Wayfoong”, which means “focus of wealth” or “abundance of remittances.”

job.title: Product Designer
job.abstract: We are seeking a Product Designer with a passion for finding solutions!
job.content:
We are seeking a Product Designer with a passion for finding solutions that allow customers to intuitively use our products and have an AMAZING experience while using them. The ideal candidate will be skilled at each stage of the design process but always focused on the needs of the customer. 

You will work with other cross-functional team members and will rely heavily on both qualitative and quantitative data to make informed decisions.
 

What we expect from you
By partnering with cross-functional teams and customers, you will turn your insights into delightful products in a creative environment that requires proven leadership skills and the ability to execute a creative vision.


● Set design requirements based on information from internal teams and user 
research
● Ensure that Spacebox’s digital products both look great and operate smoothly
● Identify new product improvement opportunities
● Modify and revise existing designs to meet changing preferences and evolving 
business direction
● Collaborate with PMs and engineers to sharply define what needs to be built – 
juggling user demands while keeping an eye on business target
● Present product design ideas to cross-functional teams and senior leadership
● Align design prowess with product life cycles and business blueprints

 

What are we looking for in you?
● Hungry-to-learn-and-grow-mindset
● Strong sense of responsibility and self-motivated team player
● Creative problem-solving skills
● Excellent communication skills
● Proven experience in all phases of the design process including user research, 
copywriting, wireframing, prototyping, visual design, interaction design, and 
usability testing
● Project Management skills; Relentless focus on your timelines and resources
● An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
● Strong attention to detail
● Ability to collaborate with cross-functional team members
● Ability to collect and interpret both qualitative and quantitative feedback
● Passion for design; not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways 
to improve
● Dynamic, creative personality, effective at engaging and influencing a variety of 
audiences
● Provide assistance to product engineers when needed
● Recommend new tools and technologies by staying abreast of the latest trends 
and techniques
● Immediately available is preferred

job.title: Relationship Manager, Corporate Cash Management
job.abstract: Reporting to the Team Head, you will be responsible for accelerating the acquisition of new non-borrowing corporate / SME accounts to drive CASA, FX
job.content:
Description:

Reporting to the Team Head, you will be responsible for accelerating the acquisition of new non-borrowing corporate / SME accounts to drive CASA, FX, operating flow, insurance and investment in order to align with the commercial Account Acquisition Strategy of the Bank.

Responsibilities:

  • Explore the business opportunities from the existing non-borrowing account in SME and deepen the relationship
