job.title: Senior Finance Manager
job.abstract: We are seeking to recruit a Senior Finance Manager to join our Finance team based in Hong Kong.
job.content:
About us

We are 10 Design, (part of Egis’ Architecture Line), a dynamic and innovative architecture and master planning practice. With over 400 architects and designers strategically located across three regional headquarters in London, Hong Kong, and San Francisco, as well as six additional studios in key global markets.

We design and deliver projects at all scales and complexities. Our diverse portfolio is a testament to our versatility and creativity, featuring a range of sectors, including mixed-use, retail, office, residential, hospitality, transport-oriented development, life sciences, education, civic and cultural. We’re committed to creating inspiring destinations that connect people to their surroundings, enhance the human experience, foster a sense of community, and exceed expectations.

We prioritize economic and social responsibility in all our multicultural projects, striving to create designs that are not only visually stunning but also environmentally sustainable and socially equitable.

About the role

We are seeking to recruit a Senior Finance Manager to join our Finance team based in Hong Kong.  The successful candidate will manage daily finance, accounting and controlling activities, drive and manage the monthly reporting, quarterly forecasts, annual budget and mid-term strategy, and project implementation, and the CFO to provide financial insights and solutions to continuously improve operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage the preparation and finalization of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), tax laws and company policies;
  • Develop and implement internal control policies and procedures to safeguard company assets, enhance the accuracy of financial data, and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements;
  • Manage and drive the budgeting process, quarterly forecasting process, and mid-term strategy planning process including the creation, analysis, and review of financial forecasts and the development of strategies to address variances between budgeted and actual figures;
  • Lead the internal and external audit process, coordinating with auditors and tax representatives to ensure the efficient and timely completion of annual audits and tax filings, and address any findings or recommendations and/ or mitigate any tax risks;
  • Manage the company cashflow and optimize the capital efficiency;
  • Coordinate tax planning and compliance activities;
  • Perform periodic review of accounts payable and receivable, ensuring transactions are processed efficiently, accurately, and in compliance with financial policies and procedures;
  • Implement and maintain financial information systems to improve reporting capabilities, operational efficiency, and data integrity, including the integration of new financial software solutions (Oracle and Tagetik).
  • Support processes enhancement across finance and business operation;
  • Provide in-depth analysis (e.g. Revenue, GP and SG&A) of financial performance with quality commentary;
  • Report to and support CFO being a business partner to work closely with business stakeholders to support company decision with facts and figures.

Ideal candidates must have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or Accounting with professional accreditation such as HKICPA or equivalent;
  • Large audit firms or MNC experience in Architecture industry will be highly considered;
  • Over 8 years relevant working experience with at least 3 years people management experience with a team of 10 or more;
  • Reasonable knowledge of Project accounting;
  • Strong hands-on experience of Excel and PPT, and sound knowledge of Oracle are preferred;
  • Organizational skills with the ability to set priorities, manage deadlines and work under pressure;
  • Leadership, analytical & problem-solving skills to direct the team to accomplish finance and accounting duties and tasks in meeting deadlines;
  • Business conscious, willing to accept challenges and changes as well as detail-minded;
  • High level of integrity and a sense of confidentiality;
  • Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese;
  • Immediately available will be a definite advantage.

 

www.10design.co

bullets: MNC experience will be highly considered;
Strong hands-on experience will be a definite advantage;
Proficient in Excel will be highly considered;

job.content:
從1936年開始，本會與香港一同成長，並一直堅守｢培育新一代　攜手創未來」的宗旨及使命，為兒童及青少年的福祉盡一分力。為了配合本會發展，現誠邀優秀人才加入我們的團隊。有關詳細資料，請瀏覽本會網站www.bgca.org.hk。

職責：

  • 照顧8名4至18歲因家庭問題而需要入住兒童之家的兒童及青少年
  • 指導及照顧家舍內的兒童及青少年，包括日常起居生活、飲食作息及功課輔導等
  • 為宿生提供個別關顧，促進宿生身心靈健康成長
  • 協助社工提供有關兒童及青少年的行為輔導及推行各項活動
  • 如有需要，會調往本會於其他地區設立的兒童之家工作
  • 處理由督導指派的其他工作
  • 工作地點: 天水圍/沙田/慈雲山

要求：

  • (i)香港中學文憑考試五科包括中文、英文、數學、通識達二級或
  • (ii)香港中學會考五科合格包括中文、英文(2007年前之"課程乙")、數學或具同等學歷或
  • (iii)副學士、高級文憑或同等學歷或以上程度
  • 正家長須為已婚男性或已婚女性，必須一對夫婦入住家舍，及可與不超過兩名4至18歲子女一同入住
  • 夫婦兩人性格均須成熟穩重，喜愛照顧兒童、具興趣培育、煮食等經驗，無不良嗜好

job.title: Finance/Wealth Management Graduate Trainee 財務規劃顧問
job.abstract: CYN Branch深明各有獨特之處的個體，能成就更優秀的整體。因此，我們樂見團隊中有來自不同文化背景的成員。在這裡你將擁有更高的收入，更彈性的時間，更多發展和學習的機會。無論你是來自不同的行業，還是剛投身社會，只要願意接受挑戰，我們將全力助你以您獨特的方式創造改變。
job.content:
Key Responsibilities

  • Conducts Fundamental Analysis to Help Develop Advice and Guidance on Financial Planning Strategies
  • Keeps Up to the Market and Regulations to Remain Knowledgeable on Industry Standards
  • Applies Previous Experiences to Add Value to a Growing Sector of Insurance Advisor Services
  • Gains Exposure to Every Facet of Wealth Management, Liquidity Management and  Relationship Management
  • Learns Team Management and Sales Management through Utilizing the Full Capabilities of the Company
  • Displays Creativity in Formulating Integrated Risk Investment Solutions through the Use of a Wide Range of Products and Services

 

Boost Your Career and Income with AIA

(Full Time)

  • Diversified Environment, Flexible Working Hours
  • Exceptional Income Potential, One-of-a-kind Financing Scheme
  • Comprehensive Medical Coverage, Insurance & Retirement Plans
  • Best In-Class Training Delivered by Industry Leading Tools
  • Benefit from Exclusive Recognition, Privilege & Rewards
  • Accelerate Career Growth within a Short Span of Time

(Internship)

  • An Guaranteed Official Internship Certificate
  • Customized Training and Flexible Internship Schedule
  • At Least Two Business Licenses throughout the Internship
  • Chance for Receiving Return Offer to Unlock Full Benefits
  • Various Milestones to Receive Extra Bonus

 

About AIA

  1. AIA的今日成就可追溯至1919年於上海的發源地，屹立亞洲逾100年。為最大的泛亞地區獨立上市人壽保險集團。1931年在香港開展業務，至今覆蓋亞洲18個市場。
  2. 我們屢獲殊榮，深得業界認同，傲視同儕。改善上億人的生活，人壽保險業界的卓越標準。
  3. AIA作為香港聯交所最大上市公司，自2010年上市後，市值升逾四倍，總資產值達 3,400億美元，為恆生指數第二大成分股。

 

About Challenge District

  1. 「精英團隊，執行細節，追求卓越」是AIA "Challenge Family" 核心營運理念。
  2. "Challenge Family" 精英輩出，依靠高標準的人才選拔，眾成員學歷皆為學士以上；配合最專業的培訓，卓越的配套支援，區域不斷栽培出更多獨當一面的管理人才。
     
  3. 「挑戰家族」獲獎記錄首屈一指。連續12年取得行業最高榮譽「最高百萬圓桌會會員比例、最多百萬圓桌會會員人數的區域大獎」。業界唯一四度摘得「超級傑出區域」第一名的殊榮。

 

About the Leader

Cynthia CHAN，Senior District Manager，香港金融財富管理Professional Training Instructor、香港中文大學高级工商管理硕士。自06年將管理哲學帶入團隊，連續二十載橫掃各大獎項。2021年更獲得香港最傑出資深經理排名第一。

Cynthia致力培育新一代優秀人才，團隊成員皆為「年輕有為」的學士及碩士，並相繼取得MDRT、COT及TOT的榮譽。除剛畢業的大學生，團隊有具備金融、經濟學、市場學、法律等不同背景的優才為客戶提供最專業的服務。而作為業界的領跑者，Cynthia為成員提供度身定造的專業培訓、自主的工作模式，注重實踐及反饋，令新人能快速掌握行業知識及溝通技巧。發揚因材施教的團隊文化，CYN Branch將助你在事業上快速起步，成為卓越管理者，實現「財富自由」的目標。


Reasons for Running your Wealth Management Business

  • 我們的人員比銀行、證券等金融從業者擁有更靈活的時間和空間。自由建立團隊，發展終身事業，成為行業企業家。
  • 不單助您發展事業，我們希望照顧您工作和生活的平衡。我們為員工提供一系列的活動及措施，助您在思維、情緒、規劃上都各得其所。
  • 我們正建立可持續發展的將來。據數據顯示，未來10年間香港及內地將迎最大退休潮。透過多年來完備的保障及財富管理方案，我們已為上億人的生活帶來積極影響。
  • 2019年起，政府實施多項市場政策以支持行業。2020年更推動服務中心在大灣區設立。隨著疫情迎來轉折點，面對龐大且不斷增長的市場，空前的機遇已經出現。

 

想要創造改變，實現財務自由，選擇平台很重要。通關契機下，香港四大產業之一的金融保險業再度興起。依靠友邦雄厚的實力和卓越的亞洲資源，現在就是你“低成本創業”的絕佳機會。

Begin the career of your dreams now

All personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only and will be treated in accordance with our Personal Data Policy. All applications will be destroyed after 12 months.
 


* Welcome both Hong Kong Residents and IANG Visa Holders - Help with the Renewal of IANG Visa *

job.title: Programme Executive (Mental Health and Psychosocial Support –  PFA Training)
job.abstract: Supports the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Service in programme implementation, training service administrative and operation matters.
job.content:
Job Purpose:

The position supports the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Service (MHPSS) in programme implementation, training service administrative and operation matters. 

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the implementation and logistic support for Psychological First Aid trainings and psychoeducation programme; 
  • Assist in organizing public events and and activities;
  • Provide support in the operation of volunteer services; 
  • Provide administrative support, including statistic and data entry, progress reporting and meeting minutes, inventory control and prepare other documentary work to support the operational needs;
  • Undertake any other duties as assigned by Supervisor(s) from time to time.

 

Requirements:

  • Graduate of Higher Diploma or Associate Degree in Social Science, Humanities, Health Studies, Education, Community Services or related disciplines.
  • Applicant process of 2 years of post-graduation working experience and completion of HKCEE/ HKDSE (minimum five passes, including English, Chinese and Mathematics) equivalent or above.
  • Volunteering or work experience in social service sector is an advantage.
  • Keen internet user with high proficiency in using Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Proficient in written and spoken English and Chinese (including Putonghua).
  • Self-motivated, strong sense of responsibility, independent, able to work in a multi-disciplinary team and under pressure.
  • Good team players with excellent interpersonal and communications skills.
  • Five-day work per week, may need to perform duties on weekends or evenings if required
  • Fresh Graduate will also be considered

 

Contract Period: 1 year (renewable)

 

Fringe Benefits:

Fringe benefits including generous annual leave, marriage leave, compassionate leave, caring leave, medical and dental benefits (including dependents), Employer MPF voluntary contribution, and a discretionary incentive payment (where applicable) will be offered to the right candidates.

 

Please send application together with full curriculum vitae and expected salary to the Head of Human Resources, 9/F, Hong Kong Red Cross Headquarters, 19 Hoi Ting Road, West Kowloon, Hong Kong or email to hr@redcross.org.hk.

 

Review of applications will start from 19 Oct 2024 and until the post is filled.

 

Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with Agency’s data protection policy for recruitment purposes only. Applicants not contacted within 4 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful and all related information will be kept on our files up to a period of 6 months.

job.title: Human Resource Officer / Manager
job.abstract: The No.1 Employment Agency in Hong Kong. We have branch offices throughout Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories
job.content:
Job Responsibilities:

  • Lead, oversee and manage the human resources functions, including but not limited to manpower planning, talent acquisition, performance management (Key Performance Indicators) and employee relations;
  • Drive and manage HR projects. Proactively communicate with project hosts for smooth strategies execution;
  • Develop and establish short- and long-term HR strategies to ensure sustainable organization growth;
  • Recommend, develop and schedule training and development courses;
  • Design and conduct internal / external training;
  • Provide advice, assistance and follow-up on company policies, procedures, and documentation; 
  • Interview job applicants; review application/resume; evaluate applicant skills and make recommendations regarding applicant's qualifications; 
  • Conduct and analysis the Exit Interview for resigned staff;
  • Recommend, develop and maintain human resource data base, computer software systems, and manual filing systems;
  • Evaluate and recommend improvements to staff benefit programs;
  • Oversees and provide the services of HR & Office Administration issues;
  • Perform ad-hoc assignments.

 

Requirements:

  • Bachelor Degree in Human Resources or related disciplines;
  • At least 3 years of HR experience in sizable companies (+200 staffs);
  • Experience in design, development and implementation of Key Performance Indicators;
  • Good command of verbal and written English and Chinese with strong communications, interpersonal and presentation skills.
  • Good command of Chinese word processing and proficient PC skills, such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Detail-minded, well-organized and with good time management skill;
  • Strong sense of responsibilities and commitment, well-organized, effective communications skills in interacting with people at all levels.

 

Company Awards:

  • 2024 Happiness at Work Promotional Scheme Award
  • 2022-24 Caring Company Award

 

The No.1 Employment Agency in Hong Kong. We have branch offices throughout Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories, including North Point, Sai Wan Ho, Fortress Hill, Causeway Bay, Wan Chai, Central, South Horizons, Whampoa, Mong Kok, Mei Foo, Lam Tin, Tseung Kwan O, Tsuen Wan, Sha Tin, Tuen Mun, and Yuen Long. (Your requirements will be considered)

For candidates, please send your resume and salary expectations via WhatsApp to 9141 9588 or apply through the "APPLY NOW" link.

job.title: Teacher of Mathematics (Nov 2024 - Jun 2025) - King George V School
job.abstract: Contributing to our collaborative and professional environment by enacting our four elements of trust – compassion, competence, communication
job.content:
At King George V School (KGV), our purpose is based on our belief that every student can ‘be their own remarkable…’ This drives our vision to create a ‘school for one’, a place where each and every person engages in remarkable learning to achieve at high levels and be the best they can be.

Our school is also about continual improvement. As an agile school, we collaborate and innovate to make a difference in the communities we serve and lead. KGV School is part of the English Schools Foundation (ESF), the largest provider of English-medium international education in Hong Kong. Our school delivers the IB Middle Years Programme (MYP) in years 7 to 9, the iGCSE in years 10 and 11, after which our students progress to study either the IB Diploma Programme or the more vocationally oriented BTEC applied learning programme in years 12 and 13.

At KGV School, all our staff are leaders and we shape our culture by:

  • Modelling and maximising learning through building capacity in others and participating as a learner;
  • Contributing to our collaborative and professional environment by enacting our four elements of trust – compassion, competence, communication and consistency;
  • Accepting personal accountability for our behaviours and the quality of our outcomes.

We are looking for a Teacher of Mathematics with experience of MYP, IGCSE and IB Diploma courses. This role requires the successful candidate to be flexible in teaching whole classes, providing smaller group interventions and supporting the Mathematics Department in resourcing and administration.

This position is a full-time temporary contract from November 2024 to June 2025 with the possibility of an extension to August 2026.  


Requirements

  • Bachelor Degree in Mathematics or similar, plus a recognised Postgraduate teaching qualification, or equivalent;
  • Ability to teach MYP, IGCSE and IBDP level Mathematics;
  • Experience and ability to use data on student learning to modify curriculum, teaching and assessment provision;
  • Effective interpersonal skills and ability to form positive relationships with students, staff and parents;
  • Contribute strongly to the Mathematics Department Professional Learning Teams collaboration which is focused on improving student learning;
  • Monitor the impact of teaching strategies through collaborative enquiry and data-informed conversations;
  • Ability to lead or support extra-curricular activities as part of the whole-school CAS programme and attend school functions as required.

Applicants must be a permanent Hong Kong resident or possess a valid visa to work in Hong Kong.

By applying for this position, your application may be considered for other opportunities within ESF. 

ESF is an Equal Opportunities Employer

The English Schools Foundation (ESF) is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity. ESF will not discriminate on the basis of age, race, colour, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, religion, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, creed, citizenship or any other status protected by local laws or regulations.

Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the ESF's Personal Data Policy, a copy of which will be provided upon request.

Aligned with the recommendations of the International Task Force on Child Protection, we hold ourselves to a high standard of effective recruiting practices with specific attention to child protection.

SecondaryTeacherMathematics

SecondaryTeacher

About Us

The English Schools Foundation (ESF) is the largest English-medium international school organisation in Hong Kong. Our 22 schools and comprehensive programme of extra-curricular activities bring out the best in every student through a personalised approach to learning and by inspiring curious minds.

There are over 18,000 students from 75 different nationalities in ESF kindergartens, primary, secondary and all-through schools.

www.esf.edu.hk

About the Team

At ESF King George V School (KGV), our purpose is based on our belief that every student can ‘be their own remarkable…’ as they achieve, improve and learn. Our vision is to create a ‘school for one’. A place where each and every person engages in remarkable learning to achieve at high levels and be the best they can be.

Our school is also about continual improvement. As an agile school, we collaborate and innovate to make a difference in the communities we serve and lead.

The school is well known for its commitment to developing all aspects of student life and it has a fine tradition in sport, music, drama, dance, community service, charity work and environmental sustainability. Our school has a very strong House system, which is run and inspired by our students and provides a wide range of learning opportunities and activities.

http://www.kgv.edu.hk

job.title: Audiologist/Radiographer/Sonographer(50-90K/Private medical centre)
job.abstract: Our client are providing highest quality of services to premium customers and looking for a high calibre to join the team as Radiographer/Sonographer
job.content:
Our client is an established private medical company, they are providing highest quality of services to premium customers and looking for a high calibre to join the team as Sonographer/Radiographer

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

Radiographer

  • University graduate in diagnostic radiography from a local university or equivalent
  • Registration in HK Radiographers Board
  • Provide imaging services for patients and handle patients’ enquiries
  • We will provide training in MRI and Mammography
  • Fixed rest day on Sunday and public holidays. Night-shift is NOT required

 Sonographer

  • Performs medical sonography examinations; adhering to best practice of ultrasound technique.
  • Prepares preliminary diagnostic ultrasound reports.
  • Registered sonographer of ARDMS or equivalent
  • 2 years or above solid experience in ultrasound exam
  • For Ultrasound Radiographer, should be Part II or above registered with the HK Radiographers Board and minimum 1 year experience in Ultrasound

Audiologist

  • Counsel hearing-impaired persons and give advice to their relatives,
    particularly parents of hearing-impaired children
  • Explain audiological services and hearing solutions in a professional
    manner easily understood by the clients and professionals
  • Select and administer diagnostic hearing tests; operate diagnostic
    equipment; determine type and degree of hearing impairment and hearing handicap for newborn to elderly
  • Provide hearing aid evaluation, orientation and counselling; advise on the selection and use of hearing-aids and other appropriate remedial and rehabilitation measures
  • Master degree or above in Audiology, local degree or overseas equivalent
    qualification
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with passion
    in providing professional health care, learning new knowledge, providing
    professional service and team work spirit.
  • Fluent in Cantonese and English Language. Putonghua is preferred
  • Audiologist in Accredited Register preferred.

job.title: 全職導師/老師 Full-time Tutor/Teacher (小學/中學)
job.abstract: We are seeking passionate and experienced tutors to join our team. We are helping students of all ages and levels achieve their academic goals.
job.content:
我們正在擴展教育團隊，誠邀有意擔任各階段教育事務的專業加入我們團隊：

職責：

  1. 教導小學功輔班及專科班 及 中學全科班及專科班 (不需要100%任教全部課程，視乎老師專業及經驗編制教節)；
  2. 帶領學生進行課堂、管理課室秩序、定時與家長聯絡匯報；
  3. 協助製作教材及編排課程；
  4. 視乎能力安排協助主管管理中心營運；
  5. 定期評估學生的學術優勢和弱點，制定個性化的學習計劃；
  6. 監察學生表現和出勤記錄，根據需要定時調整教學策略；
  7. 與中心的教育團隊合作，分享最佳實踐並實施有效的教學方法；
  8. 為所有學生營造積極、鼓勵和支持的學習環境。

要求：

  1. 曾有一年或以上補習社工作經驗優先考慮；
  2. 具備相關學科的學士學位或同等學歷，並有良好的學術成績；
  3. 在香港中學文憑試相關科目取得優良成績，香港中學會考和香港高級程度會考成績達到C級或以上；
  4. 具備優秀的溝通能力、組織能力和團隊合作精神；
  5. 具責任心、耐性，能帶領小組學習；
  6. 具豐富的教育經驗或有志投身於教育界發展；
  7. 能夠適應不同學生的獨特需求，調整教學風格；
  8. 具備強大的組織和時間管理能力；
  9. 對教育充滿熱情，真誠希望幫助學生取得學業成功；

待遇及福利：

  1. 良好的晉升機制和明確的職業發展道路
  2. 提供津貼和獎金分配計劃
  3. 公眾假期休息
  4. 高於市場水平的入職薪酬
  5. 定期公司聚餐，良好工作氣氛及溝通文化, 重視團隊精神
  6. 提供完善在職培訓, 快速掌握教學及行政各項重點

 

申請者請將您的履歷連同學業成績單，以及您期望薪酬，通過點擊“立即申請”來提交。所有收集的信息將按照保密協議處理，僅用於招聘目的

job.title: Radiographer (MRI / Mammography)[Part time / Full time]
job.abstract:
About EC Healthcare​
EC Healthcare is Hong Kong's largest non-hospital medical service provider,
 leveraging its core businesses of preventive...
job.content:
About EC Healthcare​

EC Healthcare is Hong Kong's largest non-hospital medical service provider, leveraging its core businesses of preventive and precision medicine, and committed to developing medical artificial intelligence by integrating its multi-disciplinary medical services. Aligning with our mission - to bring health, beauty and happiness to everyone, the Group’s high-end branding and quality customer services offer customers safe and effective medical services with professionalism. The Group is a constituent stock of the Hang Seng Composite Index and the MSCI Hong Kong Small Cap Index. The Group currently operates 154 service points, providing one-stop medical and healthcare services. The total GFA is around 557,000 sq ft.​

The Group provides a full range of services and products under its well-known brands, including aesthetic medical solutions, primary spine and physiotherapy care clinics, health management centre, vaccine centre, dental centre, diagnostic and imaging centre, oncology treatment centre, obstetrics and gynaecology specialist centre, paediatric centre, cardiology centre, medical laboratories, professional hair care centre, ophthalmology centre and veterinary hospital and imaging centre.​

To support our hyper growth in the healthcare space, we are looking for a capable and independent individual to join our Radiographer team. 

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

  • University graduate in diagnostic radiography from a local university or equivalent
  • Registration in HK Radiographers Board
  • Provide imaging services for patients and handle patients’ enquiries
  • Experience in MRI or Mammography is preferred
  • Professional working attitude and motivated to learn new technology
  • Independent, self-motivated and strong sense of responsibility
  • Have good patient handling skill
  • We will provide training in MRI and Mammography
  • Fixed rest day on Sunday and public holidays. Night-shift is NOT required

We offer a competitive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience to the right candidate. Interested parties please send your full resume with last and expected salary via “APPLY NOW”.​

Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Applicants not contacted within 8 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful. For further information on EC Healthcare, please visit our website: https://echealthcare.com/en​

job.title: Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.abstract: Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.content:
Some careers prize diversity more than others.

If you're looking for a career where you will be respected as an individual and valued for the contributions you make, join HSBC and discover how diversity drives our success. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) helps deliver on HSBC's purpose of opening up a world of opportunity by providing our customers with borderless banking and world-class wealth management through best-in-class, mobile-first capabilities and exceptional people. Our international network and breadth of expertise enable us to support individuals, families, business owners, investors and entrepreneurs. Wealth and Personal Banking has four key business areas responsible for efficiently bringing the best of HSBC to our clients through a broad and relevant suite of wealth and retail banking capabilities: Asset Management, Global Private Banking & Wealth, HSBC Life, Retail Banking & Strategy and COO & Digital Transformation.

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier.

In this role, you will be responsible for working collectively with Premier Relationship Manager on developing and maintaining relationships with our Premier clients through active management of client portfolios and ensuring solutions continually meet with customer's needs.

The Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier is also responsible for attracting new customers by understanding their financial needs and delivering superior standards of service quality. The key to success in this role is having the customer centricity mindset, industry expertise and business acumen to deliver in accordance with HSBC's values. All these are unique in making your career journey different from any other.

Principal Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Premier Relationship Manager to develop and nurture relationships with Premier clients
  • Provide efficient, high quality professional services and ensure a consistent delivery of the Global Premier core service standards and proposition
  • Support Premier Relationship Managers to conduct customer needs activity planning and portfolio management to improve customer satisfaction
  • Promote HSBC Premier proposition for deposits and portfolio growth
  • Initiate and maintain effective communication with paired Premier Relationship Managers
  • Assisting Premier Relationship Manager on managing, developing and retaining quality client relationship
  • Identify opportunities for wealth and credit reviews to optimize portfolio performance and meet the needs of the customers
  • Understand and adhere to local and global compliance
  • Maintain the levels of operational integrity required by HSBC and adhere to the Business Principles and Values of HSBC

*Remark: Multiple work locations available across branches in Hong Kong, Kowloon, and New Territories

Requirements

  • University level education, preferably in finance, business or a related discipline
  • Proven frontline experience in customer serving at a financial institution
  • Excellent customer service skill and mindset, with strong attention to detail
  • Good knowledge of retail banking and wealth management products
  • Team player with commercial orientation
  • Clear view on how to work with Compliance, Credit & Risk and Internal Control to ensure a balanced risk operating environment
  • Holder of relevant insurance and investment licenses and compliance with related Continuing Professional Development (CPD) requirements
  • Fluency in both English and Cantonese, with knowledge of Mandarin is preferred
  • To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Hong Kong is required

You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.
http://www.hsbc.com/careers

HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

bullets: One of the world's leading international banks

paragraphs: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited is the founding member of the HSBC Group. Established in 1865 to finance the growing trade between Asia and Europe, it has become the biggest bank incorporated in Hong Kong.

The bank provides a range of personal, commercial and corporate banking financial services across Asia. HSBC is known in Cantonese as “Wayfoong”, which means “focus of wealth” or “abundance of remittances.”

job.title: Mainscale Class Teacher (Jan 2025 - June 2025) - Bradbury School
job.abstract: The English Schools Foundation (ESF) is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity.
job.content:
Job Description

Bradbury School is looking for a temporary maternity cover Mainscale Class Teacher.  This is a temporary contract position starting from January 2025 to the end of June 2025.

The main role of the classroom teacher is to maximise student learning and development through the planning, preparation and teaching of programmes which meet students’ individual learning needs and achieve specific student outcomes. Teachers teach a range of student abilities and classes and are accountable for the effective delivery of their programmes. The classroom teacher engages in critical reflection in order to improve their knowledge and skills to better engage students and improve their learning.


Main Accountabilities

Teaching and Assessment:

  • Planning lessons and sequences of lessons to meet student’s individual learning needs and to ensure student’s progression
  • Using a range of appropriate strategies for teaching and learning and classroom management
  • Use flexible groupings and structured inquiry to deliver high- quality lessons in line with the IBO philosophy
  • Maintain a well- organised and stimulating learning environment
  • Use technology to effectively enhance learning
  • Using information about prior attainment to set expectations for students
  • Using a range of assessment and reporting methods that show student’s achievement in relation to learning outcomes
  • Providing clear and constructive feedback to students and their parents and caregivers

Wider professional roles:

  • Planning and engaging in professional learning activities that support school and systematic priorities
  • Taking responsibility for own professional development and using the outcomes to improve teaching and students’ learning
  • Making an active contribution to the policies and aspirations of the school
  • Ensuring administration of classroom procedures is completed efficiently
  • Collaborating with members of the school community to build a team environment that supports students’ learning

Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Assisting with or managing an aspect of daily school management
  • Assisting year level co-ordinators, curriculum co-ordinators, student management co-ordinators, principal and vice principal with the performance of specific functions
  • Assisting with or managing a specialist function such as sport, careers, student welfare, excursions or camps co-ordination
  • Supervising a range of student activities including support and welfare programmes

Requirements

  • Bachelor Degree in Education, or
  • Bachelor Degree in any subjects with PGCE (Postgraduate Certificate of Education), or equivalent
  • Relevant teaching experience within a recognised educational organisation

ESF is unable to sponsor a work VISA as this is a temporary position.  Applicants must have the right to live and work in HK as ESF cannot sponsor a visa.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and offers may be extended prior to the job closing date.

By applying for this position, your application may be considered for other opportunities (senior-level roles, head of department, etc.) within ESF.

ESF is an Equal Opportunities Employer

The English Schools Foundation (ESF) is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity. ESF will not discriminate on the basis of age, race, colour, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, religion, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, creed, citizenship or any other status protected by local laws or regulations.

Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the ESF's Personal Data Policy, a copy of which will be provided upon request.

Aligned with the recommendations of the International Task Force on Child Protection, we hold ourselves to a high standard of effective recruiting practices with specific attention to child protection.

PrimaryTeacher

PrimaryTeacherMainscale

 

About Us

The English Schools Foundation (ESF) is the largest English-medium international school organisation in Hong Kong. Our 22 schools and comprehensive programme of extra-curricular activities bring out the best in every student through a personalised approach to learning and by inspiring curious minds.

There are over 18,000 students from 75 different nationalities in ESF kindergartens, primary, secondary and all-through schools.

www.esf.edu.hk

About the Team

ESF Bradbury School offers a safe, caring and fun environment, providing children with an all-round education of the very highest quality. We pride ourselve on The calibre of all of our staff and the positive, encouraging approach in our classrooms produce outstanding results. We encourage our children to become independent thinkers who care about the world around them – through an active sustainability approach – and to develop the skills required to become lifelong learners and leaders. We place a high importance on partnership with parents and see this as a cornerstone of how we operate on a daily basis. Our Parent Teacher Association is active and hardworking, contributing much to the life of our school. We are governed by a knowledgeable School Council.

http://www.bradbury.edu.hk

Bachelor Degree in Education, or in any subjects with PGCE

job.title: CFO
job.abstract: 負責投融資對接及港股ipo
job.content:
Job Responsibilities:

  •  Be familiar with the operations of the capital market, provide advice and decision support for significant investment, financing, mergers, and acquisitions activities of the company, and participate in risk assessment, guidance, monitoring, and control;
  • Responsible for advancing financing and coordinating pre-, during, and post-listing matters, maintaining investor relations post-listing, information disclosure, and matters related to refinancing after listing;
  •  Responsible for maintaining and developing external relationships with shareholders, investors, brokerage firms, and investment banks, as well as communicating and coordinating matters between the group and directors, regulatory authorities, stock exchanges, and government departments;
  • Responsible for team building and daily management of the group’s finance team, building and leading an efficient finance team, and cultivating team members' professional skills and leadership abilities.

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or above in finance, economics, or financial management;
  • Over 5 years of experience as a CFO, more than 5 years of experience in a Big Four accounting firm, CPA, and CFA certificates are preferred;
  • Experience in leading a company through an IPO on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in the capacity of a CFO;
  • Possess good professional ethics and excellent communication skills.

 

KN Group was founded in 2014, with its headquarters in Hong Kong, China. The company has established R&D centers in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Jakarta, and other locations, focusing on providing technological services for upgrading the financial industry. Over the past decade, by analyzing a vast amount of user data, the company has developed a unique big data model of consumer behavior, offering technical support to various licensed financial institutions. Leveraging its extensive model experience, KN Group has expanded its business globally, including countries such as Thailand, the Philippines, Pakistan, Indonesia, and Mexico. In these countries, the company has acquired multiple financial licenses, evolving into a leading technology group that integrates AI innovation with global financial services.

Our benefits include: 

  • Annual leave and company holidays
  • MPF, commercial insurance and life insurance
  • Comprehensive staff engagement programs, e.g. monthly team-building activities, annual travel and core team-building activities 
  • Afternoon tea, beverage bar
  • Flexible working hours
  • Training and development opportunities


 

All information received will be kept in strict confidence and will be treated only for employment-related purposes.

The personal data that we collect and/or hold (whether contained in this application form or otherwise obtained) includes your personal details, contact information, education and training details, employment details, financial details, and information on your social circumstances.

job.title: Senior Marketing Manager
job.abstract: Design and Implement the Marketing strategy for Greater China (Hong Kong, Macau and China) and lead the implementation of all Marketing activities.
job.content:
WHO WE ARE 

Avolta is the world’s leading travel experience player. With a traveler-centric philosophy and a geographically diverse network, the travel retail and F&B company addresses the needs of up to 2.3 billion passengers each year, with 5,500 outlets in more than 75 countries across six continents. Guided by their Destination 2027 strategy and boosted by their recent combination with travel F&B giant Autogrill, the company is well positioned to realise their ambition to create a Travel Experience Revolution through their many locations at airports, motorways, cruise lines, seaports and railway stations amongst others.

 

Avolta - The Nuance Group (HK) Limited

 

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

Design and Implement the Marketing strategy for Greater China (Hong Kong, Macau and China) that supports the Company’s values and vision, lead the implementation of all activities defined in the Annual Marketing Plan with all involved departments.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

General

  • Strategic design, budget, and implement the marketing plan for the Greater China region
  • Collaborate with commercial team to uncover insights for developing marketing and branding strategies 
  • Lead development of marketing strategy by working closely with clients, managers, creatives, content providers, and distribution partners to create effective plans 
  • Spearhead the execution and implementation of marketing campaigns, tracking, results reporting, analyses, and recommendations
  • Manage conception, development, and implementation of promotional programs to drive customer interest and sales
  • Understand key performance metrics and tracking tools for market research, forecasts, competitor analyses, campaign results, and consumer trends, and translate results into actionable insights for marketing team
  • Supervise and follow-up with the implementation of in-store marketing and visual merchandising
  • Ensure the proper execution and implantation of all marketing activities and communications
  • Any other ad hoc requirements

 

External Partnerships

  • Spearhead complementary partnerships with public and private agencies to expand customer reach
  • Coordinate Advertising income strategy

 

Management, Leadership and HR

  • Proactive in alignment, support and coordination with countries
  • Lead and develop the people within Greater China Marketing community
  • Accountable for reporting results of Greater China Marketing Community to Greater China Commercial Director
  • Specific responsibilities as required by direct manager

 

REQUIREMENTS

Experience

  • Required:
    • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Communications with at least 7 years of experience in leading a marketing team in a retail company / fast consumer goods
    • Proven track record in creating successful global marketing activities, campaigns, etc.
    • Well organized
    • Proven ability to plan and manage budgets
    • Well-versed in managing below-the-line marketing communications, sales-driven promotions and corporate events
    • Ensure the understanding and adherence to standard policies and procedures of the marketing community
  • Desirable: MBA

 

Specific Requirements

  • Motivator with a proven track record of successfully developing people
  • Strong market and customer focus
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Leadership skills

 

Languages

  • Fluent English and Chinese (Putonghua) – written and spoken; other languages would be an asset

 

Send your CV at “Apply now button”                                   

For Company information, please visit www.avoltaworld.com

job.title: Outsource Accounting Senior Manager
job.abstract: Are you ready to take your career to the next level as an Outsource Accounting Senior Manager at our company, join us and be part of a team!
job.content:
Our client, a global network accounting firm (top mid-tier firm) is looking for a highly energised and passionate leader to build, lead and grow the Outsourced Accounting Business Solution arm in our Hong Kong office. It serves internationally active businesses through value-added managed services (corporate secretarial, payroll, accounting and cloud digitalisation). 

Attention to Accounting and Finance professionals who aspire to be Business Advisors to Growing Businesses.

Outsource Accounting Senior Manager – Professional Firm 

Responsibilities:

  • Heavily involve in leading our HK firm’s outsource accounting practice.
  • Identify and optimize opportunities for business growth and development within outsource accounting unit to ensure continued success and expansion of the business.
  • Being a professional accounting and finance expertise in meeting basic to complex accounting and financial related requirements for the clients
  • Be the subject matter expertise in outsource accounting & finance services including client trends, technology and competitive landscape.
  • Liaise with statutory bodies, banks, and other third-party business partners, as required
  • Responsible for growing both new and existing portfolio of clients. 
  • Passionate in building, driving, leading and growing the business to serve a great diversity of clients in various industries.
  • Streamline all workflow processes within your department to ensure prompt and professional services.
  • To develop, expand and build network and effective relationships to improve opportunities for cross-referrals and local/ regional development.
  • Managing all aspects of accounting engagements including planning, administration, staff scheduling, staff coaching, execution and closely monitoring engagement progress to ensure pre-agreed deadlines and milestones are met.
  • Ensure that all accounting work for our clients is in compliance with the Hong Kong regulatory requirements.

 
Requirements:

  • Degree holder in Finance, Accounting or related disciplines in postgraduate/professional accounting qualifications
  • Professional Qualifications: Member of HKICPA, ACCA or equivalent overseas leading professional accountants’ institutes
  • At least 8 years’ relevant working experience with prior audit experience working in Professional firm / Big 4 would be added advantages
  • Good knowledge and understanding of cloud accounting solutions (e.g. Xero/QBO/SAGE/Business Central)
  • Ability to build positive relationships with clients and prospective clients at all levels, along with the intermediaries who support them
  • Strong team leader and team player that demonstrates maturity, perseverance and commercial sense
  • Ability to work in a team environment, jointly driving projects with other teammates.
  • Capable to lead engagements involving multiple business lines.
  • A can-do attitude that takes initiative and thrives in a start-up environment
  • Ambitious business focus, self-starter, diligent to details, strong interpersonal skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Cantonese and / or Mandarin is preferred. 
  • Excellence in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word & PowerPoint)

job.title: Assistant Manager – Trust
job.abstract:
Summary and Overview 

Hong Kong, Hong Kong
Permanent
Full Time
Competitive Salary
job.content:
Summary and Overview 

  • Hong Kong, Hong Kong
  • Permanent
  • Full Time
  • Competitive Salary

This job is vital role for the business and will be responsible for working with your own portfolio of key client work.

Main responsibilities and duties

The responsibilities of the role will grow and adapt to changing needs and demands, however below are the core duties of the role, which is not exhaustive; 

  • Maintain and administer the assigned portfolio of Hong Kong Trust, offshore and onshore companies with providing quality client's services 
  • Prepare and Review trust and trust underlying company documents independently
  • Responsible in liaising with clients and different stakeholders such as lawyers, accountants and tax advisers to keep them notified and updated about any changes in trust deed, memorandum and other related matters. 
  • To help mentor and guide junior trust administration team members. 
  • Handle daily administration work and ensure compliance with Equiom's standards, policies and procedures.
  • Ensure compliance with company standards, policies, and procedures.
  • Undertake ad hoc assignments.

 

What will you need to succeed in this role? 

Equiom Group are committed to ensuring that we embrace and develop a culture of Diversity and Inclusion within our global workforce, and therefore we welcome applications from any interested applicant. 

As is to be expected, we are searching for someone who can bring a range of skills and experiences to enhance the team, and to work with the business to deliver on projects, and tasks. As such, there are a few key skills which an applicant should demonstrate; 

  • Relevant professional qualifications such as STEP, ACS or ACIS 
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in handling trust administration and company secretarial matters
  • Fluency in both English and Chinese , Mandarin is preferred
  • PC skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point 
  • High proficiency in both written and spoken English, Mandarin and Cantonese
  • Self-motivated and able to work under pressure 
  • A motivated professional individual with a strong desire to deliver quality technical service 
  • Assertive, approachable individual who can work under pressure adhering to deadlines
  • Excellent organisation, time management and communication skills.
  • Experience in Microsoft Navision (Dynamics NAV) would be advantageous 

 

Please send your application through this link: https://careers.equiomgroup.com/jobs/5085545-trust-assistant-manager?promotion=1197763-trackable-share-link-jobsdb


Who are Equiom Group?

For more than 40 years we have supported high net worth individuals and international corporations to nurture and fulfil their ambitions. We are a global professional services provider, working with private clients, corporate clients and funds to navigate the twists and turns on the journey towards achieving ambitions.

We are proactive and passionate, and we go exceptional service to develop deep and meaningful client relationships, providing an unrivalled breadth of bespoke end-to-end wealth protection and business support services.

We are a business which has rapidly expanded, allowing us to adapt quickly to change and invest in areas as needed. We are on a growth journey, and we are looking for brilliant people to join our team to grow and develop with us.

What should you do now?

If you are interested in this role, please apply now. If you have read the above and are on the fence about whether this is for you; maybe you can do most of the responsibilities, or you have some of the key skills, please get in touch for a confidential conversation about the role and we can talk it through.

Equal Opportunities

Equiom Group is committed to Diversity and Inclusion across our Global business. We welcome applicants from all interested parties, and any reference to qualifications or certifications should be read to be interchangeable with local or international qualifications and certifications, and all applications will be reviewed solely on their merits. All recruitment and selection will be conducted in accordance with prevailing Employment and Equality legislation.

 

Please send your application through this link: https://careers.equiomgroup.com/jobs/5085545-trust-assistant-manager?promotion=1197763-trackable-share-link-jobsdb

job.abstract: Handle customer enquiries and complaints via hotline and digital channels (online chat, email)
job.content:
The role:

  • Handle customer enquiries and complaints via hotline and digital channels (online chat, email)
  • Support lost property enquiry and perform administrative tasks
  • Deliver a seamless customer care experience to the customer
  • Assist with service enquiries and operations at Customer Service Centre as needed
  • Participate in passenger liaison meetings to gather feedback for bus service improvements
  • Perform other ad hoc duties as assigned by supervisors

 

Skills and attributes:

  • HKCEE/HKDSE or above, with experience in customer service and call centers is preferred
  • Passionate about developing a career in the customer service field
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good command of written and spoken Cantonese, English, and Mandarin
  • Proficient in computer applications and Chinese word processing
  • Friendly, customer-focused attitude with good manners
  • Shift duties are required
  • Fresh graduates are welcome

 

Applications, with detailed qualifications, employment history, salary expectations and contact information, should be sent for the attention of Assistant Talent Resourcing Manager, Citybus Limited, 5/F., No. 8 Chong Fu Road, Chai Wan, Hong Kong. Applications can also be e-mailed to careers@citybus.com.hk. 

 

Who are we?

Citybus is a market leading operator of public transport services operating over 1500 buses and employing over 5000 colleagues across our organization to serve over 1 million customers in the city. We are following our core value of “putting our people first”, we know that strong teams and high levels of employee engagement deliver a high-performance culture and a business that will deliver results. Therefore, we invest in our people and technology to provide an extraordinary journey to our customers where we put safety in the first place in the business. Having secured two new ten-year operating franchises to provide public bus services across Hong Kong and won the bid to operate new routes in the New Territories, this is an exciting time to join us as we head into a new chapter of our business.

 

Citybus is an inclusive employer, our team represents a diverse group of performance driven members with experience across various industries. Our goal is to transform traditional bus services with a strategic focus on driving the transition to zero-emission vehicles in an effort to support our sustainability objectives.

job.title: Assistant Manager, Service Management
job.abstract: The incumbent role will manage the resolutions of a wide range of regulatory/customer complaints, market conduct disputes.
job.content:
The incumbent role will work directly with the Head of Quality Enhancement and Service Management to effectively execute Complaint Management Framework within Cigna Healthcare HK, to manage the resolutions of a wide range of regulatory / customer complaints, market conduct disputes of different lines of business lines, as well as service coordination, facilitating relevant parties within Cigna Healthcare HK for compiling better customer experience for our customers. The incumbent will work closely with all key stakeholders and section heads across the Company to manage the resolution of issues and corrective actions whilst also liaising with internal enterprise risk management, legal and compliance and external insurance authorities (including but not limited to IA, ICB, VHIS Office (HHB), Consumer Council, PCPD, Small Claims Tribunal and Legislative Council). The incumbent will also drive service improvement initiatives to improve customer experience and add value to the Company.

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Effectively manage regulatory / customer complaints received via various channels and to ensure entire Service Management team performance on case resolutions;
  • Conduct detailed and thorough investigation into complaints with internal and external parties independently and strictly in accordance with guidelines;
  • Propose resolutions to complaints and ensure they are in line with the overall business strategic goals;
  • Prepare investigation report, analyze customer feedback and conduct root cause analysis, assist in improving service delivery and liaise with respective business / operations teams on the development and implementation of effective remedial actions and long-term solutions;
  • Act as the contact point between the Company and Regulators on Complaint Management, ensure appropriate actions are taken in accordance with the related guidelines / policies set forth by the Company and regulators;
  • Provide regular reports with detailed analysis on handling, and lessons learnt and influence the future actions of service areas to improve performance, overall client satisfaction with the complaint process with first-time resolution.
  • Provide coaching / training to junior staff.

 

Job Requirements:

  • University degree in a related discipline or relevant experience;
  • Minimum of 5 years' work experience in complaint handling or Customer Service Management, where insurance industry is preferred;
  • With qualification in IIQE Paper 1 and 2 will be preferred;
  • Sound knowledge of Insurance Products;
  • Strong self-motivation with good communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills;
  • Strong driver role and ownership to deliver result within tight timeline;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Chinese;
  • High level of customer-centricity mindset with dedication to deliver exceptional quality services for customers;
  • Proficient in PC skill especially Excel and Chinese Word Processing.

paragraphs: Wonderful Sky Financial Group Limited

The Wonderful Sky Financial Group Holdings Limited, “Wonderful Sky” (01260.HK), was listed on the main board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on 30 March 2012, and is the only financial and PR Consultancy firm currently listed.
Professional + Innovative
Financial Communications Pioneer in China

The Group is the only large scale financial PR communications Group in Hong Kong market that can simultaneously provide Public Relation, Investor Relations, Financial Printing, International Roadshow, Brand Promotion, ESG Reporting, Corporate Headhunting,

Equity Investment, Asset Management, Compulsory and Commercial Insurance , in a "10 in 1" full chain service model for one-stop financial communications. We can meet a full spectrum of financial PR communication requirements for IPO clients (those intended

to be listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange) and for non-IPO clients (comprising either private enterprises or those companies listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange). While on the one hand, we render our Chinese customers with updated consultation services

oversea, directing those mainland enterprises to "leap forward", on the other hand, we facilitate international enterprises to accomplish their extraordinary comparative advantages in Asia, and to materialize cross-border collaboration in China.
Integrating A + H Shares Corporate Services

Being the leader of the market, we established a track record of participating on world’s best known projects, such as conglomerate, energy, infrastructure, TMT and clean- tech firm etc. Our dedicated team is a group of highly specialized professionals,

headquartered in Hong Kong; we have regional offices in Beijing, Shanghai and Shenzhen. Wonderful Sky is the one and only consultancy firm which integrating A +H shares corporate services including M&A, IPOs, bond issuance and restructuring. Wonderful Sky

services hundreds of corporate clients in China and Hong Kong, our extensive experience in corporate communication, crisis management, roadshow execution and printing services enables us to offer the most robust suite for our clients. We also provide overseas
advisory for PRC institutions and cross border projects.
Global Network

Wonderful Sky financial Group founded in 1996 in Hong Kong, providing seamless interconnection services to clients in more than 160 countries and regions. Network and resources covered banks, investors, research institutions, regulatory authorities and account,
legal service, financial media etc.
As one of the top investor relations and financial PR company in Asia-Pacific, WSFG is committed to a ‘client first’ culture of professionalism and dedication.
Insights
With our forward insights, we bring the trending market solutions to our clients, we prevent the outbreak of potential crisis and we make swift reactions to challenges.
Innovation
We break the tradition to create innovative ideas for our clients, we think outside the box to assist our clients to become extraordinary.
Dedication
Our highly professional experts are devoted, we grow with our clients, maximising the best value and return, achieving mutual trust and beneficial partnership with our clients.

job.abstract: Work in a young and high performance investment and asset management team. Flat reporting line with down to earth working culture,
job.content:

job.title: VP, Equities Compliance Officer
job.abstract: We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as VP, Equities Compliance Officer - Hybrid (Internal Job Title: Complianc...
job.content:
Whether you’re at the start of your career or looking to discover your next adventure, your story begins here.  At Citi, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your skills and make a difference at one of the world’s most global banks.  We’re fully committed to supporting your growth and development from the start with extensive on-the-job training and exposure to senior leaders, as well as more traditional learning.  You’ll also have the chance to give back and make a positive impact where we live and work through volunteerism.

Shape your Career with Citi

Citi’s Global Legal Affairs and Compliance(GLAC) empowers and protects Citi by providing legal, compliance, investigative, and security services to our firm.  We manage compliance risk, provide legal analysis and advice, protect Citi’s people and businesses, advocate for legal and regulatory outcomes that benefit our firm and our clients, and ultimately promote behavior that is consistent with Citi’s mission and culture.

We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as VP, Equities Compliance Officer - Hybrid (Internal Job Title: Compliance Product Officer - C13) based in Central, Hong Kong. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well-being to help plan for your future.  For instance:

Position summary:

Serves as an Equities compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM) responsible for assisting with internal strategies, policies, procedures, processes, and programs to prevent violations of law, rule, or regulation and design and deliver a risk management framework that maintains risk levels within the firm's risk appetite and protect the franchise. In addition, engages with the ICRM Product and Function coverage teams, in order to partner to develop and apply CRM program solutions that meet the function/business/product and customer needs in a manner consistent with the Citi program framework. Primary responsibilities include monitoring compliance risk behaviors and providing day-to-day Compliance advice relating to the supported function/business/product and guidance on function/business/product rules/laws and interpretation on internal policies and procedures


In this role, you’re expected to:

  • Assisting in the design, development, delivery and maintenance of best-in-class Compliance programs, policies and practices for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM), especially on Asia Cash Equities.

  • Providing guidance on rules and regulations relating to function/business/product issues, as well as, provide transactional approvals and interpretation of internal compliance policies.

  • Assisting with regulatory inquiries and/or examinations. This may include coordination with regulators and other parties.

  • Collaborating with other internal areas including: Legal, Business Management, Operations, Technology, Finance, other Control Functions, and In-Business Risk to address compliance issues which may impact the supported function/business/product.

  • Supporting the function/business/product in performing timely compliance reviews of new products.

  • Assisting in the development and administration of Compliance training for the supported function/business/product.

  • Researching any new reform rules and rule changes and implementing policies, procedures or other controls necessary to comply with the rules.

  • Additional duties as assigned

  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

As a successful candidate, you’d ideally have the following skills and exposure:

  • Knowledge of Compliance laws, rules, regulations, risks and typologies

  • Must be a self-starter, flexible, innovative and adaptive

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively and with people at all levels of the organization

  • Bachelor’s degree; experience in compliance, legal or other control-related function in the financial services firm, regulatory organization, or legal/consulting firm, or a combination thereof; strong working knowledge of function/business/product supported and the related operations and financial requirements; Advanced degree preferred

  • Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills

  • Ability to both work collaboratively and independently; ability to navigate a complex organization

  • Advanced analytical skills

  • Ability to both work independently and collaborate with team members

  • Excellent project management and organizational skills and capability to handle multiple projects at one time

  • Proficient in MS Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)

  • Demonstrated knowledge in area of focus

  • Relevant certifications desirable

------------------------------------------------------

Compliance and Control

------------------------------------------------------

Product Compliance Risk Management

Full time

job.title: Customer Care Assistant/Officer (Front Counter)
job.abstract: Maintain the daily operation of reception counter and support general administrative work
job.content:
About IDP

IDP is a leader in global education services established in 1969. As an Australian listed company, we have operations in more than 50 countries and our websites attract 100 million visits a year. We specialize in combining human expertise with our leading digital platform to help people get accepted into their ideal course, take an English language test or learn English in our schools.

About IDP Student Placement

Our global network of 120 offices helps students from 30 countries to study in Australia, New Zealand, the UK, Ireland, Canada, and the USA. Our highly trained consultants are by our students' side from the first course search until day one in the classroom, and beyond.

IDP is also a proud co-owner of IELTS (International English Language Testing System), the world’s most popular English language test for work, study and migration.

We are now expanding the team and looking for a high-caliber candidate to join our dynamic Student Placement services team in Hong Kong.

 

Job Duties:

  • Maintain the daily operation of reception counter 
  • Handle walk-in and incoming phone calls and enquiries 
  • Ensure the condition of reception and student area are at high standards at all times
  • Support general administrative work e.g. providing logistics support to meetings and events, data entry, and assist in some ad hoc tasks

Requirements: 

  • HKDSE/F.7 with at least 2 years of working experience OR an associate degree / diploma with at least 1 year of working experience in customer service or as receptionist is preferred
  • Good command of spoken and written English. Mandarin will be a plus.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Service-oriented, friendly, mature, and enthusiastic
  • Ability to work on Saturdays occasionally

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation: Double pay, Discretionary bonuses, 15 days of Annual Leave, Birthday Leave.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Medical Insurance and Dental Care
  • Work-Life Balance: Flexible working hours to accommodate your lifestyle

 

A competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered. 

Application:  Interested parties please submit your full resume with current, expected salary and availability by clicking “APPLY NOW”, or send to the People Experience Team at recruit.hongkong@idp.com.

Website: www.idp.com/hongkong

Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.

We are an Equal Opportunities employer and welcome applications from any member of the community who meets the selection criteria for the position.

bullets: Double Pay, Discretionary Bonus, Medical Benefits

paragraphs: IDP Education, established in 1969,is a world leading education consultant

in assisting Hong Kong's international students to find the right overseas study option for them. IDP Education with a global operation of 120 offices around the world offering student placement in Australia, the USA, Canada, the UK, Ireland and New Zealand.Over the past 50 years IDP Education has helped more than 500,000 international students realize their international education goals. IDP Education, Co-Owner and Official Test Centre of IELTS.We are a proud co-owner of IELTS (International English Language Testing System). job.abstract:
SAP FICO Consultant
SAP
Fianance and Control
job.content:
Responsibilities 

• Involved in end-to-end SAP project implementation 

• Gathering and analysing business stakeholders' requirements 

• Preparing the business blueprints 

• Designing key business reports and go-live activities 

• Leading upgrades, migrations and integrations to third party system 

• Managing SAP Project implementation. This includes gap analysis, configuring of SAP Functional Module 

• Documenting the solution design and functional gaps 

• Preparing the user manuals and providing training to SAP users 

• Supporting day-to-day SAP user activities 

• Works closely with technical architects to make the bridge between the business team and IT team 

• Assure the quality of the delivery and go live of the application 

Profile 

• Minimum Bachelors Degree in IT or Computer Science 

• Minimum 6-7years of SAP Experience 

• Hands-on S4 Hana experience mandatory 

• Certified SAP Finance Consultant 

• Deep understanding of SAP Functional Modules with hands-on experience 

• Minimum 3 End to End Implementation cycles 

• Strong integration working experience with other SAP modules 

• Handle SAP project design, testing, training implementation 

• Has done both support and implementation 

• Experience in regional template roll-out 

• Strong Business knowledge and ability to interact with business users 

• Good communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills. Mandarin language is an added advantage. 

• Independent with strong analytical skills and ability to work under pressure 

• Overseas travelling may be required depending on project requirements

 

About VISEO:
VISEO is a Global Technology Company established in 1999 with HQ located in France. The Singapore office serves as VISEO Asia Pacific Japan (APJ) headquarters, with additional offices in Australia (Brisbane, Melbourne, Sydney), China (Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen), Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia, Philippines (Cebu, Manila), to address projects in the region. VISEO uses technology as a powerful lever of transformation and innovation to help its clients take advantage of digital opportunities, address new uses and compete with new players who change the rules of the game. With more than 2,700 employees globally, our worldwide presence best meets clients' needs through supporting global roll-outs. If you are interested in joining us, VISEO ensures the development of your skills by having regular exchanges with peers, coaching by a technical mentor, and official certification with our partners, such as but not limited to: SAP, Salesforce.com and Commerce Cloud, Docker, Azure, AWS, Anaplan, Cegid etc. In addition, you will have fun while challenging yourself, participating in agile projects, external events and conferences, and internal technical communities, which will contribute to your career growth!

job.title: Assistance Audio & Visual Producer (Video Patrol & Operation)
job.abstract: Control the New Video Patrol Sync. Play system (NVPSS) at the racecourses during the racedays.
job.content:
The Department

The Broadcasting Operations team is responsible for live coverage of horse racing in Hong Kong, production of related promotional video, formatting betting and racing-related information into TV graphic displays and documentaries for on-air at TV stations as well as display on the giant display screens and closed-circuit TV network at the racecourses.  Video Patrol Section in Broadcasting Operations is responsible for control the Video Patrol Sync. Play system during race day to support the Steward inquiry.

The job holder reports to Senior Manager, Broadcasting Operations.

 

The Job

You will:

  • Control the New Video Patrol Sync. Play system (NVPSS) at the racecourses during the racedays;
  • Perform system checking and data verification to ensure the stability operations during raceday;
  • Perform the system check and support non-raceday operations such as appeal and inquiries;
  • Produce in-house TV commercial;
  • Ensure compliance with Responsible Gambling Policy (RGP) and all stipulated legal requirements pertaining to wagering, thereby protecting the integrity of the Club’s business;
  • Undertake other duties as assigned by Line Manager.

 

About You

You should have:

  • Bachelor degree holder;
  • A minimum of 5 years’ relevant experience in TV broadcasting;
  • Experience in motion graphics productions;
  • Priority will be given to those familiar with EVS system operations;
  • Hands-on skills in PC software e.g. Photoshop, After Effects;
  • Knowledge in non-linear editing system such as Adobe Premiere;
  • Good command in both English and Chinese;
  • Willingness to work on shift including on weekends and public holidays.

 

Terms of Employment

The level of appointment will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

 

How to Apply
Please send your resume, complete with expected salary and job reference by clicking the Apply Now button or to: 
Fax: 2966-5770
Mail: The Human Resources Department, The Hong Kong Jockey Club, 1 Sports Road, Happy Valley, Hong Kong

 

We are an equal opportunity employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the Club's notice to employees and prospective employees relating to the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance. A copy of which will be provided immediately upon request.

bullets: A minimum of 5 years’ relevant experience in TV broadcasting
Perform system checking and data verification to ensure the stability operations
Perform system check and support non-raceday operations including inquiries

paragraphs: Founded in 1884, The Hong Kong Jockey Club is a world-class racing club that acts continuously for the betterment of our society.

The Club has a unique integrated business model, comprising racing and racecourse entertainment, a membership club, responsible sports wagering and lottery, and charities and community contribution. Through this model, the Club generates economic and social

value for the community and supports the Government in combatting illegal gambling. In 2021/22, the Club returned a total of HK$33.6 billion to the community. This included HK$27.0 billion to the Government in duty, profits tax and Lotteries Fund contributions
and HK$6.6 billion in approved charity donations.

The Club is Hong Kong's largest single taxpayer and one of the city's major employers. Its Charities Trust is also one of the world's top ten charity donors. The Club is always "riding high together for a better future" with the people of Hong Kong. .

job.title: Business Development Manager
job.abstract: We are currently seeking a talent as an Account Manager to provide service management and support to company’s key commercial customers
job.content:
About HKT Teleservices

HKT Teleservices, a subsidiary of PCCW Limited and an operating entity since 1998, is a renowned leader in the business process outsourcing (BPO) industry. Our expertise encompasses a comprehensive range of voice and non-voice customer experience solutions, earning us prestigious accolades. 

 

With a global presence, we operate 24-hour, multi-channel customer care centers in Hong Kong and Mainland China, including Guangzhou, Shanghai, Beijing, Chongqing, Yongchuan, and Xian. Our expansive network allows us to cater to clients worldwide, delivering exceptional services and support. 
 

At HKT Teleservices, we specialize in providing innovative digital customer experience (CX) solutions. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and a highly skilled workforce, we offer support in multiple languages, covering over half of the world's population. 

 

With our unwavering commitment to excellence, we strive to transform customer interactions, exceed expectations, and drive business growth for our esteemed clients. Partner with us to unleash the full potential of your customer experience strategy and gain a competitive edge in today's dynamic marketplace.

 

Website: https://www.hktteleservices.com/

 

Your role:

  • To be responsible for providing service management and support to company’s key commercial customers
  • To work with different functional teams on existing project expansion and new business development
  • To identify new sales leads and potential new markets for business expansion.  Act as a focal escalation contact point to customers on all commercial issues.
  • To establish and maintain a close working relationship with internal functional areas and external parties such as service partners related to local and international services/products, service provisioning, billing management, complaint resolution, operations reports, and crisis management.
  • To monitor the Service Level Agreement (SLA), manage and deliver the projects within agreed schedule and quality.
  • To analyze current marketplace trends and competitors' activity.  Developing growth strategies and plans which focus on financial gain and customer satisfaction.

 

To succeed in this role:

  • Bachelor degree in Business Administration or related disciplines with at least 8 years’ working experience
  • Solid experience in business development, client servicing and account management
  • Customer-focused, result-driven and the ability to achieve business targets
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good skill in PPT and commercial service proposal writing 
  • Proficiency in spoken and written in both Chinese and English
  • Candidate with more experience would be considered as Senior Business Development Manager
