job.title: Sales Associate / Junior Sales
job.abstract: The Sales Associate will handle a diverse set of client engagements looking for storage solutions. The job holder will facilitate effective...
job.content:
Redbox Storage is seeking a highly motivated and talented Sales Associate to join our team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to manage a diverse range of client engagements and provide storage solutions to our valued customers. We are looking for someone who is passionate about sales, possesses excellent communication skills, and is committed to achieving targets.

As a Sales Associate, you will be responsible for effectively communicating with customers through various channels such as calls, emails, chat, and WhatsApp Business tools. Your primary goal will be to maximize sales opportunities and meet or exceed your sales targets. You will also play a vital role in maintaining an accurate and timely sales pipeline, collaborating closely with the Customer Services, Operations, and Marketing teams to ensure the best possible customer experience and achieve our sales objectives.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Engage with a diverse set of clients actively seeking storage solutions, utilizing various communication channels to provide exceptional service.
  • Maximize sales opportunities and consistently achieve sales targets.
  • Accurately and timely maintain sales pipeline and documentation.
  • Collaborate with your manager and the team to improve sales approaches and processes.
  • Conduct market research to increase industry knowledge and closely monitor customer behaviours.
  • Provide daily progress reports on your sales activities.
  • Apply different sales skills to effectively engage with your audience and increase won deal conversion rates.
  • Collaborate closely with customer service and operations teams to ensure seamless after-sales service and a superior customer experience.
  • Collaborate with the marketing team and provide feedback on successful customer acquisition and retention campaigns.

Requirements:

  • Higher diploma or equivalent.
  • Minimum of 3 years' sales experience, preferably in retail or telecommunications.  Candidates with less experience may apply for the Junior Sales position.
  • Strong desire to deliver exceptional results with great attention to accuracy and detail.
  • Self-motivated, independent, and possess a positive working attitude.
  • Eager to learn and possess strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills.
  • Customer-service and teamwork-oriented mindset.
  • Excellent command of spoken and written Cantonese and English.
  • Proficiency in CRM, pipeline management systems, and computer literacy (MS Applications) is advantageous.

At Redbox Storage, we value our employees and provide a supportive and collaborative work environment. Join our team and be part of a company that is dedicated to excellence in customer service and sales. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, as well as opportunities for growth and advancement.

 

Competitive remuneration package and benefits as below:

  • 5-Day work week
  • 14 days Annual Leave
  • Medical & Dental Insurance
  • Birthday Leave
  • Family-caring Leave
  • Study Leave

 

Job location: San Po Kong

Learn More About Us 
https://www.redboxstorage.com.hk

 

Company Overview

At RedBox, we believe in the power of enhancing living experiences. Our vibrant and innovative team is dedicated to pushing the boundaries to deliver exceptional storage solutions to customers. We're excited to welcome a new Sales Associate who shares our vision and enthusiasm for excellence.

questions: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Hong Kong?

paragraphs: RedBox Storage, an integrated Hong Kong Self-Storage business owned by Brookfield Asset Management since 2022. RedBox Storage is established in 2007 and it
continues to grow as a trusted and reliable provider of storage solutions to both consumers and commercial business customers.
Brookfield Asset Management has extensive expertise of Self-Storage sector since 2016. Its proven track records include having successfully transformed the

self-storage business in the US into a fully integrated institutional platform with robust talent base, leading technology and processes across its facilities, including revenue management and digital marketing.
The company owns and operates five modern facilities, strategically located across Hong Kong, in Shatin, Chai Wan, Yau Tong, Tuen Mun and Tsuen Wan, delivering
ease of customer access and space in excess of 400,000 square feet. Each is a large-scale facility enabling RedBox to offer a broad range of different-sized spaces to meet every kind of storage need.
RedBox Storage is committed to meeting and exceeding government compliance regulations and is actively championing even higher standards for the storage industry.
We are a Hong Kong business dedicated to serving the needs of local and international businesses and communities who live and work in our great city.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer/ Software Engineer
job.abstract:
Job Description
This role is exceptionally challenging because it requires both technical knowledge of electronics manufacturing and the...
job.content:
Job Description

This role is exceptionally challenging because it requires both technical knowledge of electronics manufacturing and the ability to communicate empathetically with internal and external parties. 
 


Job Responsibilities:
 

  • Responsible for full software development life cycle for embedded products.
  • Develop technical documents to identify requirements and solutions.
  • Design well-structured, traceable, and testable code.
  • Document and maintain software functionalities.
  • Enhance, debug, and upgrade existing products.
  • Perform R&D for state of art technology in IoT.

 

Job Requirements: 

 

  •          A proactive, collaborative team player
  •          Bachelor’s degree in electronic engineering, computer engineering, computer science or related disciplines
  •          Good command of English and Mandarin.
  •          Knowledge in electronics circuit and 16/32bit MCU and SoC application.
  •          Familiar with embedded C. Knowledge of C++, RTOS based design is a plus.
  •          Hands-on experience for below technical area:
    •  driver development in common wired interface e.g. UART, SPI, I2C.
    •  network protocols (e.g. TCP/IP, MQTT) and modern wireless standard (e.g. Wi-Fi, BLE, Zigbee, LoRa).
    •  GUI display engine and UX development.
    •  Scripting tools such as Python or batch.
  •          Some knowledge on cloud / app development is a plus but not essential.
  •          Fresh graduates will be considered as software engineer with training support.
  •          Candidate with more experience will be considered as senior software engineer.
  •           At least 2-3 years of relevant experience.

We place much emphasis on the career development of our employees, respect the worthiness of individual contributions and expect strong commitment to performance excellence. We offer 5 days work per week, competitive remuneration package and fringe benefits including year-end and mid-year bonuses, medical scheme, life & accident insurance etc to the right candidate.
 


Interested parties please send full resume stating current salary, expected salary and availability via JobsDB apply now.

All information received will strictly be kept confidential and be used for employment-related purposes only.

  • Proven success in driving marketing initiatives and solid experience in leading large-scale events / campaigns;
  • Have strong execution ability, result-oriented player, good team-player and co-working ability;
  • Excellent interpersonal, presentation, proactive, good data analytical and problem-solving skills; Ability to think creatively with an excellent business sense;
  • A creative thinker with strong business acumen - you excel at narrative driven content and love inventing fresh/interesting ways to tell stories; while understanding what compel our audiences to take action to drive business needs.
  • Fluent in both spoken and written English and Chinese, Mandarin is required
  • Immediate available is preferred.

Welcome QMAS / TTPS  / ASMTP Visa are welcome. More experience will be considered as Senior Manager.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. The information provided will be treated in strict confidence and be used only for consideration of your application for relevant/similar posts within the Magic Compass.

Applicants not hearing from us within 6 weeks from the date of advertisement may consider their applications unsuccessful. All personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be destroyed within 12 months from the date of application.

  • 较强的沟通和表达、演示能力；
  • 能操流利的普通话、英语、粤语

job.title: Pre-sales Solution Consultant (IPT/PABX, Cisco, Cloud UC, Collaboration)
job.abstract: Seeking a Solution Consultant with expertise in collaboration solutions for a leading cybersecurity technology company.
job.content:
About Our Client:

Join a leading, publicly listed company known for delivering cutting-edge cybersecurity technology solutions. Our client is seeking a skilled Solution Consultant to focus on pre-sales and collaboration solutions. You'll work with a diverse range of clients from industries such as retail, banking, healthcare, and more. Become part of an innovative and supportive team that values personal and career growth in a dynamic environment.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary with annual discretionary bonus
  • Up to 16 days of annual leave
  • A dynamic, inclusive work culture that encourages innovation and collaboration

Main Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with the Sales team to identify and develop business opportunities, focusing on collaboration solutions.
  • Analyse customer needs using a solution-based selling approach to deliver desired business outcomes.
  • Create and present high-quality technical proposals, conduct solution demonstrations, proofs of concept (POC), and provide test reports.
  • Manage and maintain strong relationships with customers and vendors.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree with at least 3 years of experience in IPT/PABX.
  • Cisco CCIE/CCNP Collaboration certification is preferred.
  • Proven experience in collaboration solutions.
  • Passionate about ICT technology.
  • Mature, proactive, and able to perform well under pressure.
  • Strong communication, teamwork, and presentation skills.
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English and Chinese.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience mentoring junior team members.
  • Hands-on experience with Cisco collaboration solutions.
  • Knowledge of contact center and recording solutions.
  • Familiarity with cloud UC/conference solutions.
  • Understanding of Microsoft Teams voice solutions.
  • Experience with audio-visual solutions.

If you're interested, please click "Apply Now" and submit your CV along with your current salary, expected salary, and notice period. We look forward to hearing from you!

job.title: Team Leader
job.abstract:
General Role

 To assist Boutique Manager / Assistant Boutique Manager in the daily store operations and manage a team of sales staff to...
job.content:
General Role

  • Assist in the daily store operations and manage team deliver quality service while achieving individual targets, identifying customers' needs, developing client relationships, and delivering post-sale services
  • Manage the store independently in the absence of boutique management
  • To achieve non-sales objectives (i.e., service provision and visual presentation of the store) in order to enhance customer satisfaction
  • To collect, analyze and solve customer complaints

Responsibilities:

 1)    Budget and Sales

  • Help to achieve annual and monthly targets, monitor and review regularly
  • Ensure the boutique reaches the target mix per product department and responsible for the sales of owned product department
  • Analyze sales data and provide constructive suggestions for improvement
  • Execute in-store incentive programs to drive sales objectives, evaluate results and effectiveness

2)    Stock and Process Control

  • Ensure the group procedures are respected and take necessary actions to avoid discrepancy or stock loss
  • Work with operation team on regular stock take and be able to explain discrepancies or irregularities
  • Identify best-selling, slow moving, aging and overstock items, and to propose concrete action plan

3)    Merchandising

  • Ensure the visual merchandise corresponds to the product's sales plan
  • Suggest visual presentation for improving the sales through of slow-moving items
  • Maintain shop display and environment in line with group guideline

4)    Store Operations

  • Be present in sales floor as shift leader to oversee store operation, assist team whenever required
  • Ensure store procedures are properly followed and smoothly operated
  • Handle all customer complaints and difficult situations
  • Conduct briefing session and act as Key Holders and a contact person in case of emergency
  • Propose recommendations to streamline and enhance operational process; eliminate administrative work and reports in order to achieve store optimal efficiency

5)    Team Management

  • Motivate and coach team member to achieve sales and non-sales objectives
  • Observe and review staff's performance with managers on regular basis
  • Build morale and foster team spirit, encourage open two-way communication
  • Monitor and manage the team to ensure enough manpower on floor to serve customers
  • Organize the team to brief other team members after their training session to make sure that all teams share the knowledge
  • Identify training need; follow-through team's learning and practices; ensure on-going applications at workplace

6)    Clientele Development and CRM

  • Support and coordinate company events to develop a closer customer relationship
  • Educate and convey brand messages to customers through different means
  • Ensure customer database management and proper daily handling: explore new recruitment system to increase customer database

Requirements:

  • Tertiary education or above
  • Minimum 6 years' relevant management experience in luxury retail or similar capacity
  • Knowledge of different aspects of shop operations
  • Great presentation, communications, and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical mindset and ability to provide effective solutions
  • Good Leadership skills and encourage teamwork
  • Curious individual with good problem-solving skills and eager to seek for challenges 
  • Proficient with computer skills and MS Office 
  • Good command of written and spoken English and Chinese (Mandarin and Cantonese)

 

Ready to join us? Apply now to submit your resume with date of availability and expected salary to us! 
 
All information received will be kept in strict confidence and will be treated only for employment-related purposes.

bullets: Competitive salary package and employee benefits
Solid people management and ability to drive sales

paragraphs: A creator, artisan and seller of high-quality objects since 1837, Hermès is an independent, family-owned French house that employs more than 22,040 people worldwide. Driven by its permanent entrepreneurial spirit and consistently high standards, Hermès cultivates the freedom and autonomy of each individual through responsible management. The company perpetuates the transmission of exceptional know-how through strong territorial presence that respects people and nature, a source of exceptional materials. 16 artisanal métiers nurture the creativity of the house, whose collections are presented in over 300 stores in 45 countries across the world, including 5 stores in Hong Kong.

job.title: Audio Visual Engineer - Onsite Support
job.abstract: Audiovisual Engineer, AV Technician, Banking AV
job.content:
General Description

We are seeking AV Engineer who can deliver exceptional support and services to our Financial Services clients while ensuring the installation, calibration, and troubleshooting of AV systems. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, maintenance, programming, testing, and supporting complex audiovisual systems. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure efficient and professional project completion. As we have multiple headcounts, we also open for junior candidates with limited experiences to gain the knowledge of AV products and operation.

Responsibilities
 

  • Deliver operational support and audio visual services to our banking and commercial clients
  • Provide onsite audio visual support service at client offices during operation hours and if necessary, work in different shifts as per client request
  • Coordinate, setup, test, and standby for client events including local presentation, video/audio/web conference
  • Install, calibrate, and maintain AV systems according to client specifications and industry standards.
  • Provide training and technical support to end-users, ensuring their understanding and satisfaction.
  • Collaborate with project managers and fellow technicians to ensure timely and successful project completion.
  • Stay up to date with the latest AV technologies and continuously develop technical skills.
  • Program and configure Q-SYS and Crestron control systems for various AV projects.
  • Configure and optimize professional audio equipment, including Shure and Sennheiser products, as well as audio consoles.

Education Requirements
 

  • Higher Diploma or above in AV Engineering / Hospitality or related fields Work Experience Requirements
  • Strong organizational and communication skills to coordinate with project managers and team members effectively.
  • Minimum 3 years’ relevant experience, with on site support experience is an advantage
  • Immediate available is an advantage

Key Skills
 

  • Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese (Cantonese and Mandarin)
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills, within the company and at all levels of clients
  • Team player, pro-active, strong self-motivation and enthusiastic
  • Able to work independently

job.title: Graduate Engineer / Graduate Trainee - 2025 Intake
job.abstract: 2025 Graduate Engineer / Graduate Quantity Surveyor Program
job.content:
Leighton Asia recognise that having dedicated training is a key part of building and managing a sustainable pipeline of talent for the future. 

Being a part of the CIMIC Group Graduate program, our dedicated graduate training program aims to focus on developing our future leaders, and provides graduates with comprehensive training and career development program through on-the-job training, job rotations, in-house, external continuous professional development seminars, site visit and activities organised through our Young Professional Club peer group.

We invite high-calibre graduates to join our 2025 Graduate Program in Hong Kong.

Graduate Positions:

  • Civil Graduate Engineer
  • Building Graduate Engineer
  • Mechanical & Electrical Graduate Engineer
  • Building Services Graduate Engineer
  • Graduate Quantity Surveyor

Requirement:

  • Degree in related disciplines
  • Strong communication skills in both written and spoken English and Chinese
  • Energetic, flexible and good problem-solving ability
  • Enjoy working in mixed cultural environment

 

Application:

Please submit your full resume, latest academic transcripts, academic qualifications certificates (e.g. HKDSE), other relevant awards/ certificates.

Come to join us and experience a fun, challenging and energetic culture.

We offer HKIE Scheme A Training, CPD seminar, professional training course sponsorship and study leave to eligible graduates.

For more information, please visit our Graduate Program page:https://www.leightonasia.com/en/work-with-us/graduates-and-internships

 

By submitting your personal data for recruitment purposes, Applicants understood and agreed that the Company may retain such personal data up to a period of two years for the recruitment of any suitable position within the Company.

Information provided will be treated in strict confidence. Applicants who are not invited for an interview within 8 weeks may consider their application unsuccessful for the applied post.

paragraphs: LEIGHTON ASIA, established in 1975, is a leading international construction company, delivers a portfolio of high-profile infrastructure projects throughout Asia, operations specialize in civil engineering and infrastructure, rail, roads
and tunnels, as well as building works.

We are a member of the CIMIC Group, one of the world’s largest leading international contractors and the world’s largest contract miner. Our Group Principles are Integrity, Accountability, Innovation and Delivery. Safety is more than a Principle, it underpins
everything we do.

As a leading construction provider, Leighton Asia is what it is today because of our people. Our people are the key asset driving the business. One of the Group’s highest priorities is to create a rewarding, challenging and safe workplace for all our people.
We invite high-calibre candidates to fill the following position in Hong Kong.

What you’ll be doing?   

 

  • Responsible for supporting and maintaining E&M Service within our corporate facilities.
  • Monitor the services which involve a wide range of system, including but not limited to air-conditioning systems, power distribution, UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply), fire service installations, etc.


     

Who are they looking for? 

 

  • 2-5 years of relevant experiences in E&M maintenance
  • Candidates who intended to apply for Grade A Electrical worker will be considered
  • Holder of Certificate of Registered Grade A Electrical worker in Hong Kong will be an advantage
  • Strong knowledge and expertise in air-conditioning systems, power distribution, UPS, fire services installations and related equipment
  • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work
  • Irregular shift duty is required
     

 

Why you should consider this opportunity: 

 
Our client offers an attractive remuneration package with fringe benefits to the right candidate, such as 

 

  • 12 days of Annual Leave 
  • Performance bonus
  • Medical Insurance 
  •  Birthday Leave

 

 

Working Hour: 

 

  • 5 day work week

 

 

Ready to join this role? Apply now to submit your resume with date of availability and expected salary to us!  
 

All information received will be kept in strict confidence and will be treated only for employment-related purposes.

job.title: Assistant Custody Settlement and Operations Manager
job.abstract: Perform daily securities position reconciliation, ensuring client positions correctly reflect external records.
job.content:
Responsibilities:

  • Perform daily securities position reconciliation, ensuring client positions correctly reflect external records
  • Ensure system exceptions are identified and liaison with internal and external clients to ensure any discrepancies are resolved in a timely manner
  • Daily reviewing of clearing house and central depository’s long and short balances. Arrange fund transfer between nostro accounts and settlement accounts when necessary
  • Setting up and maintenance of system static data, including securities, accounts, FX rates, fees, securities prices and other instruments
  • Responsible for day-to-day transaction settlement and corporate action operation on bonds, foreign equities, Hong Kong market stocks and fixed incomes
  • Handle business inquiries from clients
  • Participate in enhancement projects discussion and perform user acceptance tests on system enhancements. Working collaboratively with Fintech and system vendor to ensure enhancement projects are smoothly roll out
  • Ad-hoc project and assignment when required by your manager

Requirements:

  • Degree holder or above with major in Finance, Economics, Business or Banking related discipline or equivalent qualifications at HKQF level 5
  • Preferably minimum 2 years’ experience in global custody and banking operation
  • Good knowledge of securities market products and global custody operation including settlement and corporate action event cycles handling
  • Familiar with SWIFT, CMU, CCASS, Euroclear/Clearstream operation
  • Attention to detail, independent thinking and demonstrate problem solving skill
  • Willingness to learn and the ability to work to tight deadlines whilst maintaining a high level of accuracy
  • Proficient in computer applications (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, WPS etc.), VBA Macro skill is an advantage
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills with fluency in Cantonese and English, Mandarin is preferred
  • ECF achievement is the definite advantage

Candidate with less experience will be considered as Custody Settlement and Operations Officer

job.title: Manager (Strategic Risk Management)
job.abstract: To facilitate the review and updates of risk appetite, risk management policies and framework, and risk registers regularly when necessary;
job.content:
HKMC Annuity Limited, a wholly-owned subsidiary of The Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation Limited, is an authorized insurer to facilitate retirement financial planning through provision of annuity products in Hong Kong.

 

Job Descriptions: 

  • To facilitate the review and updates of risk appetite, risk management policies and framework, and risk registers regularly when necessary;
  • To provide support in formulating risk related advices to business functions, e.g. risk mitigation measures, controls, monitoring framework, etc.;
  • To conduct regular monitoring exercises on different business functions in risk related aspects; and
  • To assist in preparation of risk reports tailored to the requirements of relevant parties, e.g. the Risk Management Committee, the Risk Committee, the Insurance Authority and the Board of Directors.

Requirements:

  • Degree holder in Risk Management, Actuarial, Finance, Business or equivalent;
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in the field of risk management or related disciplines;
  • Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills; and
  • Well-organised and detail-oriented.
     

Candidates with less experience will be considered for the position of Assistant Manager.  

 

Interested parties please send your full resume starting your current and expected salary by 23 October 2024. 

 

Please visit https://www.hkmca.hk/eng/about_us/careers.html for other application methods. 

 

Please ensure that all information provided to the HKMC Group is accurate, complete and updated. Data provided which is inaccurate or incomplete may influence the process and outcome of the recruitment exercise. Please read the HKMCA Personal Information Collection Statement for Recruitment of Prospective Staff Members and Licensed Individual Insurance Agents at the HKMCA website before completing the application form. Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Candidates not invited for interview within 8 weeks may consider their application unsuccessful.

job.title: Officer, Tied Agent
job.abstract: NA
job.content:
AXA is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to promoting Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) by creating a work environment where all employees are treated with dignity, respect, and where individual differences are valued. We welcome and treasure diverse profiles to join our big family, and to build an inclusive culture together which allows everyone to maximise their personal potential.

Responsibilities:

  • Handle inbound enquiries from Business Partners
  • Prepare quotation to Business Partners
  • Provide quality services and immediate assistance to Business Partners
  • Handle ad hoc request independently
  • Provide sales support for the team

Qualifications:

  • Diploma/Higher Diploma or above in any disciplines
  • Preferable in insurance industry and/or customer services position
  • With solid customer service-related experience will be an advantage
  • Good interpersonal skill, self-motivated, independent and well organized
  • Fluency in Cantonese, English and/or Putonghua

paragraphs: AXA Hong Kong and Macau is a member of the AXA Group, a leading global insurer with presence in 54 markets and serving 105 million customers worldwide.

As one of the most diversified insurers offering integrated solutions across Life, Health and General Insurance, our goal is to be the insurance and holistic wellness partner to the individuals, businesses and community we serve.

At the core of our service commitment is continuous product innovation and customer experience enrichment, which is achieved through actively listening to our customers and leveraging technology and digital transformation.

We embrace our responsibility to be a force for good to create shared value for our community. We are proud to be the first insurer in Hong Kong and Macau to address the important need of mental health through different products and services. For example, the

Mind Charger function on our holistic wellness platform “AXA BetterMe”, which is available via our mobile app Emma by AXA, is open to not just our customers, but the community at large. We will continue to foster social progress through our product offerings
and community investment to support the sustainable development of Hong Kong and Macau.

AXA is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to promoting Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) by creating a work environment where all employees are treated with dignity, respect, and where individual differences are valued. We welcome and treasure diverse
profiles to join our big family, and to build an inclusive culture together which allows everyone to maximise their personal potential.

job.title: Accounting Manager
job.content:
Responsibilities:
  • Report to General Manager and supervise the day to day operations of a team of accounting staff;
  • Managing month-end closing, group consolidation, and financial analysis, statutory reporting, forecasting, management reporting;
  • Ensuring internal controls and compliance with accounting and legislative requirements;
  • Assist with tax computation annually; dealing with annual statutory audit, external and internal auditors;
  • Coordinate with the subsidiaries and group companies in all financial matters;
  • Assist in overseeing the internal control of the group;
  • Implement and enforce finance policies and procedures, tight controls and reporting system;
  • Ad hoc projects from time to time.

Requirements:
  • Degree holder in Accounting or related disciplines;
  • 8 years experience in finance and accounting;
  • Relevant experience in listed company is required;
  • In-depth knowledge in HK & PRC compliance regulations in such areas as tax and the HK Stock Exchange Listing Rules.
  • Professional qualification of HKICPA, ACCA or equivalent;
  • Fluent/Native in Putonghua and is a MUST. ;
  • Self-initiative detail-minded, able to work under pressure and tight deadline.
We offer an attractive remuneration package to the right applicants. Interested parties, please send your full resume with current and expected salary and availability by clicking “Apply Now”.

job.title: Supervisor / Assistant Supervisor (主任/助理主任) - Children Theme Park
job.abstract: 負責店鋪日常營運工作；處理店鋪相關諮詢，提升客戶服務和銷售水平。
job.content:
Responsibilities:

  • Supervise and support the daily operations of a brand new indoor fun park catering mainly for children and youngster markets.
  • Maintain safe and smooth operation for the children park including facilities inspection, ticketing and guest service, and any other work related to the daily operations of the park venue.
  • Handle inquires, resolve comments or complaints related to the park, uplift service and sale standard within the park to achieve a high-quality experience and repetitive purchases of customers.
  • Ensure a hygienic and visually presentable park.
  • Coordinating with event planner to operate programmes and charter activities inside the park

Requirements:

  • F6 or above in related disciplines
  • At least 2 years’ relevant working experience with minimum 1 years’ experience in supervisory/team lead level, preferably experience in theme park/fun park/children playhouse/entertainment centre
  • Good command of written and spoken English and Cantonese, computer skills in MS Office
  • Good at leading a team, excel in service, presentable, able to multi-task
  • Good at communicating with children and parents, and have love for children
  • Able to set a role-model to teammates
  • Possess can-do attitude, energetic, work pleasurably and is a self-starter
  • Candidates with any one of the following criteria could be an advantage:
  • Experience in: Theme park/Children Playhouse or Fun Park/Entertainment Centre/Ticketing or Cash handling/Claw and game machine/Children merchandise/Children activity and party/First-aid qualification
  • Passionate in children oriented entertainment business, and the eagerness to become a part of this fast growing business.
  • Candidates with less experience may be considered as Assistant Supervisor/Fun Team Members

Benefits & Others:

  • Flexible Working Hour
  • Discretionary Bonus
  • Birthday Leave & Gift
  • 10-14 days of Annual Leave
  • Group Medical

工作內容：

  • 負責店鋪日常營運工作
  • 處理店鋪相關諮詢，提升客戶服務和銷售水平
  • 維持樂園秩序，確保場地整潔及安全
  • 帶領團隊跟進現場活動事宜
  • 主管要求的其他職責

要求：

  • 中六或以上學歷
  • 具至少2年相關工作經驗，其中至少1年主管/團隊管理經驗
  • 一般的英文和廣東話書寫和口語能力，熟練使用MS Office
  • 具有團隊領導能力、客戶服務意識、能同時處理多項任務、做事積極主動
  • 具良好的溝通能力和人際關係技巧
  • 符合以下其中一項，可獲優先考慮：
  1. 曾從事主題樂園/夾公仔機/遊戲機/銷售兒童商品/兒童活動和派對等相關工作
  2. 具有效急救證書資格
  3. 能即時/短期內上班

job.title: Restaurant & Bar Promoters Leader (Beer)
job.abstract: Promotion Leader - 帶領促銷團隊, 為品牌和產品帶來更多關注和銷量
job.content:
我們正在誠聘有經驗的Promotion Leader加入我們的團隊！我們需要有能力的人才來帶領我們的促銷團隊，為我們的品牌和產品帶來更多關注和銷量。


主要職責:

  • 上班時間為14:00 - 23:00 (包括1小時15分鐘的用膳時間)
  • 管理和指導Promoters，確保他們按時完成任務並達成目標
  • 整合相關同事資料，每月制定Promoters上班時間表 
  • 每星期制定銷售報告
  • 檢查餐廳倉存以及向同事滙報狀況 
  • 培訓和指導團隊成員，提升他們的銷售技巧和顧客服務以確保符合品牌形象
  • 密切監控促銷表現，根據數據及時調整策略
  • 與相關部門密切合作，必要時作出調配確。確保促銷行動與品牌形象和整體市場策略一致
  • 主動跟進客戶反饋，協調解決客戶投訴和問題。建立和維護與重要客戶的良好關係
  • 參與制定客戶關係管理計劃，協助部門提升客戶滿意度
  • 根據報告結果，提出提升客滿意度的具體措施


我們希望你具備:

  • 5年以上的帶領促銷或零售管理經驗
  • 卓越的領導和團隊管理能力
  • 良好的溝通和協調技巧
  • 對行業充滿熱情
  • 靈活應變能力，擅於分析數據和制定策略
  • 對客戶服務和品牌形象有深入的理解


如果你認為自己符合以上要求，歡迎立即投遞簡歷。期待您的加入！

job.title: Senior Waiter / Waitress – Six Furlong [Ref No.: 20013521/ 20013839]
job.abstract:
The Job
You will:

 Deliver excellent food and beverage services to our Members and their guests in casual dining restaurant (Six Furlong)
...
job.content:
Our Catering Department manages one of the largest and most diverse catering operations in Hong Kong. We provide a wide range of catering, sports and recreation facilities for Members and their guests in three Clubhouses. In addition, both Happy Valley and Sha Tin Racecourses have numerous catering facilities used by Members, non-members and corporate organizations for a variety of functions.

本會飲食部於跑馬地及沙田會所、跑馬地及沙田馬場、和上水雙魚河鄉村會所，為顧客提供多元化及優質餐飲服務，現誠意邀請對餐飲服務有興趣及具備有關工作經驗的人才加入。

 

The Job
You will:

  • Deliver excellent food and beverage services to our Members and their guests in casual dining restaurant (Six Furlong)
  • Assist captain to ensure a smooth and efficient service in the assigned section of the restaurant floor
  • Keep the service standard at top quality and achieve high level of customer satisfactions
  • Maintain the high level of hygiene and quality standard for the restaurant
  • 於西式餐廳(六化郎)為會員及其客人提供優質的餐飲服務
  • 協助領班確保餐廳的運作順暢及提供有效率的服務
  • 保持高質量的服務標準從而實現高水平的顧客滿意度
  • 維持餐廳內高水平衛生和質量標準

 

About You
You should have:

  • 3 year's related fine-dining restaurant experience is required and preferably working in hotels & clubs
  • Good communication skills in both English and Chinese
  • Working location in The Hilltop in the Valley (Happy Valley)
  • 三年或以上於酒店/會所/高級餐廳餐飲服務經驗
  • 良好粵語及英語溝通技巧
  • 工作地點 –跑馬地會所

Terms of employment
The level of appointment will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

paragraphs: Founded in 1884, The Hong Kong Jockey Club is a world-class racing club that acts continuously for the betterment of our society.

The Club has a unique integrated business model, comprising racing and racecourse entertainment, a membership club, responsible sports wagering and lottery, and charities and community contribution. Through this model, the Club generates economic and social

value for the community and supports the Government in combatting illegal gambling. In 2021/22, the Club returned a total of HK$33.6 billion to the community. This included HK$27.0 billion to the Government in duty, profits tax and Lotteries Fund contributions
and HK$6.6 billion in approved charity donations.

The Club is Hong Kong's largest single taxpayer and one of the city's major employers. Its Charities Trust is also one of the world's top ten charity donors. The Club is always "riding high together for a better future" with the people of Hong Kong. .

job.title: Operation and Maintenance Manager (Ref.: M/25/0783)
job.abstract: responsible for chiller plant related facility management or DCS operation and maintenance.

job.title: FX Trader
job.abstract: We are looking for talented Forex Traders to join our dynamic prop trading team.
job.content:
KVB Group is an international financial services corporation with operations or offices in Auckland, Sydney, Melbourne, Hong Kong, Toronto, and Singapore.

KVB is a leading global financial services company specializing in providing Treasury, Liquidity Management, FX, and Payment solutions to financial institutions, corporations, and high net-worth individuals. KVB is also at the forefront of B2B payment innovation, dedicated to servicing our worldwide high-value clients with a strong footprint in the APAC region. Our B2B payment solution streamlines global financial operations, enabling businesses to seamlessly manage worldwide collections, foreign exchange, international transfers, and card transactions.

We offer a unique combination of international strength and flexibility that has helped propel our rapid global expansion and placed us at the vanguard of international global financial services. Considering our rapid business expansion, we would like to invite a professional candidate for this position in Hong Kong.

Are you ready to elevate your trading career in the exhilarating world of proprietary trading? We are looking for talented Forex Traders to join our dynamic prop trading team. If you have a passion for forex markets and a strong track record of trading success, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

  • Provide professional advice and services to corporate and/or wholesale clients on FX price quotation, and execute clients’ orders foreign exchange dealing.
  • Develop, test, and implement proprietary trading strategies to capitalize on market opportunities.
  • Monitor and analyze global economic indicators and geopolitical events that impact currency markets.
  • Develop strategic plans for business and client development to achieve the sales target.
  • Comply to all legal and compliance codes and regulations.

Requirements:

  • Degree holder in Business, Finance, Economics or related discipline(s).
  • Proven experience as a Forex Trader, preferably in a proprietary trading environment.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced & dynamic environment, well-organized and with strong interpersonal communication and people management skill.
  • Excellent strategic mindset with strong business acumen and broad business perspective.
  • Excellent command of both spoken and written English and Mandarin.
  • Strong PC skills in MS Office including Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

We offer 5-day workweek, career prospects and attractive package for the right candidate.  If you would like to take the challenge to stretch your ability and form part of our team, please send your full career details, together with your current and expected salary by e-mail to us.

For further information, please visit our website: http://www.kvbgc.com


Information provided will be treated in the strictest confidence and used only for recruitment related purposes. All applications will be destroyed after 6 months. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

job.title: Customer Services Officer (Hospitality Services/Call Centre)
job.abstract:
As an ambassador to provide premium customer services to members, VIPs and the public
1-2 years of relevant working experience in Call Centre
job.content:
About Us


A cutting-edge hospitality group crafting unique and consistent guest experiences. With headquarters based in Hong Kong, Leading Nation operates multiple brands, restaurants, private clubs, and bars across several key cities in Asia.

We manage a diverse portfolio of award-winning concepts, including The Diplomat, recognized among the Top 50 Best Bars, Cristal Room by Anne-Sophie Pic, overseen by the world's most decorated female chef boasting 10 Michelin Stars, and cult sensation WAGYUMAFIA. Driving our growth are multi-location brands like Mortys (American Deli), Mashi no Mashi (Wagyu Ramen), and Elephant Grounds (Lifestyle Specialty Coffee).

Our latest venture, Forty-Five atop Landmark, located in the centre of the city, stands as a testament to our commitment to innovation. This multi-concept venue spanning three floors and 20,000 square feet heralds a new chapter in Hong Kong’s vibrant arts and culinary scene, offering five stunning experiential concepts where art seamlessly merges with gastronomy.

We specialize in creating, identifying, and managing original F&B concepts across Asia. With a focus on collaboration with talented F&B professionals and landowners, we ensure that our concepts stand the test of time by maintaining relevance within the community. With recent expansions with the opening of Singapore Mashi No Mashi, we continue to shape the future of guest experiences across the continent.

 

Due to ongoing growth of our business, we are now seeking a highly motivated individual with solid guest services experiences to join our growing team!

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • As an ambassador to provide premium customer services to members, VIPs and the public
  • Handle customer enquiries and reservations via phone/email/WhatsApp with professional and timely manner
  • Clarify with the customers the details consistently about menus, dietary restrictions and celebrations well in advance
  • Update and monitor Seven Rooms booking systems meticulously ensuring details in: Tagging VIPS and regulars, building profiles based on guest preferences
  • Perform ad-hoc duties as required

 

Qualifications:

  • 1-2 years of relevant working experience in Call Centre (Fresh graduates will also be considered)
  • Candidates from top tier restaurant or hotel will be a definite advantage
  • Highly organized with problem solving and multi-tasking skills
  • Proficiency in PC skills
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Good command of spoken English , Mandarin and Cantonese

 

Benefits:

  • 8 rest days per month (after probation)
  • Annual leave & Statutory holidays
  • Marriage leaves, Maternity leave, Paternity leave, Compassionate leave, etc
  • Medical allowance
  • Staff discount
  • Performance-based Salary Review
  • Friendly working environment
  • On the job training
  • Excellent Career Exposure

 

Website:  www.leadingnation.com

Interested parties please send your full resume including PRESENT & EXPECTED salary and DATE of availability to the "HR & Admin. Dept." by clicking Apply Now below.

The information provided will be treated in strict confidence and be used only for consideration of your application for relevant / similar posts within the Group / Company.

Established in 2014 with presence now in Hong Kong, Guangzhou, Beijing, Chengdu and Manila, Leading Nation operates a collective of concepts. We create, identify and manage unique and original F&B concepts

job.title: IBDP Chemistry Tutor (Full Time & Part Time)
job.abstract:
IBDP Chemistry Tutor 
We are looking for qualified and driven tutors to join our team of educators.
job.content:
IBDP Chemistry Tutor (Full Time & Part Time)

We are looking for qualified and driven tutors to join our team of educators. We are looking for ambitious tutors who will provide our students with the academic training and real-life skills that are needed in the modern world. Those who commit to our team will get the opportunity to oversee the development of the next generation at a critical stage of their lives. We take this responsibility very seriously.

Job Description:

  • Preparing and teaching interactive lessons focused on allowing students to build a solid foundation within the topics specified in the IB, A Level & IGCSE Curriculums
  • Using a variety of effective techniques to allow the student to conceptualize topics and to enhance their learning such as preparing A* vs B/C sample responses and breaking down why one response will be marked higher than the others
  • Building great student/teacher relationships and being a helpful team member within the team
  • Using a variety of effective techniques to allow students to build up their exam-taking skills using past paper exams
  • Using the Socratic approach to ensure students are engaged and are learning effectively within the lessons
  • Assisting in the creation of proprietary course/teaching material to be used exclusively at All Round Education Academy
  • Assisting in analyzing past paper trends in order to forecast potential pitfalls students may face in achieving top grades
  • Providing clear and constructive feedback to students and parents

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree with a minimum 3.0 GPA
  • Excellent Academic background
  • Teaching experience in IB/GCSE/A-Level with a proven record of score improvements among past students is a plus
  • Passionate in teaching students, patient and creative
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Fresh graduates with impressive academic backgrounds will also be considered
  • High achieving undergraduate and/or postgraduate candidates who are still at university are also encouraged to apply in a part-time setting

Benefits:
 

  • Competitive base salary
  • Attractive bonus scheme and annual leave for Full Time tutors
  • Medical insurance provided for Full Time tutors
  • Training and development opportunities 
  • Wellness program for Top performers
  • Career development and progression

Locations:

Tsim Sha Tsui Campus

Central Campus

Online

Home Tutoring

 

Website:

www.allround-edu.com
 

Company Overview

All Round Education Academy specializes in academic tutoring for students following international curricula (including IB, GCE, IGCSE, AP), standardized test preparation (ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL), admissions consulting as well as programs specifically designed for young learners.

We value candidates who exhibit the following attributes:

  • Commitment: We are seeking individuals who can commit to joining our team until the end of the Academic year.
  • Location Flexibility: The ability to work at both of our locations is a key requirement for this role.

Job Types: Part-time, Full-time

Salary: $18,000.00 - $35,000.00 per month

job.title: Head of Claims - Insurtech Startup
job.abstract: OneDegree is a new generation of InsurTech that reimagining the industry with design and digital innovation. Our mission is to set new...
job.content:
OneDegree is an InsurTech company, with a virtual insurer license granted by the Hong Kong Insurance Authority in 2020 Since then, we have grown quickly into the leading Hong Kong virtual insurer with an ambition to bring consumers a seamless and instant insurance and claim experience through technology. We currently offer multi-line digital insurance products, including pet, medical, fire and home insurance for individuals, and cyber security and digital asset insurance for enterprise businesses.

Want to join us and make a change? We are looking for a Head of Claims in building great General Insurance (for personal lines’ claim, e.g., Home & Pet) that protect our customers and their loved ones!

If you love building winning claims related service, come and join our team!

 

 What you will be doing:

  • Manage a team of claim and hotline staff, to assess and approve new claims/complaint cases/complicated cases within the authority and manage customer expectations by offering flexible solutions.
  • Provide regular training and support to enhance the professional knowledge and standards of the team.
  • Work effectively and efficiently with cross-functional departments and external parties to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget and aligned with company strategy.
  • Ensure effective and efficient operation procedures and services are delivered in accordance with the Company's standards.
  • Provide recommendations and engage in projects to enhance internal workflows.
  • Coordinate and assist in UAT activities such as preparation of test plan, test cases, pre-UAT quality check, monitoring of bug fixing, retest progress, UAT reports and post-implementation monitoring.
  • Provide managerial advice and feedback to streamline procedures and workflow.

 

 What we are looking for:

  • 10+ years of experience in GI claim processing including 5+ years in managerial positions
  • Customer-oriented with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong sense of responsibility with a high level of integrity and trust
  • Good communication and time management skills
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel), and Chinese word processing is necessary.
  • Excellent command of spoken and written in English and Chinese
  • Strong team player, willing to learn, able to work independently and under pressure
  • Highly organized self-starter, capable of leading multiple projects to meet tight deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Candidates with less experience will be considered as Senior Claims Manager
  • Immediate availability is highly preferred

 

More about us: 

  • Fast growing Insurtech startup in Hong Kong 
  • Young and energetic team 
  • Flat organization structure 
  • Opportunities to grow and shine!   

 

 We value our employees - let’s check out what we offer 

  • 5 days work week
  • Performance bonus
  • 25 days of annual leave
  • Birthday, marriage, parental and new pet leave
  • Medical Insurance
  • Comprehensive training
  • Work from home policy

To us, people are our greatest asset and we are more than happy to invest in employees! We create a healthy work atmosphere and provide you with the tools and support for doing your job successfully. With a culture of flexibility and transparency, we believe there should be no barriers, and everyone’s contributions matter.



We would like to be an ‘EMPLOYER OF CHOICE’!
 

Interest in joining US! 

Please send a detailed resume with your expected salary by clicking "Apply Now"

(Not providing the expected salary will not be considered)

Some careers grow...
job.content:
Our client is a market leader of the financial industry in Hong Kong. It is seeking potential candidates to join its company.

Some careers grow faster than others. If you are seeking a platform where you can become a young entrepreneur, where growth and opportunities are unlimited, join us. 

We serve clients with comprehensive wealth management services to enable them to manage their finances and protect and build their financial futures. 

Now we are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an asset management consultant.

Principal Responsibilities

  • Understand clients' current and long-term needs and advise them on products and services to meet their financial goals
  • Monitor clients' investment portfolio constantly 
  • Conduct regular review to update clients on their portfolio performance
  • Build long-term relationship with clients and expand network

job.title: 产品经理岗 - 个人银行部
job.abstract: 合作公司和产品的开发及引入。完成供应商及产品的尽职调查，根据市场需求，遴选产品，制定产品销售流程及相关规章
job.content:
职责：

  • 合作公司和产品的开发及引入。完成供应商及产品的尽职调查，根据市场需求，遴选产品，制定产品销售流程及相关规章；
  • 定期检视：对不符合要求的供应商及产品进行下架处理；
  • 销售管理及销售支持：制定销售目标，完成销售培训，制作相关销售支持工具；
  • 产品收入管理：供应商合作管理，确认对接销售、收入数据，保持与供应商沟通；
  • 数据统计管理：制作数据报表，并及时录入相应系统；
  • APP以及系统:根据业务需要，上线产品并制作产品以及宣传资料；
  • 联动分行路演；
  • 部门负责人安排的其他产品类工作。


要求：

  • 全日制本科及以上学历，金融相关专业；
  • 具备3年以上金融行业产品管理相关从业经验；
  • 了解境内外特别是香港市场的债券类、基金类、结构化类、保险类或融资产品，宏观分析理论扎实；有销售推动经验优先；
  • 熟悉香港及境内金融市场，了解资产配置逻辑；有较强的专业能力；善于沟通，能够独立开展工作；
  • 具有较强的表达能力，熟练使用英语及普通话；同等条件下，持有相关从业资格认证优先。

job.title: Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.abstract: Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier - Wealth and Personal Banking
job.content:
Some careers prize diversity more than others.

If you're looking for a career where you will be respected as an individual and valued for the contributions you make, join HSBC and discover how diversity drives our success. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) helps deliver on HSBC's purpose of opening up a world of opportunity by providing our customers with borderless banking and world-class wealth management through best-in-class, mobile-first capabilities and exceptional people. Our international network and breadth of expertise enable us to support individuals, families, business owners, investors and entrepreneurs. Wealth and Personal Banking has four key business areas responsible for efficiently bringing the best of HSBC to our clients through a broad and relevant suite of wealth and retail banking capabilities: Asset Management, Global Private Banking & Wealth, HSBC Life, Retail Banking & Strategy and COO & Digital Transformation.

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier.

In this role, you will be responsible for working collectively with Premier Relationship Manager on developing and maintaining relationships with our Premier clients through active management of client portfolios and ensuring solutions continually meet with customer's needs.

The Assistant Manager, HSBC Premier is also responsible for attracting new customers by understanding their financial needs and delivering superior standards of service quality. The key to success in this role is having the customer centricity mindset, industry expertise and business acumen to deliver in accordance with HSBC's values. All these are unique in making your career journey different from any other.

Principal Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Premier Relationship Manager to develop and nurture relationships with Premier clients
  • Provide efficient, high quality professional services and ensure a consistent delivery of the Global Premier core service standards and proposition
  • Support Premier Relationship Managers to conduct customer needs activity planning and portfolio management to improve customer satisfaction
  • Promote HSBC Premier proposition for deposits and portfolio growth
  • Initiate and maintain effective communication with paired Premier Relationship Managers
  • Assisting Premier Relationship Manager on managing, developing and retaining quality client relationship
  • Identify opportunities for wealth and credit reviews to optimize portfolio performance and meet the needs of the customers
  • Understand and adhere to local and global compliance
  • Maintain the levels of operational integrity required by HSBC and adhere to the Business Principles and Values of HSBC

*Remark: Multiple work locations available across branches in Hong Kong, Kowloon, and New Territories

Requirements

  • University level education, preferably in finance, business or a related discipline
  • Proven frontline experience in customer serving at a financial institution
  • Excellent customer service skill and mindset, with strong attention to detail
  • Good knowledge of retail banking and wealth management products
  • Team player with commercial orientation
  • Clear view on how to work with Compliance, Credit & Risk and Internal Control to ensure a balanced risk operating environment
  • Holder of relevant insurance and investment licenses and compliance with related Continuing Professional Development (CPD) requirements
  • Fluency in both English and Cantonese, with knowledge of Mandarin is preferred
  • To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Hong Kong is required

You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.
http://www.hsbc.com/careers

HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

bullets: One of the world's leading international banks

paragraphs: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited is the founding member of the HSBC Group. Established in 1865 to finance the growing trade between Asia and Europe, it has become the biggest bank incorporated in Hong Kong.

The bank provides a range of personal, commercial and corporate banking financial services across Asia. HSBC is known in Cantonese as “Wayfoong”, which means “focus of wealth” or “abundance of remittances.”

job.title: Marketing Officer II (MTR Mobile Loyalty Scheme) (Ref:240001K8)
job.abstract: We offer attractive remuneration packages and diverse career development opportunities.
job.content:
Responsibilities

  • Manage the overall MTR Mobile loyalty hotline call center and its service provider, and other customer enquiries channels
  • Follow up the customer enquiries and complaints on MTR Mobile loyalty scheme with responsible internal teams and call center, and escalate the potential complaint case to management
  • Monitor the service level of MTR Mobile loyalty hotline to ensure the quality of service 
  • Coordinate with different business units to ensure effective operation of MTR Mobile loyalty scheme and provide supreme customer experience
  • Keep abreast of the applicable new technology to enhance the customer journey 
  • Participate in the MTR Mobile loyalty related enhancement projects and work with project team to improve the functionalities and customer experience
  • Evaluate the Management Information System “MIS” and performance from the loyalty campaigns

Requirements

  • Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or a related discipline
  • A minimum of 2 years’ working experience, preferably in customer service management, business analysis or loyalty scheme
  • Customer-oriented with good interpersonal and communication skills in both English and Chinese
  • Able to work under pressure, multi-task, meet pre-set deadline and manage ad hoc tasks
  • Hands-on experience in various software applications, such as English and Chinese word processing, Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint

Applications 

You are invited to apply online via http://www.mtr.com.hk/mtr_job_en or send in your CV stating the position (with reference number) you are applying for by mail to Human Resource Management Department, MTR Corporation, G.P.O. Box 9916, Hong Kong on or before 7 November 2024. 

For other job openings, please visit MTR Corporation's website for more details. All information provided by applicants will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purpose only.

All personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be retained for 12 months for future recruitment purpose and will then be destroyed.

paragraphs: As a growing multinational company, the MTR Corporation strives to connect communities through our railway network, property projects, various commercial activities and investment projects. Riding on our expertise and experience, we continue to grow outside of Hong Kong. Join us in building your career in our dynamic businesses.

job.title: CS Officer (Virtual Banking)
job.abstract: Banking, Call Centre, Virtual Bank, Back Office, Customer Service, CS Officer, Teller, CSO
job.content:
About HKT Teleservices

HKT Teleservices, a subsidiary of PCCW Limited and an operating entity since 1998, is a renowned leader in the business process outsourcing (BPO) industry. Our expertise encompasses a comprehensive range of voice and non-voice customer experience solutions, earning us prestigious accolades. 

 

With a global presence, we operate 24-hour, multi-channel customer care centers in Hong Kong and Mainland China, including Guangzhou, Shanghai, Beijing, Chongqing, Yongchuan, and Xian. Our expansive network allows us to cater to clients worldwide, delivering exceptional services and support. 
 

At HKT Teleservices, we specialize in providing innovative digital customer experience (CX) solutions. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and a highly skilled workforce, we offer support in multiple languages, covering over half of the world's population. 

 

With our unwavering commitment to excellence, we strive to transform customer interactions, exceed expectations, and drive business growth for our esteemed clients. Partner with us to unleash the full potential of your customer experience strategy and gain a competitive edge in today's dynamic marketplace.
 

Website: https://www.hktteleservices.com/

 

Responsibilities:

  • Handle customer enquiries in a professional manner via phone, email and live chat
  • Maintain good relationship with with customer
  • Maintain high-level service standards 
  • Welcome call centre background, hotline officer, general banking officer, teller and phone banking officer

 

Requirements:

  • Degree Holder OR Passed in 5 subjects in HKCEE/HKAL/HKDSE Holde
  • Call centre background, hotline officer is an advantage
  • Passed in IIQE Paper 1, 2 or HKSI Paper 1, 7 and 8  is an advantage 
  • Good command in English and Mandarin
  • Shift Duty
  • Working Location: Quarry Bay

job.title: Vice President, CSIS Lead Investigator
job.abstract: We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as VP, CSIS Lead Investigator (Internal Job Title: CSIS Lead Investigator ...
job.content:
Whether you’re at the start of your career or looking to discover your next adventure, your story begins here.  At Citi, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your skills and make a difference at one of the world’s most global banks.  We’re fully committed to supporting your growth and development from the start with extensive on-the-job training and exposure to senior leaders, as well as more traditional learning.  You’ll also have the chance to give back and make a positive impact where we live and work through volunteerism.

Shape your Career with Citi

Citi’s Global Legal Affairs and Compliance(GLAC) empowers and protects Citi by providing legal, compliance, investigative, and security services to our firm.  We manage compliance risk, provide legal analysis and advice, protect Citi’s people and businesses, advocate for legal and regulatory outcomes that benefit our firm and our clients, and ultimately promote behavior that is consistent with Citi’s mission and culture.

We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as VP, CSIS Lead Investigator (Internal Job Title: CSIS Lead Investigator - C13) based in Hong Kong. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well-being to help plan for your future.  For instance:

  • Citi provides programs and services for your physical and mental well-being including access to telehealth options, health advocates, confidential counseling and more. Coverage varies by country.
  • We believe all parents deserve time to adjust to parenthood and bond with the newest members of their families. That’s why in early 2020 we began rolling out our expanded Paid Parental Leave Policy to include Citi employees around the world.
  • We empower our employees to manage their financial well-being and help them plan for the future.
  • Citi provides access to an array of learning and development resources to help broaden and deepen your skills and knowledge as your career progresses.
  • We have a variety of programs that help employees balance their work and life, including generous paid time off packages.
  • We offer our employees resources and tools to volunteer in the communities in which they live and work. In 2019, Citi employee volunteers contributed more than 1 million volunteer hours around the world.

The CSIS Lead Investigator is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.

Responsibilities:

  • An Investigator will be responsible for the coordination and investigation of high level fraud matters and/or network security incidents
  • This role will utilize sophisticated expertise in investigative interviewing, fraud identification, loss prevention, network security, cyber enabled fraud, to identify fraud activities, schemes, trends and organized rings that create a risk to our firm, its employees, shareholders, systems, assets and clients
  • Conduct proactive, complex, variable and high profile/sensitive investigations with the goal of developing cases to a successful conclusion and providing timely fraud preventive intelligence to business and functional partners
  • Actively engage partners and management to ensure they are kept apprised of any significant changes during the progress of an investigation
  • Responsible for the recovery of losses through court ordered restitution, property or direct payment by suspects
  • Build external relationships with members of law enforcement, industry peers and other sources of support
  • Engage with internal and external suspects, witnesses and third parties through interview and interrogation, evidence collection and forensic examination
  • Represent Citi in criminal and civil court matters and have the ability to show knowledge and provide accurate and supportive testimony
  • Mentor and train junior staff members
  • Brief others on an ongoing investigations/investigative projects
  • Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
  • Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
  • Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.


Qualifications:

  • 6-10 years of relevant hands on investigation skills
  • Ability to conduct investigative interviews and recording techniques that tie the facts and evidence together
  • Experience investigating complex and variable case(s) that has substantial impact
  • Understanding of forensic and eDiscovery processes and procedures to include the collection, examination, and analysis of data while preserving integrity and maintaining a strict chain of custody
  • Experience representing/testifying in criminal and civil court matters
  • Conveys mastery of investigative concepts
  • Demonstrated report writing that would present the case and evidences gathered in a cohesive and comprehensive manner
  • Knowledge of financial products, frauds and trends
  • Previous US Intelligence, military, law enforcement, law firm or government service background
  • Experience working in an in-house investigations team
  • Professional certifications (CPA, CAMS, CFE and CFF)


Education:

  • Bachelors degree


This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family Group:

Corporate Services

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family:

Investigations

------------------------------------------------------

Time Type:

Full time

job.title: Senior ERP Business Analyst (Ref: JD/CSBA/04/2024)
job.abstract: Provide ERP implementation support
job.content:
The role:

  • Provide ERP implementation support
  • Collect business requirements from various users departments
  • Cooperate with internal IT team and external ERP & infrastructure vendors
  • Ensure seamless system integration
  • Provide ERP end-user training, documentation and technical support

 

Skills and attributes:

  • Bachelor Degree in Business, Accounting, Information Technology or related disciplines
  • Minimum of 4 years of full cycle Tier-1 ERP application implementation & support experience is preferred, especially in Finance & Procurement/Warehouse modules
  • HR system knowledge is an asset
  • Knowledge in project management, user training & support, MS office is mandatory
  • Working experience in ERP consultancy, process automation & application development & integration is bonus
  • Basic knowledge in IT infrastructure, reporting is an advantage
  • Proficient in both spoken and written English and Chinese
  • Good analysing, organizing, leadership, communication, presentation & problem-solving skills
  • Self-motivated, and result-oriented
  • Willing to learn & able to work independently

 

Applications, with detailed qualifications, employment history, salary expectations and contact information, should be sent for the attention of Assistant Talent Resourcing Manager, Citybus Limited, 5/F., No. 8 Chong Fu Road, Chai Wan, Hong Kong. Applications can also be e-mailed to careers@citybus.com.hk. 

 

 

Who are we?

Citybus is a market leading operator of public transport services operating over 1500 buses and employing over 5000 colleagues across our organization to serve over 1 million customers in the city. We are following our core value of “putting our people first”, we know that strong teams and high levels of employee engagement deliver a high-performance culture and a business that will deliver results. Therefore, we invest in our people and technology to provide an extraordinary journey to our customers where we put safety in the first place in the business. Having secured two new ten-year operating franchises to provide public bus services across Hong Kong and won the bid to operate new routes in the New Territories, this is an exciting time to join us as we head into a new chapter of our business.

 

Citybus is an inclusive employer, our team represents a diverse group of performance driven members with experience across various industries. Our goal is to transform traditional bus services with a strategic focus on driving the transition to zero-emission vehicles in an effort to support our sustainability objectives.

bullets: Bachelor Degree in Business, Accounting, Information Technology

job.title: Customer Service Executive - Toys & Material Division
job.abstract: espond promptly to customer inquiries via various communication channels, including phone calls, emails, and social media platforms
job.content:
CMA Testing, a well-known third party assurance body, specializes in testing, inspection and certification services. Worldwide networks have been spreading out rapidly to 12 global footprints locating in Asia, Middle East, Europe, North America. Our number of professionals is growing up while our service scope and service sectors are expanding. Being a HOKLAS accredited third-party laboratory and HKIAS accredited inspection body, we are serving every party within a supply chain of every industry with our total solution regardless of locations, meeting the testing, and inspection needs of manufacturers, traders and buyers around the world. 

 

CMA Testing also assists enterprises in upgrading and transforming to cope with the future development. With the emerge of new brand image, CMA Testing will develop diverse business solutions to respond to the needs of the market in alignment with the company’s new core values ; A Better World, Passionately Curious and Perfectly Scaled. In the coming future, CMA Testing will place focus on Technology Commercialization, DNA Testing and Green Finance Service.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Respond promptly to customer inquiries via various communication channels, including phone calls, emails, and social media platforms
  • Provide accurate information about our testing and certification services, pricing, and delivery timelines
  • Assist customers in scheduling appointments, coordinating on-site visits, and resolving any issues that may arise during the process
  • Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and transactions using our ERP & CRM software
  • Collaborate closely with internal teams to ensure smooth communication and efficient service delivery
  • Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and our service offerings to provide informed support to customers
  • Seek continuous improvement by actively participating in training programs and sharing valuable feedback

Requirements:

  • Diploma or above, science stream preferably but not a must.
  • Candidates with degree holder or experience in a customer-centric role, preferably in the testing and certification industry may be considered as Customer Service Executive or above
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a good command of written and spoken English and Chinese (Cantonese and Mandarin)
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively within a team
  • Detail-oriented, with excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Proficiency in PC Knowledge in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint & other PC applications
  • A passion for delivering exceptional customer service and exceeding customer expectations
  • Less experience will be considered as Assistant Customer Service Executive
  • Immediately available is highly preferred

We offer a competitive remuneration package as well as other benefits encompassing:

  • 5-day Work
  • Annual Leave
  • Birthday Leave
  • Double Pay
  • Group Medical Insurance
  • Education and Training Subsidies
  • Free Shuttle Bus Service

job.abstract: Talent Fields Hong Kong provides different services to the firm’s international client base through the provision of registered office and...
job.content:
Talent Fields Hong Kong provides different services to the firm’s international client base through the provision of registered office and related services in various jurisdictions throughout the world. The Payroll Specialist is responsible for payroll cycles, balances and reconciles payroll amounts, and verifies payroll data.

Responsibilities

  • Being responsible for the accurate preparation of the payroll inputs, such as new hires, terminations, and changes;
  • Providing end to end payroll processing and ensures employees’ payroll is processed in an accurate and timely manner;
  • Reviewing payroll reports including computation of pay and associated deduction, and reconciling them against payroll inputs;
  • Preparing required tax filings and other reporting such as statutory and third-party payments;
  •   Handle queries on payroll issues and client invoices
  •   Account Receivable and Vendor management
  •   Ad-hoc finance tasks
Requirements
  • A bachelor degree in related field. Fresh graduates will also be considered
  • Hands-on experience in payroll, ideally at least 2 -3 years' exposure
  • Good knowledge of the Hong Kong Employment Ordinance and related statutory regulations
  • Working knowledge of payroll practices and procedures
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft applications
  • Action-orientated, detail minded and organized
  • Able to work independently and with a flexible mind set
  • Responsible, independent, self-motivated, detail oriented and a good team player
